i7F2SpIgGPWta6ju-9HQlg.text: This place obviously doesn't need this review but I just have to share how impressed I was by this place. We stopped by egg works after finding it on Yelp. With all the positive reviews I knew this place would be good but I was in no way prepared for what I experienced. I'm from California and a bit of a foodie so I have had some great breakfast dishes. This place is no exception! I was blown away by not only the quality of the food but the exceptional service. Our waiter started right off by recommending some favorites. I ended up going with a carnitas breakfast burrito which I have never had. My girl went with biscuits and gravy. Both of us were totally blown away. Not only was my burrito perfect and amazing. But the potatoes(which I'm usually not super crazy about) were insane! The port in my burrito was super juicy and full of flavor. My girl was raving about her mouth watering gray which was the perfect density and full of flavor. I also would like to mention at how pleasant all the employees seemed to be working here. It says a lot about the management and the owners. There needs to be more restaurants like egg works! This will be our stop every time we go to Vegas.

3rHxpAVgRF4N5KWGA-7kNg.text: Great place to grab breakfast. The huevos ranchoes were amazing. Beat I've had in a long time. Did them with green sauce and scrabbled eggs. And a plus they have booze!!! With breakfast, OMG.

uIielb9sXT1g9BMD4uSwag.text: Donna was awesome and the food matched! We had a great breakfast and she made it even better. What a great spot for some homemade breakfast.

3jj9IHIicXQ5NV1trVVZGw.text: Had a amazing breakfast on Mother's Day. Our server Ashley H was very frendly and knowledgeable of the menu, reccomended the original Benny which was fantastic!

xXznfCu4rb36oRLpbQo-Eg.text: Awesome service from Ashley H! Friendly and professional. Best eggs and toast in town.

X0e4APYK7FaMPBS16qWeSw.text: We love egg works, they banana but muffins are the best !  I never had anything here I didn't like Donna was our server this morning and she  was very attentive. Hope u enjoy ur vacation Donna !! Don't worry work be here when u get back   It's easier to get a table during the week but weekend this place is packed, just a FYI

SxURLQalEy_IlZLDv1Likg.text: Great food great service. First time here definitely coming back on our next trip to Vegas. Thank you telly for the great service. Have to try the muffin.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MMluOtodl_B077AuDDQXEQ.text: Just off the airplane and needing to 'layer' for the impending Vegas adventure. Egg Works (Part of the Egg & I family) fits the bill perfectly. This chain of egg diners rises above mediocrity and serves some damn fine egg dishes. My rellenos omelet was delish. Friendly and fast service (assuming you aren't waiting for a table). What makes this place noteworthy is that you find yourself amazed that such solid food is coming out of a short-order kitchen. And, really, all my staff interactions were above and beyond friendly! Keep up the great work!!!

MnjdCIvY9rV27F7ecn-DgA.text: Donna is amazeballs.  Food is always great! One of my favorite places for breakfast and brunch!

iVSJn7UDhI1b_4wSKHGAJg.text: Typical American Diner. Not my cup of tea. Was edible not delicious. Service was so attentive it was almost oppressive. This is not the place to go for a quiet, relaxing breakfast. I had the veggie Benny and was disappointed, as usual. It still baffles me why Americans can't figure out hollandaise sauce. It's not that complicated people! Egg yolk, butter, lemon.

OhUpnrYPjLf0KOka6cOwOw.text: Family friendly, price is right for good food, and everyone makes you feel welcome!  Ask for Candice - she's the best!!!!

gQ3rUWcRHR-FuoQ_8M9-TQ.text: Second time and it was awesome! James was me and my pop's sever this time. He was great I recommend you sit with him hell treat you well. Was going to try something else but I went with the Sunrise Mountain again which was just as good as the latest time! See you soon Egg Works!

o-psRXla0niBId5BvIk77w.text: Everything was amazing! The only thing is, we were sat at a table. & for three different items I had to get up and take from the table beside me. The ketchup was empty, no creamer for my coffee, and no strawberry jelly. My server was really nice and sweet and helpful though!

SnBYHh1PV6dwMJnb9WntoQ.text: Visiting for the weekend and decided to stop here for breakfast before heading home.  My fiance had the 3 Pigs Omelette and he said it was delicious, "like a party in my mouth". I had the short stack with a side of scrambled eggs and the works potatoes. That too was delicious. At first it may seem like it's a bit pricey but when you see the portions, you'll understand.  Our waitress, Sarah, was great. Friendly, attentive and helpful, as was the rest of the staff. We are definitely coming back on our next trip to Vegas!

MUhA11MQOdXM5w-ttn3jqA.text: Everyone should sit at the bar because Ashley is such a cute, upbeat server!! 10/10 would recommend

aF3dULIMQtlfyJJVkC-m6A.text: We were in the area on business and were looking for a breakfast spot.  Saw the Egg Works had good Yelp reviews and decided to give it a try.  They have a pretty extensive menu from omelettes to crepes to French toast.  Food was really good and portions were generous, prices were very reasonable as well.  Best part was the fantastic service, our server Danielle (Dani) was very polite and attentive.  Will definitely go back

_X5TaPBtJE-xUwuBFf0vPg.text: I LOVE EGG AND I!!!!! They have the best customer service !!! My boyfriend and I used to go every Monday it got to the point the girl up front noticed I would wait for him to arrive from his Monday meetings. Lol they are always so pleasant, polite and always make sure were taken care of. Thanks guys for making our fresh Monday a great start!

zQsYKgNdv_IT3K1oRnl_cg.text: Do not miss out! this was the best breakfast meal that I had all weekend. I wish I had an egg works where I lived. The potatoes were well seasoned and the eggs were cooked to order. Dont miss out on the banana muffin either its delicious.    The service was great. Our server was brady, he had a great attitude and was attentive. He took the time to check in with us  to see how the meal tasted and to make sure we had everything we needed. The restaurant uses a yellow egg/black egg system that alerts all servers that some sort of attention is needed at the table. This is a very helpful way making the restaurant more efficient and an overall better experience. I will absolutely return and tell everyone I know how eggs-cellent this place is!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5gy0KuIQM0LeH2Bb7mHXZw.text: Brady the waiter had excellent customer service , always checked up on us, very friendly even though there was a bunch of us at the table he kept his composure. Overall just excellent customer service

ZwTGfsWevkHXMHae1V9o_g.text: I pop in here from time to time to enjoy what is normally a not so healthy breakfast.  I have tried some of the lunch items but breakfast...anything breakfast is my meal of choice.  On my last outing I tried a a bacon omelet stuffed with garlic mashed potatoes topped with cheese and dap of sour cream.  The happy egg, sad egg thing is no joke!    If your coffee cup runneth empty, or your need a side of hollandaise to liven up your meal, don't bother trying to flag down the busy servers.  FLIP the egg and watch them come a running.

1FVRSjLr5fc6wfWbP4-oQw.text: Before you get to order your food, you have to peruse their menus, and the idea behind it is ingenious. Menu in the form of a newspaper.. as reading the paper is synonymous with reading it while eating breakfast. Haha, clever :)  Many people come to this place for their moist banana nut muffins, but, I came for their seasoned potatoes! Something about the diablo seasoning = yum.   People from Hawaii: this is your breakfast place away from home. I mean, Vegas is Hawaii's "9th island", but it's still nice to see the local guys carrying on the spirit in the mainland. Our excellent server, PK, was from the island of Kauai. Very personable, attentative, and funny. Definitely a guy to "talk story" with. He is such a great person/server that it wasn't a surprise to overhear a host tell him that another patron requested to be served by him. And the nice cashier was from my hometown of Ewa Beach, Oahu.   The service and food is consistently great each time my family and I come here, and I recommend my friends to try out this place for breakfast, whenever I find out they're traveling to Vegas. Make sure to ask for PK as your server!

jewRs0MWvK-rTADjtvvq1A.text: I love this place! I've been here more times than I can count. The service and the food are always great!

BLiybRbyAC06k6t4ayNE_w.text: Great breakfast place. Corned Beef hash is the freshest I've ever had, bacon & onion skillet was perfect. Ask for the banana nut muffin grilled, tasty!

o9Qru82Kn-MuJ1GO3ybWXg.text: Amazing service and breakfast! Christopher was our server and he was helpful and attentive. The country fried steak was amazing and so was the bacon avocado omelet! But the banana muffins were by far the best part of the meal!

y_OHFJKRjhgqGywiQHvNfQ.text: Visiting from Oregon this place was fantastic. I would totally go back. Service was great. The server was fast and very friendly. The food was yummy and plentiful. You could eat as healthy or unhealthy as you choose for a general perspective. Really close to the airport but that's only about 10 Minutes from the strip soooo.... considering traveling half that distance in some southern Oregon towns takes 4 times as long...  it's not that bad at all.

n5p7rpoyYNSOF2gCZutCRw.text: I really truly did want to try Egg Works after having it bookmarked for so long. The parking lot had plenty of parking. We arrived mid-morning so we avoided the morning rush and were seated promptly. Looking around everyone was taking food to go so we opted to share an omelette and get an extra muffin with the Yelp check-in. I asked the waiter if this would be okay and she said yes. We ordered the works omelette as it seemed to have a little bit of everything.  Our muffins arrived and neither of us was impressed with it. Sure it was warm and the butter melted on it but the flavor I was expecting just wasn't there. Our omelette arrived and the portion was really huge. I was disappointed as everything was so chopped and mushed that you couldn't distinguish any of the contents and this we both found disgusting. The even more disgusting part is yet to come. When our bill arrived, we noticed we were charged for the muffin in addition our omelette. No big deal, or so I thought. Thought they'd take care of it when we checked out at the cash register but boy, I didn't think it would take a whole lot of time.  The cashier started to pull up our check and I let her know about the Yelp check-in. She proceeded to insist that because we ordered an "extra" muffin that's why we were charged. After explaining it she proceeded to ask the hostess if the Yelp check-in was still valid. If anyone should know these things, you'd think it would be the cashier who rings people up all day. Now there was a line of at least 3 people waiting to pay their checks and I could certainly feel their eye rolls over waiting during this whole ordeal. It wasn't the $2 muffin, but the sole principal that if you have something on your Yelp page, you should honor it. Lastly, they had to have the manager come over and remove it from our bill.   I'm not quite sure I understand the hype of this place. Come if you have an abundance of time to kill, but don't expect the food to be anything special. There are plenty of other places in the area that we've been to that rank way higher than Egg Works. Sorry, but unfortunately we won't be coming back here.  2016 Review #57

Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works omelette

f7SwxnKYO3CpWUyDZzqhMw.text: Just moved out here and tried this place for breakfast. This place is awesome. Bry was my server and he was constantly checking on the table and was spot on with customer service. The banana nut muffins really are not of this world though, they are too good. Steamed and soft. My new spot for sure.

h5QC6f1weN2qermhNuqvVg.text: If theres two things you gotta know about me is that I'm from California and I LOVE breakfast. Eggworks is really the only place I'll be eating breakfast at everytime I come to Las Vegas. The portions are good, the price is right and the employees really make you feel welcome. I always get the country fried steak and it is always cooked to perfection and they always put enough gravy on the fried steaks so I have never asked for more. There has always been a wait ever since I first visited but it is totally worth it. I really do recommend coming here if you are from out of town because it is worth it. Plus it's nice to really take time away from the Vegas Strip to have a nice meal at a family oriented restaurant.

CP1LFAAe-nPLaLjarD_N8Q.text: Services here was outstanding Christopher was our server...kids game is top notch...free muffin sir...hell yeah! Good coffee, had the Loco Moco...it was excellent...zero wait time and they were slammed! Did i mention Christopher was a rock star for a server? Yeah he killed it Thanks!

s1s315X_b_aBBVBohTHO0Q.text: I have eaten breakfast here everyday for the past three days. I am in town for a wedding and this place was early enough for this east coaster with some killer jet lag.   OMG I love this place!! Fast service, lovely waiters and waitresses, and just overall a solid place for food. I got the same thing everyday because I am typical and know what I like. I would get the veggie omelette. Everything was made super fresh to order which was awesome. The veggies always tasted really great and the way they made the food was clearly with love.   I would probably eat here 3-4 times a week if I lived here. They know what they are doing, the prices are right, and the people are great. Thank you for taking care of this early bird out of towner. I will be back if I am ever in the area again.

PXUmu9FEKVKNeVpO0CMpfg.text: Shay is an amazing server,  great at suggesting items and making our order just right. She has a smiley personality.

omfNfOWh14etmDdht5OIwA.text: Really enjoy the wide selection of breakfast dishes, the menu is diverse and includes many speciality foods. My new go to spot for breakfast. The service the last two times we've fined has been wonderful and friendly.

3fyMcY7Q7VYkQlg4KQwhxA.text: If I could eat the Habla Diablo potatoes for every meal, I would. Love this place so much! Gotta visit one of the locations at least once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham &amp; cheese omelet with my favorite potatoes in the whole world

nJgPNJws9kByJ172c8Mqcg.text: Stopped by while I was in Vegas. Was NOT disappointed. The only thing, the server took a while to take our order which is not what you want when you're STARVING.

La1Mf-GwiWnS4wvra3BrqA.text: Samm is a great server, she made some great suggestions on what to order! My first time here, now I know where to come for breakfast every time I come into town.

rGUrgZs9PwSaJkOzXq3ERg.text: I got the veggies omelette with fruits. The restaurant gave really big portion.  Their flavored potatoes are really good.  A lot of local come to eat in the morning. For a busy restaurant, the servicing was good and quick.  We enjoyed it!

Sra8vp6-LCg0IHFvwxeNBQ.text: You have to get the banana nut muffin. Best muffin I've ever had! Portion sizes are big so be sure to bring your appetite. There were so many options it was hard to choose. The place has a diner like feel but the food was more than just your neighborhood diner. Not greasy. Staff was pleasant and attentive.

tFOCWxHBPSmTBRhMbPEyRg.text: If you know me, you'd know that I'm always craving country fried steak! I found Egg Works and made my sorority sisters go with me. Everyone seemed to really enjoy their meal (: Not even 10 minutes later our table was filled to the brim with food! Needless to say we all go to-go boxes at the end.   I love that they give you the option between toast or their homemade banana muffins. (go for the homemade banana muffins!)  If you are on the way to Vegas or just heading home to Cali, I highly recommend this place as a stop! The price is cheap, the quality is great, and the quantity is bountiful!

El5z7cEF1twqVX2fTHSmmg.text: Waiting: Went in at 12:00pm on a Friday. No wait. Seated right away.  Food (Vegan): Ordered The veggie skillet without eggs and cheese. Added tofu and potatoes. Side of toast without butter and an extra side of avocado. Delicious! The potatoes are soo good. Whole meal was super filling. Last time I came here, they got my order wrong and service was slow and terrible. Glad it was better this time!  Service: Came with a party of 22. Excellent service this time and food come out pretty quickly. Waiters were attentive and fast.  Convenient, delicious, and would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JWWv2I53t2Sg13JoPm-Kuw.text: EGG WOOOOOOOOORKS.  I gotta give it up to them for their corned beef hash. It's pretty good. I wouldn't say it's the best ever, but it is definitely up there. I don't know why I chose to get scrambled eggs on it. Bad move on my part, but it was still amazing.   The banana nut muffin is OK. I don't quite understand how they're "famous" for it.   A friend of mine ordered some country benedict with gravy. I'm just not a huge gravy fan, and this stuff was just not working with me. It reminded me of those boxed gravies, which I cannot stand.

xCiJSfSILpMwCOTFBVK7jQ.text: Great food. Big portion size. The kids love it. I wish they stay a little longer so we can enjoy our brunch later that 3!!

pfSofeZi2mBqpn17hxQ9BA.text: This is the go to place for breakfast. Great food for great prices and they even have turkey selection for those of us that don't eat beef or pork

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works skillet ;everything has a turkey substitute

zv0Bv_nd3wMmy9frUdg8tg.text: Brunch is my favorite meal of the day, and finding good places to go while on vacation is one of my favorite things to do (besides, y'know...vacationing).  When we first got there, there was a little bit of a wait--maybe 10 minutes or less (which was surprising, because that place was PACKED). Once we were seated though, it took less than 10 minutes to get a server to come by and ask us what we wanted to drink. And not only that, but she was super friendly and not frantic at all.  I ordered the prime rib benedict (soooooo good) and my boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak (he loved it). When our drinks and food showed up, they showed up surprisingly quick, and with a smile. By checking in on Yelp, we both got banana nut muffins--and they were DELICIOUS. Overall, I'm really happy with this find.  Hey Egg Works, care to open up a few in Salt Lake City? :)

0oBaRhe7upxoIQrt4YFMlA.text: It's hard not to be a fan of Egg Works.  What you get here is pretty much what you get at the Egg and I (their other breakfast joint), Cracked Egg, and if you're in SoCal, Broken Yolk.  Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and when it comes this meal, I tend to keep it simple...just an omelet and some carbs. On my most recent visit, I had brunch with a couple of friends.  And for my meal, I had a 6 egg white omelet with spinach and mushrooms.  It was high carb day, so I had a bowl of oatmeal added to my meal.  The food is consistent and for egg whites, very tasty.  Oh yeah, I also had some turkey bacon that actually taste like real bacon.    As for their service, I'd give them 4 stars.  Keep in mind that this is one crazy busy Egg Works on the weekends.  This visit was mid-day and mid-week.  In other words, we were seated right away, got our food right away, and was out of here fairly quick.  Overall, you can't go wrong for breakfast at Egg Works, especially if it's consistency that you're striving for.    YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (487/500)

I got the Apple cinnamon pancakes, I don't always order pancakes because they aren't my favorite, but these were fantastic! My son was excited because they have eggs, spam and rice - we are from Hawaii so he was missing his staple food!! The best part Aloha shoyu!!! Overall great experience!!

GpEO7vHnMtNKv1qtBqs9EQ.text: It's ok, nothing special. Decent breakfast. I'm not sure for what reason so many people voted so high. I've had better breakfast in many other places in Vegas prices are an average to high for what it is.

UNF5lbfa8cLtbtrB3fjpiQ.text: This place is flat out the best breakfast spot I have ever found in Vegas.  Not too fancy, just really insanely good in an old school way.

tTjaPGlcOc9OOKqzBmNWLw.text: Worth the wait. Tables turn fast. Cincinnati Chili on the breakfast menu!  I lived in Cinti for seven years and have come to love it. This place did a pretty could job of coming quite close in taste.  The Greek scramble was even better.   Don't be fooled by the ugly retail plex, this place was great. Service fun and bloody Mary's tasty.  A nice stop for anyone visiting Sunset park next door.

VYeOMYKSM96MXbWtcEXDNQ.text: Eddie rocks!! This is the kind of service you expect from your server not the kind that think they are doing you a favor for showing up to work. Everything was perfect and too bad this place is too far from us because this would be a regular breakfast stop. There was an employee with glasses here that was singing everywhere she walked and that shows plenty of joy in the people she works for. Food was perfect and especially those banana nut muffins. This place has got to be making a fortune!! They are awesome from the moment you step into the establishment.

0SmpNfadv-BkJZ7VkzTAAQ.text: Came here for breakfast before a Rugby game with 4 people.   The wait time wasn't bad arrived at 11:00am and was sat around 11:15am. Our waitress was amazing she was so sweet and attentive. Our food came out after 20 minutes and was delicious with big portions. Their banana nut bread and bacon pancakes are a must try.   Side note, I love the fact that there is breathing room in this restaurant. They could definitely squeeze in a few more tables if they wants to but I enjoyed even sitting near a walkway that we weren't getting bumped into or felt confined.     Overall an A+, I would love to come back again if I am in the area.

_DMZYn1PWrHFtWA5fvxgpQ.text: Ok so I just googled eggs benidect,(to make sure I'm not crazy) Deff has holinday sauce. Sorta is what makes eggs benidect eggs benidect. When you take biskets and gravy put a poached egg on it that dose not make it eggs benidect nor should it be on the menu under eggs benidect. It was sorta my fault for asumeing eggs benidect came with holiday sauce, on the other hand it should be on the menu under biscuits and gravy. The fact that I was still charged for food I didn't touch made me mad, and they want to argue with me about what eggs benidect is. I just googled it, and what ever they gave me deff was not eggs benidect.

hfM7nSM1YhLhNP_AFF7hug.text: Service is great but they have their seasoning salt that is just too salty and over powering. Literally ruin the meal.  If they just lightened up I'm sure it would be OK.   This was my second time here also.

aSAW_N27i6AFl4vYWg1c2w.text: I don't know how the food is because we were waiting for over 20 minutes (we timed it at one point) and received no service. What makes it worse is that at least 3 waiters walked right past us, made eye contact and kept it moving. We didn't even get asked what we wanted to drink...   We eat at restaurants probably about 8-10 times a week and I can honestly say I've never seen something like this happen before. Its unacceptable and really disappointing since The location was so convenient.  Anyways, we made the drives to the Egg Works on Eastern and Sunridge heights and the service so far is amazing we have drink already and its been less than 5 minutes. The sunset location should be ashamed.

p5s4mROUfuNDCXfQGprnog.text: Good brunch. Egg-tensive menu. They even have Loco Moco. Be patient- the wait for food after order can take 15 minutes or more

j7B_M339wKkub_sdOn5hWg.text: Fresh food, fast and friendly service.  Ashley at the Sunset Road location was fantastic and very attentive.  Will come again!  Stopped in again and received exceptional service from Cris, also at the Sunset Rd location.

z1-NWWo60aqFqsZiHSdxvg.text: Awesome breakfast. The spicy breakfast potatoes are killer. The coffee is great and the staff very friendly and hard-working.

X6B7aNUeilcXRzLl3NGrKQ.text: The kids love it & the portion sizes are huge definitely a great place to share plates

ItoXMMU-SbJcC1kGB0TBJA.text: Just had breakfast here the food was delicious. The portions were huge. I ordered the veggie omelet with side of fruit also comes with banana walnut muffin. The ingredients in my omelet were very fresh and tasty. My husband ordered the great works omelet. My mother in law  had the turkey wrap. She was only able to eat half it was huge! The kids had scrambled eggs, potatoes and bacon. The kids didn't eat the potatoes too much seasoning.  I checked in with Yelp and got a free muffin to go! Lovely it was very good!  The kids enjoyed their free colors and fun menu.

8LB2Q8aSBAV4FtsdrtUInw.text: Cuisine was above outstanding. The atmosphere was very homie and the service was right on spot. Eden was our server and was very attentive.  We had the bacon avacado omelet and the chili rellano omelet. The portion was huge, each plate was big enough for two people.  The potatoes were seasoned perfectly, no ketchup required. We would recommend trying the Habla Diablo chili, it is great. This will be our breakfast place when we vacation to Las Vegas in the future.

KB5-MiVkrJkFj9sus17pxQ.text: Who doesn't love a great corn beef and hash?? Freshly made and delicious every time.. Saturday morning breakfast at the bar was delightful with Ash H. as our server.. She was bubbly, attentive and fun!!

PpBrAFUImjSCfagovIYiwA.text: Another visit to Vegas, another trip to Egg Works! This time I got the Loco Moco. I like that they give options on how to have the eggs- I got mine scrambled. Back at Cafe 100 in Hilo the eggs were usually sunny-side up, but I prefer my eggs more solid. Anyway, da bugga steh onoliscious lidat! My niece loved her mouse pancakes as usual. Thank you Cat for your great service!

gqYJnUxEQ5deJQMtF5xe5w.text: Great place for a tasty breakfast with plenty of healthy options too.  You gotta get the banana nut muffin.  Donna is a great waitress plenty of help when trying to order and she is a great server.

kGMc3fBcQDQyuql38UvZyw.text: Our server Candice was amazing. Would definitely come back just because the service was that good. Food was normal diner food. I had the waffle works, nothing too exciting.

Wnq7tMzVm0erXOkvPU3bJQ.text: Very good food with massive portions to give you tons of potatoes. Corn beef hash is excellent. The kids meals are massive.

hfbm21vf-cAB0is7QRujGQ.text: This is by far THE BEST place to go for a breakfast joint. It never cease to amaze me how great it is!  I LOVE IT.    Normally, when we come here its generally always packed with a 10 to even a 20 minutes wait time. (of course i wait) because usually it means 5 minutes less than they actually say and I would not go to another place.  If it it means I have to wait, then so be it! HA.  RATINGS (out of 5) 1: lame - 5:amazing! 1wegbFHVVi2Mn2Ew0drxog.text: I always come to egg works and am never disappointed!  Egg works has an extensive menu with tons of options for everyone! I have never had a dish that I don't like. Huevos rancheros, stuffed French toast, and their crepes are out of control!  I've always had a friendly server willing and ready to make our experience great!   Today, Donna served us. We've had her before and it's always a hit. She has a great personality, and always goes above and beyond.   We had a little bump in the road today. They brought out regular pancakes instead of the banana. Donna made sure to take the pancakes off our bill and also gave us extra muffins to take home. Btw the muffins are sooooooooooo good!   Whether you want to bring out of towners in for a great breakfast or you just want to have a nice breakfast or brunch with your family, egg works is the spot!!   ASK FOR DONNA!

rzGoVtc1syE8vgJhNGrCZA.text: Yay we love egg works! just wanted to remind you all that its still a great place to eat food is plenty the price is right and the service is awesome as always. Weve had the joy of having Donna theae past couple time and shes super attentive and wonderful thanks Donna.

AN-lpHODQZwgYRBxqZYjdw.text: I eat here at least once a month and I have never had anything I didn't like.  I introduced my parents and every time they come into town they stop here for breakfast and the chocolate mints.  Ash H. is a smiley, happy go lucky server that I highly recommend.

crMAWkkBmcBzGSckdI2RDQ.text: This morning I decided to try out Egg Works by my hotel because it had great reviews and I was not disappointed. The Biscuits & Gravy where amazing. I must say some of the best I have ever had. Trust me on this, I have eaten my share of Biscuits & Gravy. The staff were very friendly and Donna who took care of me was awesome!!  Thanks for a great breakfast and for the calories.

5CZPonjAVogROUyu1h7upA.text: Went to eat there today and had Christopher as our server.  He was very nice and attentive.  The food runner delivered the food and asked if we needed some Chlula or hot sauce for the meals.  My father wanted Chlula and asked for it.  She never returned.  Then half way thru the meal, our server returns with the check.  I really hate this.  I feel rushed and unwanted as a guest.  I also wanted to add a muffin to take home, but clearly he was done with us.  I love the food and most of the service.  Really, the check bring,  kills me.  If they need to go to break, fine, but he did not.

y4lmZMF1QVegFnTSm3E2rA.text: This place had the best food by far for breakfast. Excellent service, our server Candice was amazing she is super bubbly and helped up figure out what to get since we have never been here before! Food was great, definitely coming back.

q--tEjKTs5oJd2FyA0C_9w.text: Ask for Rosie! She is super sweet and takes really good care of us. She makes us feel so welcome that I can overlook the weak coffee. I get fruit or tomatoes instead of potatoes to cut down on evil carbs. I have only had breakfast and usually get the veggie omelet or breakfast burrito. Both are very tasty and big servings... The food is great.  The service is excellent!

6ONz6pMDL0d9CRUFnhD0jg.text: Love this place. We're from Chicago and make this a stop every time We're in vegas.  Ask for Donna, best server ever!

3zB44qU682BkMg49Rpv5Og.text: The service was outstanding! Thank you Ash H. For helping us enjoy an awesome breakfast too. The omelet was great, and served to order.  The potatoes were tasty, but had a lot of seasoning which may have had MSG, so I steered away from them. If you are looking for a sugary waffle indulgence they are loaded with whipped cream and berries which I am sure someone enjoyed thoroughly.

e30jb9QY-LQDPo247_U-ow.text: We were wary of Egg Works because, as an extension of Egg and I... well, it's just not the original, right?! Well, immediately on being seated Chelsea greeted us warmly, making us feel welcome. It's the same menu, but could it be as good?  I'm here to say, YES! The Ensenada Burrito (my first try) was awesome! Eggs and carnitas, mmm! What made it though was the sauce... a perfectly balanced tomatillo sauce, not too vinegar-y; very flavorful. The service too was spot on, with perfect checks of our experience without interrupting conversation (a pet peeve of mine).  We will definitely be back. Oh, definitely don't pass up their banana nut muffin! Delicious! Also comes in loaf form!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ensenada Burrito! Tomatillo-based sauce on top with eggs and carnitas inside.

-61R6HT_On7gXx6P5Ebihg.text: A nice place for breakfast. My pancakes were very good and of course the eggs aren't bad either. The here was phenomenal, very prompt and friendly. Cris, our server as very funny and engaging

-J1FCz4cKz92wukjVb8uDw.text: First time there. The food was very good. Service was incredibly fast. Seriously, it was back in like five minutes, as if they knew what we wanted beforehand. Donna, our server, was very nice and attentive.  One star was removed because water glass was not cleaned, as it had lipstick from a Previous user.  I would go back again, but check your glasses.

u2oNkfMFOVynestqAZ34XQ.text: Breakfast! Banana bread was awesome! Has Hawaiian flavors like loco moco and a few others SPAM.

rU3zfwO1hKFRo-ESRzfVwg.text: Probably one of my favorite breakfast houses in Las Vegas so delicious best eggs Benedict ever I absolutely love it everything is great even the service the food the muffins they give are so Good and yummy I would recommend this place

Yt7bWJSY45UHnq7N-MGNJw.text: Great food, easy location, amazing service. We came for a birthday breakfast celebration and Our server Shay was very helpful and sweet.  We ordered all sorts and loved all of it. Zesty buffalo chicken wrap, the muffins are amazing, country fried steak and eggs, mashed potato omelets, all of it hits the spot.

PRkCJc2E8BJ-PnJdRV3LHg.text: Great food. I came here with my family after getting off of a 5 hour flight and it wasn't far from the airport. Our server, Monica, was very friendly. There is a lot of food to choose from, and once we ordered, the food came in less than 10 minutes. The portions are a perfect size. Would definitely recommend the corned beef hash and pork chops.

oFsgNLGW4_biARuy2jaiJQ.text: Best breakfast on a sunday !! My pancakes were cooked good ! I like how they were good with delivering service

15Clhxs3BtxBJ4bIffPyrQ.text: Fast and friendly service! Hubby is a hash freak and said it was the best he ever had. I was so happy they had the option for real maple syrup. Definitely a rarity. I had the Harvest Grain pancakes, lots of nuts and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash and egg

TuXQIVKNTLsPiZyNIXXwLQ.text: Got off the plane after an overnight flight and headed straight here looking for some good breakfast to start our Vegas vacation.  We'd been to Egg & I up on Sahara before, so we pretty much knew what to expect as far as the menu went, but you never know how things will actually turn out at a different location.  We were not disappointed.  There was a short waiting list for tables, but we opted to get seats at the counter immediately.  Service was friendly and quick, and we soon had our orders in.  While we waited for our food, we were able to watch the goings-on behind the counter and in the kitchen - always fun.  Man, they turn around pans of those signature banana muffins like gangbusters.  I had the Works Skillet, which was pretty much everything you need.  Potatoes on the bottom, ham, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, onions, and peppers, covered in cheddar and jack cheese, and topped with two eggs (sunny side up for me).  The thing was huge, and I only finished about two-thirds of it.  I opted for toast and ate one slice.  If I had gotten the banana muffin, I probably wouldn't have been able to make it through half the skillet.  My wife got the mashed potato omelette, which she said she enjoyed.  It looked good, but with all that delicious food on my own plate, I didn't dare venture over to taste something else.  Just like at Egg & I, the coffee is really good.  I asked what coffee they use, but of course I forgot.  At any rate, it was something I hadn't heard of, so I'll bet it's something for food service that you can only buy in 20-ton packages...  Overall, Egg Works is a great place to go for good food, good coffee, and good service.  Going to make it one of my regular stops whenever I'm in Vegas.

4o9KxDMOj5JnOSK02NMRCQ.text: This a FANTASTIC breakfast spot. I don't think I can stress just how well cooked everything was. I came here with some friends (this place is definitely fam-friendly) for a quick brunch, expecting the a "typical" american breakfast. It was a pleasant surprise to get one of the best egg benedicts I've ever had! For the more daring, the turkey benedict with chipotle hollandaise sauce was also excellent.  Service was friendly and efficient; had out food out within 15min, and dirty plates out in 10. The relaxed atmosphere and cozy vibe invited us to stay longer and enjoy our coffee (it's nice when a carafe is left on the table for all to share). All in all, this is the kind of place that reminds you why breakfast is the most important meal of the day, and possibly can be the most enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The traditional benny with a side of fruit and a good cup-o-joe

JRjluow4A9RUX7xl_RY4YA.text: Seasoned potatoes and exceptional service are the Hallmark of Egg Works. The omlete's we had were hearty and super filling. Have been here twice now and their service stands out every time. Recommend for nice breakfast away from the Las Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian omelet

9RCo4HZyZHGOHX1ihsf-0A.text: PK is the man! Great food and great prices! First time eating there and I'll be back for sure! Aaaaaaloha

mOpl9fWbhBrc_bxLOc0sDg.text: This was defiantly the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. The wait was 25 minutes which was sooner than expected. Once we ordered we waited 50 mins for our food which was horrible. The manager came to our table apologized and said they discounted a percentage due to the long wait, I thought maybe once the food came out it was worth the wait.... nope! The food was nasty and cold I got the chicken and chorizo hash that looked like dog food and taste nasty my child's order was all wrong which the manager said she was going to remove from the tab when I told the waiter it was still on the receipt for 6.20 and she only removed 4.16 or so at that point I just wanted to get out. Never will be back I regret not waiting at baby stacks for the 45 min wait since I ended up waiting more here just for food that wasn't even worth it!

gkXP0NQKT2p134heUJU8Dw.text: First time to check-in yesterday (Thursday, 10/06/17) and certainly not the last. Friendly, courteous service. Highly recommended!  I ordered the Fresh Veggie Skillet. Onion, tomato, bell pepper, sliced mushrooms, fresh spinach, and cheddar & jack cheese. Side of seasoned potatoes. (Good for 2-3 servings. Really!) A dash of Chohula kicks it up a notch!  The coffee was robust and smooth. Bonus points for free muffins served melt-in-your-mouth warm.  Next time you're in Las Vegas and you're looking for a place for brunch, with courteous staff and reasonably priced meal choices, go to Egg Works at 2490 E Sunset Road. Look for Olivia. She provides excellent customer service!

Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The coffee is smooth &amp; robust. And free muffins? Bonus points!!!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My choice. Fresh Veggie Skillet Breakfast.

5a7JoQ9iiC49JBAjks-cXQ.text: WOW! Great food, "eggs"ellent service! My son, nephew, and I gambled on eating at a new place during our visit to Vegas... and hit the jackpot!  Our waitperson, Shay, went above and beyond. And the food was good enough that we got more to go! Thanks again Egg Works, FIVE+ stars for your product and for your people.

dwiwejJgI2S17IZWAaIKSA.text: I patronize at Egg Works often because i enjoy the food, atmosphere and most time the service but today was different. My cousins came in from out of town and i recommended this establishment because i enjoy it.   I gave it four stars cause our food was good and hot. The issue i have is our waiter was nice but she talked too much! We couldn't even really enjoy our food cause she kept coming to the table every 2 minutes! Yikes! They other thing was that they brought my cousin her skillet but never brought her pancakes. We asked what happened to the pancakes?? The waiter was like "oh let me go check" that was 10 or 15 minutes later but between that time she still was coming by checking on us.  I will go back but i just hope my waiter don't talk our ear off again. Sheesh!

SDJrqMBi23RJGZn6Sfe-_Q.text: Went here for brunch with the girls. Server was excellent, food was eggcellent and will definitely go back.   It's a really busy place so make sure you factor in a wait. They told us 20 mins but we probably waited 10 mins for a table for 3. We checked in so could get the free muffin and although only I checked in, our server offered each of us a muffin. We said we would share one muffin between us a s tbh, if we had one each, we wouldn't have had room for breakfast. The muffin is very flavourful.   I had turkey sausage eggs benny but there was so much to choose from, I think anything would be a good choice.

JCbFjfGdJcxeQBfnqSD4QQ.text: Great breakfast in Las Vegas near the airport. Definitely stop on your way in or out. Staff was super helpful and the food was delicious. No complaints.

Mku4h4iZlUv0RDMM38pY3A.text: Egg Works is a go to if you enjoy a great hefty breakfast with eggs in any way you wish my favorite thing is the potatoes side each plate comes with also comes with a side of fruits if you'd like. Always satisfied after eating here . Yummy  definitely recommend.

A5qclJTEks4o3D38_7MYaA.text: My family loves this place, great food, great atmosphere. It's adorable and everyone leaves full and happy!

CK9i7csuTavDCqzxrttqWQ.text: Great breakfast spot.  The portions are big and greasy.  Lots of protein options for me since I am not a pig eater.  Usually hard to find at breakfast places.  Service is always a little slow.  I love that they have a patio. It may just look at the parking lot, but I don't care I love to be outside.

VBtrHkJS_9yIBS2z42gqtA.text: This place has a nice and cozy feel about it. Went upon arriving in Vegas early one Sunday morning. The Yelp rating and review drove us to this place, plus it was 7:15A. Anyhow, the staff was very friendly and we were seated right away. The waitress was extremely friendly and helped explain what she was out of for the healthier options as we asked for a side of full protein rather than receive bread and potatoes. So if you're on a special diet or doing Keto like myself you can definitely find something to chow down on. I went with the Mexican omelette because I love chorizo, but the chorizo wasn't what I expected. It was tasty but more of a Americanized chorizo. It had hints of taco seasonings and reminded me of Texas chili. It was still tasty. For my full side of protein I went with turkey sausage. Turkey is bland itself but this sausage attempts to add flavor with a number of seasonings within. Not the best but not to bad. Although I enjoyed the meal I believe this place to be pretty mediocre.

UTzbK2GIle4xGMLEWj-4FA.text: I'm a biscuit and gravy snob. I grew up in the mid west, so the bar was set high. I am usually disappointed when I order b&g, but not here!  Great food, great service.

w-LSy_cCXtYaJ7ey_vFGDw.text: This establishment is a very good local place away from all the tourist. I have eaten at several of their locations and have yet to have a bad meal or service. Today Shay was our server and she gave us great service. She was friendly and Helpful. She even provided us with free muffins.

060ybO7o5EPc-78CRERsfw.text: I am giving this place the full five stars!!! Fruit was fresh coffee was good eggs were perfectly cooked and dog friendly for Real nice big patio and great toast

BcmKfjy-57q15YFvE827xA.text: BEST BREAKFAST PLACE!!!!!!..from Arizona and I wish they had one there!....very flavorful and ALOT kf food on your plate....Everyone very nice and helpful....will definitely come back when in Vegas!

JFB7gF_s1Iod8sxFQUBBRQ.text: Needed a breakfast spot before flying back home, but wanted something off the strip. Found this little gem on Yelp and we decided to roll the dice (pun intended). Boy was it worth the short Uber trip. The menu is huge, and very tasty. The seasoned potatoes were great. Service is awesome and the coffee tasted great. We now have a new regular spot when we visit LV. PS... order a banana muffin, even if you don't eat banana muffins.

69-ODykx8Y0II7BDYQDF9A.text: This was the best breakfast I have had in a restaurant in years! My chili relleno omelette was the best Mexican breakfast I've had outside of Mexico! The day before this we spent $50 on breakfast for two people at the Aria Cafe and had one of the worst dining experiences I have ever, ever had in my life. We paid under $20 for our breakfast at Egg Works and we're practically licking the plates! My boyfriends corned beef hash was really great and the house made banana nut muffins were amazing. Best breakfast I have found in Vegas and so cost efficient and family friendly. Link to my blog I wrote about our great expierence there. hungrymountaineer.com/20...

OQVZqlSxw95TyjkfpqJMXA.text: Bring your appetite as the servings are large. The sausage patties are really good but will give you your salt quota for a week. The favorite of all my family is the Coffee Cake that comes in place of toast with most selections. It is large and you can't stop eating it. You cannot go wrong here. But, recognize that on weekends and peak times you will have a wait. But, it is well worth the wait.

BFy8YGpU9YcVPQPi8IafvA.text: I absolutely LOVE egg works. I have tried so many different items (pancakes, waffles, omelets) and none of them have ever failed to meet my expectations. I am not a big fan of bananas, but the banana nut muffin is simply to die for. The bacon is cooked so perfectly, I could never.

u3VzC2ieXSfwzmVMqlIirg.text: First time in Vegas and we came here for breakfast. I was told I had to try it. I got country fried steak. It was AMAZING. They're fried potatoes are the greatest. Cajun seasoning  on point. Huge portions. Great service. Excellent food. Very comfortable, relaxed diner. Coffee was good, too, for being cheap diner coffee. Highly recommend this place for a top notch breakfast before getting wrecked and losing your money on the slots.

jAZLbFf2lTUKayeFd-6mdg.text: It is a amazing place and they always take care of my family that is visiting town. Nearby the airport

4eWuy_pa2RjIkqCtg5IE9Q.text: Ok just ate at egg works for the umteenth time. Ordered OJ for my 5 year old and a kids meal for $5.25. She finished her OJ and wanted a refill. Ok. No biggie. Wait no refills on juice. Ok so they charge a dollar or maybe a dollar fifty. Oh hell no. $3.35 for 6 oz of OJ for a kid. But they have no problem giving the all the damn soda they want. Waitress did not tell us it would be more the half of the price of her meal for a refill on juice. Then when I said something about it she said I know it is ridiculous that they charge that much. I said then why the hell didnt you freaking tell me it was that much.   Egg works can kiss my ass. Won't there again.  Thank you Ashly but I am not looking at getting anyone fired or in trouble for the businesses pricing. That is not her fault but it is management and the owners fault. Thank you for your reply.

v1xwb1mOfwiIy4aAuShozQ.text: Food was really good! Especially enjoyed the banana muffins and the loco moco! Definitely a place to go back to!

2FXyMB30dKTKkF0W59KuJg.text: Great breakfast place. Stopped by on a Monday and didn't have to wait but 5 minutes for a table. Service was great, really liked our waitress. Food was good but typical. Good portion sizes. Recommend.

KZGqRz4AceP4CuTbfX-sCA.text: A very mixed experience. The place was jammed but so big that we got seated quickly. Service was good. Started scanning pictures of various breakfast options on Yelp and was immediately distressed to see what were obviously frozen cubed potatoes heaped in ridiculously huge portions with many dishes. Ordered an omelet, which was absolutely top shelf. But it was served with a massive pile of the crappy potatoes, and they were as bad as they looked in pictures - very dry, clearly frozen, devoid of flavor (other than the "seasoning" they were coated in) and just.. lousy. And, my wheat toast had to be at least a week old - incredibly dry and obviously very stale. So odd for the side items to be so bad when the omelet was so right. Give me some fresh hash browns and reasonably recent toast, and this would have been a really great breakfast.

irlSdssAexxVba5PVNYjpQ.text: Great breakfast, country fried steak is wonderful, been here many times , always have to bring our out of town guests here. Great service, great food , at a good price, what more could you ask for. Here again 10/14/16 love this place, perfect service and fantastic food, never disappointed Here again in 11-11 still love this place. Eddie is our waiter , extremely professional and pleasant, he makes the visit even more enjoyable,  Here again , 12/29/16 our server Cris is so pleasant she is so attentive and is a great asset to this establishment, never , never had anything bad here the food is always great .  Another trip to the best breakfast you can have , I still give them 5 stars.
