vbpY1yqtekWXAqzEu9RjmQ.text: Best breakfast place in town!!!!! Service amazing... Nashay was so awesome!!!! Definitely coming back here for sure!!!

xdO6xJKwXo5b0YfZih2Amg.text: This place was super busy mid-morning on a Thursday but we were seated right away and the food came out hot and fast. The portions are huge and the price is reasonable. We were all satisfied with our meals and had left overs to take with us. Recommend for a nice breakfast/brunch that is close to the airport.

abR_cFwHtpMsyZTwpBaLfg.text: Amazing restaurant!! Highly recommend to anyone visiting Vegas! It was just a short drive away from the strip, and so so worth it!! The food was fantastic, the service was spectacular, and the egg-themed atmosphere was a real treat!

x7LyUVIoLE6K_VF443K3gQ.text: So amazing! I get the veggie benny with Chipotle hollandaise sauce instead of the regular one, & the other meal on the table is stuffed French toast! Yum!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dx-OTnPtcgDzQ0pTgl7qfA.text: Hidden yem! We found this place after an interesting night. The staff is extremely welcoming and the service is fast.   Donna our server took this experience to the next level! She was upbeat, friendly, and offered exceptional hospitality! The food was on point. We ordered a veggie omelette with avocado (as per Donna's suggestion) DELICIOUS!  We also ordered the waffle works. The eggs (on both plates) we a bit bland but the rest was very good. Quite large portions! Freshly brewed unlimited coffee of course! Definitely coming back next time.    We got 2 complimentary chocolate banana muffins as a first time courtesy.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary muffin
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly brewed unlimited coffee
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle works with turkey bacon

s0bo55UJs_mMMkqWkh1ZNQ.text: You should come here for breakfast or lunch or dinner or whater'e meal you want. The food is delicious, the coffee is bottomless and the service is all smiles.  Our waitress Candice was a delight from point one. She was attentive, helpful, and so nice that it makes me want to return tomorrow.   My one beef? The thick Texas toast is apparently for French Toast and not regular eating, since it was already spiced and whatnot, but it was still delicious. The corned beef hash is homemade and friggin delicious.   Thanks for the wonderful service, Candice. You rock!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R55hMgyg0lbWDIaK1xbrCg.text: This is a place you want to visit while you are in Vegas.  It's off the strip and well worth the drive.  The menu features a large variety of flavor packed options.  Loved the chorizo eggs Benedict.  Banana muffins and steak and eggs.

0NmOww-6HrmNh5Y-TLwyrg.text: Austin was awesome and the food was amazing!!!!!! I would recommend this place to everyone who lives near and has the pleasure of dining often of to the visitors!!!!!!!

bN3rS7aJ2nu7yM1RIvBJlw.text: One of my favorite breakfast places here in Las Vegas and its my sons absolute favorite

-6dB-Hx3SxFVHTSlHLjD2Q.text: Great spot for a locals home style breakfast. Good coffee, solid breakfast choices, and their potatoes are so crispy and tasty. If you don't wanna wait at Hash House, hit this joint up!

IaWuBIEe4DEW56UJ7B92Wg.text: We had an amazing experience for Saturday Brunch here. This place looks pretty unassuming as it's located in a strip mall, but the food and service was fantastic.   It was a 10-15 minute wait for a table but found 2 spots at the bar right away. We had the funniest and most upbeat server at the bar, I think his name was PK. He kept us laughing the entire time we were there. The rest of the crew was nice and they looked happy to be there! I ordered a mimosa - they give you your own little bottle of champagne with a side of OJ to mix yourself which is great as I only prefer a small amount of OJ. We also got 2 free banana muffins which were to die for.  And the food! So good! It came out super fast and hot. The veggie Benny was amazing as well as the Mexican omelette.   HIGHLY recommend.

AJO7j2SzZArCzjrysRQfQw.text: Yum! Lots of food and good value. The omelet is big, and you get hella fries. I didn't like the muffin too much and liked the toast more. This place reminds of Scramblz in the Bay Area. The service is great and I would come back again. I wish it was closer to the strip, but probably would be filled with crazy folks. This is definitely a nice friendly place to have brunch.

nC8Ce6hef8io64WiKZvfvw.text: 5 stars.. what else is there to say. But I will say this.. Donna is a 5 star server. Pair 5 star quality food with a 5 star server. What do you get??? A great experience...

5sS_92ohBDtnooG5AoGgFg.text: Went here for the first time for breakfast with the kids after landing in LV. Best decision I've made! We ordered the Santa Cruz burrito, kids grilled cheese, kids pancakes, and the breakfast platter and everything tasted amazing!!!!! Better than I had expected! Our server Ashley H was sooooo wonderful. Very caring, attentive, polite and patient. She checked up on us and made sure everything tasted good and if we needed anything else.  Would definitely recommend this place and the server!!! Oh, and the banana nut muffin was marvelous! So soft and warm!

c4w2kqqPRSOgFZBk44kXqw.text: There is a huge menu. Lots of omelets, crepes (crepes are made witha very thin layer of egg), waffles, sandwiches, and more. I started my meal with a banana muffin. It was large enough to be a meal by itself. Moist and very delicious. They accommodate changes in the menu items including half orders, egg whites only, etc. Service is  consistently friendly. Highly recommended.

k0SwnyCVmp4TF0BME3J8OQ.text: We wanted some breakfast close by.  We should have just drove to Omelet House!!!  Our server seemed pushy. Like she had a million things to do and we were holding her up.  We told her that we haven't been here before and instead of selling us their top dishes or specialties of the house, she just said "ok I will be back." Really!!!  Food is ok. Way better food and less expensive at other breakfast places. Hubby's chicken fried steak tasted processed. You can't make that fresh?  Server gave us our bill right after she dropped off our food. Even though you say "take your time", you might as well have told me to hurry and eat. I need that table!!!   Don't like the concept of the yellow and black egg when you need something. It makes the servers lazy and not work for their tip.  You still need to check on your customers even though they might not need something from the kitchen.   Food was ok. Worst customer service experience.  Sorry. She seemed new.  And if she wasn't, please help her!!!

t77AcdVqFxCJ-nlIvlFBWA.text: Great service provided by Candice. Food was great and well priced. Will definitely be back when in town.

6TbZgUWXN3CQORnbwE8AQw.text: Chris was awesome! We had never been here, and were a little distracted at the menu. He was very helpful and had great advice. He checked in on us constantly. Also the food was really good and the price was unbeatable!

OBuONPsEhMJis3OthmrRQg.text: Today was our first time at Egg Works. We arrived during the Sunday morning rush but we were seated within 10 minutes. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our waitress Danielle was kind enough to immediately bring a new cappuccino when we said it lacked flavor. The food came so fast we thought we stole someone's order. The decor is cozy and comfy like grandmas kitchen. We had The traditional Benny and the Ensenada burrito, both were superb! We will definitely be coming back as regulars. Great spot. The habla Diablo sauce is a must have. Thank you so much to Danielle for making the experience great!!

3WMm7s_i6i6y-iOEo98qVA.text: I visited Egg Works for breakfast one morning on the recommendation of a family friend. The menu had so many options to choose from and I went with the country fried steak skillet. It was fantastic! Donna, our server, was great and made some excellent recommendations for the rest of our party! Will definitely visit anytime I come to Las Vegas.

HhsoO_4zhWTK_6vFC407Og.text: Love this place. We have been coming here for years on the weekends. Food is always spot on. Service is great. It is busy on the weekends but worth the wait. We have moved to a different part of town but still come back to the one on Sunset because we love the staff there. Candice rocks.  Banana nut muffins are to die for. Warm with melted butter.

Oekd4li9xh4ixbGSTW3SCg.text: It's weird how things happen. I was reading the reviews about Egg Works on Wed and Thurs as something I really wanted to try on Friday. I didn't mention it to anyone at work but that's what they decided on doing for Friday lunch. I was actually impressed. Real spacious and nicely decorated barn look!? like the entrance to the restrooms. There's outside dining area, a kinda private room for large groups, a breakfast counter for solo diners, TV's, WIFI. Service was quick, it wasn't that busy because it was a later lunch. So it looks like most of their menu were breakfast dishes since it doesn't look to be open for dinner. Most of the dishes looked really good and were large portions. I had the Spinach Benny which was really delicious but didn't care for the sides, a slice of grape fruit and pineapple, with some Works potatoes. Server hooked me up with a pretty good banana muffin which I didn't order. Someone had the pancakes which seemed a good portion but heard it taste pretty basic. Others had the corn beef hash and some other really good looking breakfast dishes, I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu. I found a BOGO coupon online at Las Vegas Review Journal website lvrj.com and printed a bunch for our large group. They said they don't usually honor these printed coupons unless they come straight from the newspaper but they honor it this time. I'll probably be going to the other locations and see if they'll also honor the coupon or not.

h6n9wAX4aptmRInwyAIUjw.text: There are many breakfast places that serve a great omelette, but none of them have servers like this location. Everyone is friendly and professional. The waitress that really shines is Donna. She always has a smile and remembers our group. Her service is outstanding.

2IuPOJqRq9ZQL5SQE-dehw.text: We come here all the time and I love it. Donna gave us some great service  today. The food is amazing and the staff here are always very courteous. Anytime I have family come into town, I always bring them here. The weekends are very busy. Usually a 15 to 20 minute wait for a table, depending on the size of your party. But they are definitely worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food here is AMAZING! The serving sizes are huge

jUbJLWOEAX9DbdSlTre5Cg.text: Donna was a great server, happy and cheerful. No complaints!!  The atmosphere is more like a diner and not really our cup of tea. We both had the sundance omelette it was good, not exceptional. The fruit was old. The coffee average for the kind of breakfast place it is.   Would we come back? Most likely no. Why 3 stars? Donna is the reason for 3!!

qipCX7zUodskBgcojCjE-g.text: This is a hidden gem. Awesome food with awesome service.  All travelers should get off the strip and try this out. Thanks Rob!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works skillet

wsobG5c2qijqUh7LLzCq5Q.text: Good food.  Yummy, fast service after a short wait due to high demand.

dJU_r20tYl-oun9HvfE_NA.text: This was a great place to eat, the wait wasn't too long and they brought the food out really quickly! We had Ashley as a waitress and she was fantastic! She made great recommendations, was a lot of fun and helped us feel welcome. I had the skillet breakfast and it was very filling but delicious! They used a lot of cheese which I love. Highly recommend this place!

uFXlIf-LhQmqgWAQ5b4rzQ.text: The food here was awesome!  After a three week road trip this was the best meal we had.  Biscuits and gravy were perfection. Easy to get to, lots of seating.  The staff was very friendly!  Jamie was attentive!

35s9DbGO_x9GGqRETbBzyQ.text: Excellent breakfast spot!  Thank you for the wonderful customer service!  You must try the veggie omelette with avocado!

AW7IXMDLuxf8zp_W89KipQ.text: Man oh man! Where do I begin? If you like..... Scratch that, if you love eggs Benedict then please do your self a big big favor and order the Benedict here. It's was seasoned to perfection served along side potatoes that were crispy and delightful. This is by far the best breakfast I've ever had. The service was top notch as well.  Telly was our server and and she was on top of everything. Super nice and friendly. Overall just the best place I've been to for breakfast.

QZucPK3qJtFuaCnZHaWFhQ.text: This place was recommended by my husband's friend. It's a bit far from the strip but will worth it. This will be a must visit when coming to Vegas. I don't remember the name if the food of what we got but it was delicious.

NQIXbUAUJY1dBaA5mw2rmg.text: Good food and service. Adrienne was our server. She was nice. Portions seemed to have gotten smaller for breakfast, but not too much. Turkey bacon was a bit small and extra was a bit overpriced. Other than that, we enjoy coming here.

N3a8uaJWoQqZojQP5ktLMg.text: Good potatoes and bacon, scrambled eggs fairly dry. Nice hot sauce choices; much better than the usual Tabasco. Good service, and very reasonable prices.

H5E9MTuPYqT9In4aStlTnw.text: Great food!  The eggs were done to perfection. Most places can't do an over medium egg. This was just like the way I make them at home. Our server Candice was the best. Very attentive and friendly.

R2m9LBrspTdKmjx_Xjnrew.text: Large portion sizes. Excellent service - genuine friendliness all around. Our waitress Char was gracious and hospitable. At first, I thought this was a Mcbreakfast kind of place, given its location and fast casual service in a strip mall. The food is really good, of the homemade variety - especially the banana nut muffin - and the menu is varied and well-thought. It has a great reputation and I see why.

ZsbXMFOfeqovqcS2LE8k_w.text: I love this restaurant, I have been going to it for years. Overall the best service, sometimes the wait is long since they are always busy but definitely worth it. The potatoes are delicious and the banana nut muffin to die for. They also serve lunch and the sandwiches do not disappoint.

TACRDxXTwhpqFKD3tw-YhQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots and I just loved Donna she was amazing!!

CPMLjPI3kf4Od9q3_UzLEQ.text: The food was great and our server Perry was amazing! He will even help you with trivia

0xYMfy48nDBDZcylIBQAAw.text: Matthew our waiter took excellent care of us and really made it a great experience.  Of course the food was also amazing!  My wife had "The Works" veggie benny plate which she absolutely loved and I had them make me a made to order omelette with turkey sausage, avocado, Jack cheese and sour cream.  It paired sooooo well with the "Habla Diablo" seasoned potatoes!  The prices were super reasonable too.  We will definitely come back by whenever we're in town!

3confID8hnhe0cVhsWaaBg.text: Our 1st Yelp failure. MAJOR Yelp failure. So sad. Quite possibly the worst breakfast we've ever had!  Pro: Delicious Banana Nut Muffins. 1 son liked his eggs & bacon, but said potatoes were ok.  Cons: Corned Beef Hash tasted like mushy cat food. Are a few bites & couldn't choke down any more. Potatoes are odd & over seasoned. Husbands omelet was edible enough for him to eat 2/3, but he said it was just ok. Kids pancake wasn't even good. :/   Our kids asked if we could give it a "0" or 1/2 Star. 1 star is for the tasty muffin...which was the only enjoyable part of our $40+ breakfast.  Such a bummer!

DNdxOhSdV73k3g7Vkhzgfw.text: Excellent food, excellent service. Enjoyed Pumpkin Pancakes, Mexican Omelette & Bandito scramble. All 3 of us liked everything. Donna is best server. She's professional, Friendly attentive in just the right way & amount. Totally recommend

JjPkuq-slJnsnk39cy2vsQ.text: I ate here for the first time this past Sunday, and it was fantastic. Probably one of the best breakfast spots I've been too ever. The environment is casual and relaxing. I went in my onesie pajamas and there was no judgment so I felt good about it right away. Also our waitress, Candice, had a really fun personality and was super friendly and accommodating. Will definitely go back here next time I make a Vegas trip.

GioZxch-izcPhslqMJ3NWA.text: We had a wonderful breakfast at Egg Works and our server Ashley was the reason why I'm writing a review.  She was so pleasant and happily took our order again and again as we added things.  The food was great and a welcome change to the overwhelming choices on The Strip.

A_hfdbNOhW-TsEl_oRA6sQ.text: I was just looking for a nice spot to have a good breakfast while visiting LV. I noticed the good yelp reviews and decided to give it a try even tho it was in the opposite direction than the rest of my day. It was well worth going out of my way. Donna did a great job, was very friendly, pleasant and I was attend to with efficiency. Thank you Egg Works and Donna for an extremely pleasant breakfast experience!

R_S9IPHQUFoiSWLK2Z4CAQ.text: Sara was a great server!! Very informative of the menu, friendly with kids and she checked in on is regularly. Definitely loved having her as a server!!

i2Qgziz594gB8WbljojSjQ.text: In a word, amazing. Truly massive breakfasts to suit everyone's taste for a morning out. Don't miss it when in Las Vegas. Omelettes, crepes, Mexican, traditional, and much more at 4 locations.

SJ-3V1KJFzR72UzF-wEgEQ.text: Amazing home style breakfast. I come here every time I am in Vegas. This location is better than the Vegas locations. Some people might not want to drive to Henderson but it's worth it. The stuff French toast with sausage is my favorite.

eyXYRFQJhwTI-nekc5vLUA.text: Egg works was just as I suspected and up to my expectations of providing great country hearty style breakfast. To top it off Ashley was my waitress and she is awesome and was a delight to conservate with and beautiful to look at. See you next time Ashley, thanks!

uOrqvCQDsjE3JlO2XFOXAQ.text: Loved it everything is delicious starting from eggs to pancakes . Service is amazing .. Candice was super we loved her

CbWP46VduSDbpkcCSfXXbg.text: I had such a great breakfast here on Saturday I came back on Sunday. ..the service was great food came out fast...potatoes were a little salty but the muffin was the bomb

3kPJMxl9zGHTgjHx84uYqg.text: We love eggworks. The food is consistently delicious. They offer substitutions for everything, and that's great! The train that runs on a track that hangs from the ceiling keeps my kids entertained for the whole meal!

uzFKHwZePjV8Ju8t-fqQNQ.text: I'm not a breakfast person by any means but this place rocks!! Huge portions that 2 can easily share one plate.  The potato seasoning gives their crispy breakfast potato's such a fantastic flavor and their in house made carrot cake muffins and banana nut muffins are sinfully delicious and mouthwateringly moist.

oMk2uxBZxAp9SDhlpUCoNg.text: Great breakfast experience. Friendly service. Food was hot and fresh. Would definitely repeat.

x3rEfDSgsReUF-FkBhNZ5A.text: dont you dare go or even think about the possibility of even setting foot in this restaurant unless you want some of the best darn breakfast you've ever had. it makes me sick thinking of all the times i haven't had their delicious food when i totally could have. go somewhere else? i think not. you will be sorry if you miss out on their fantastic food. going anywhere else would be a serious waste of time and money.

M2Eb_mCLvqjN0CVHv0646w.text: We love this place!  (apologies for taking a few weeks to finally write a review)  Great menu, with a lot of options.  Recently, we started to get much more health conscious and more specific about our food options, so my wife asks a lot more questions about each item and what all is in it.  Every person has provided excellent service and patiently answered each question!  Thank you for that.  We greatly appreciate it.   On top of that of course is the quality of food.  Every meal has been outstanding.  We just found you two months ago, but we have been back repeatedly and will continue to do so!

Htg0B65m85Qg6IfY9M5SwQ.text: The food is awesome and Olivia was the best server! Very polite and attentive! She made my first experience great and I will definitely come back again when I visit Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-zHwQ-Lao0rwkUUHTjjHOg.text: Excited to eat here!!! OMG!! Their banana muffin is to die for!! I'm in love!! Lol holy sh!$$ soo good! Excited to eat my loco moco!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excited to eat here yummy!!

zKTboF1sUEeJxXQ-RASoBg.text: We got a Groupon for this restaurant. We went in it took about 5 minutes to get our table sat down ordered some breakfast and enjoyed our breakfast it was piping hot the whole entire time. Very good omelettes feeling delicious we will come back

lnHLEsMXpcng2v8qw-TZSA.text: The service here at Egg Works was amazing! Robin was on it and was at our table before we sat! My kids always eat the eggs here but not mine at home! Robin really helped make our experience here very welcoming and warm! Its a nice home away from home for breakfast. We usually eat at home but the service and food here is so good we are starting to want to come here more and more!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mickey Mouse pancake!

_vMs1J-chp_uUlRUe8B3mw.text: Food was Spectacular, Service Amazing. Egg works really has delicious food. THANK YOU EGG WORKS

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eKm0SHJUbMS_T6l0MIkydw.text: Eggs Works has been one of my favorite places for a long time. Country Fried Steak, gravy, and the Homestyle fries. You can never go wrong with this meal.

_Ek8rgETZQMke9ULh1K1pQ.text: Great food. Huge portions. Love the diablo potatos. Bought the seasoning and just made my own for breakfast. The wait can be long but well worth it. Used to head out to egg and i on sahara but this is our new favorite spot for breakfast.

mCg14Ev7xi0s-2wU0UhIew.text: I usually go to the sister restaurant, "Egg and I" but we decided to try this location.  Plenty of parking, and  I was really happy that it took only 15 minutes to be seated.  The location is bigger than the other one, and they seem to get people in and out.  They have plenty of TV's and, being Sunday, it was a great place to watch the NFL and have brunch with the family. Unfortunately I'm not into football, but I still enjoyed my breakfast: the pork chops and eggs.  Its 2, thin cut pork chops, cooked perfectly served with the home fries and 2 eggs, and toast, or, their muffin.  Knowing they have large portions, I opted for english muffin.  Stephen had the Cincinnati chili omelette and his mom had the Stuffed French Toast, which was stuffed with eggs and bacon.  HUGE.. where we took 1/2 of it home.  Overall a great meal, and even better that we had a groupon.  It beats eating at the Strip, and we dine where the locals eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cincy chili omlette
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chops n eggs
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast with bacon

9WCsQBuoXOtrqD6cYGNmiA.text: This place is awesome! We bought a groupon to try it out. So worth it.   Items bought: Loco moco with country gravy Traditional benny  Corned beef and scrambled eggs Kids scramble eggs and fruit With 2 banana nut muffins  All delicious!! Server was so nice and very efficient!

enwBEAiKLi7GB46GE_antQ.text: Breakfast was very good, service was very good too.  Add, they have a Bloody Mary mix which beats out many of the others brands I've purchased. They have me saying: Si "Hablo Diablo" Saving the one star for another visit. (I'm not local)

ci_aWJZm6rmEaQxqg09jvQ.text: We have eaten here many times, but never again. There was food on the wall next to our table and trash everywhere on the floor. There were 15 people in line waiting to pay their bills, and I waited 20 minutes in line to pay. The manager did not even say he was sorry for my wait.

kzON-Reizc7m3IznkDRJfA.text: My boyfriend and I come here at least once or twice a month. Always grey service and amazing food! I love that the portions are enough for two meals. The wait is never long even when it's busy. We will be back in a few weeks !

rxUAwW6UrSiw9YsRqU2lnw.text: Waiter was hilarious (Ray?) and offered suggestions. I got buttermilk pancakes with turkey bacon and scrambled eggs. The pancakes were fluffy and the turkey bacon was smoky, but they weren't anything spectacular.   The orange juice tasted like it was homemade. It was very delicious.   2 other people got corned beef hash (mashed potatoes, corned beef, eggs, side of hash) and they gobble it up. My sister got Portuguese sausage with eggs and sticky rice and raved about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with eggs &amp; turkey bacon

S-4gHAMHnRISfEH11seOoQ.text: If you're looking for a good, relaxed breakfast, this is where you go. It can get crowded, so try to go at an off-peak time. Waiting to eat breakfast is not fun. Went at 1PM on a Sunday and were seated promptly.  Stuffed French Toast was great, as was the Banana French Toast. I was really impressed with the Stuffed French Toast. A lot of places try this and fail. You touch the thing with your fork once and it falls apart - not at Egg Works. VERY WELL DONE HERE. Attentive waitress. Food came in a reasonable amount of time. Coffee was left on the table, which is great so you don't have to spend 1/3 of the meal trying to flag down the waitress.   An excellent spot for breakfast. Reasonably priced.

t8gEBO8wGg3gniXqJoH0nQ.text: Decent menu. Corn beef hash is average. Biscuits were the best part. The restaurant is not very clean. Average at best overall.

VKjMomnry91OCRY92bgMpg.text: Omelette amazing, potatoes amazing, toast amazing, service amazing. Egg Works is my new breakfast place. Donna was my server and really went over and beyond. Today was my first time and now I can't wait to come back and tell all my friends about it.

RlX4rqr0gQAlGhfObFoLFQ.text: Shantel did a great job of taking care of us! She recommended meals and was very friendly. The food was wonderful! Very large portions. We both had an omelette. I had the three pigs and he had the chili and cheese. The egg was cooked perfectly and both were great. The banana nut muffins were superb, very moist. Thank you for a great brunch :)

w1W3XVfHNxNT6uaxcC8e_g.text: Awesome breakfast. I had the Santa Cruz skillet.  If you are hungry and want a classic southwestern  breakfast it's very hard to beat this dish.  The banana nut muffin was also very good,  skip the toast and get this instead.

S-d9GTTpisETxgL8C5vqcg.text: Stopped here before catching a flight back home to TN. Food was PHENOMENAL and server was attentive. Been hearing about EW for a while and glad we stopped to try it out! Thank you Danielle for making my first experience here AWESOME!

9jCTlKcoBX3Kc42g1r8tUw.text: The chicken fried steak was the best I have had ever.  Well cooked. The service by Donna was outstanding and they were very busy.  Definitely go there again or at least one of the other ones if we are not on that side of town again soon.

yW2CtSrmkLg8L1Yu0wZFZQ.text: I had something called the 5 way. Boy it was big and good. We had a sweet little waitress. So sweet and kept an eye on us.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 5 way, so good.
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute little eggs with happy faces.

08t-sdL8huEQeqo8cot4Eg.text: Donna was great.  Very fun and patient.  We were waiting for another person and she was totally cool with it.  Food was great as always

T5TQq4fSm_rx4IqP0QgBYA.text: I try to come here every time we're in Las Vegas. The food is tasty, they have a big menu, and very reasonably priced. Most egg dishes have 4 eggs instead of the measly 2 you get at most places. Lots of TV monitors, very friendly staff. Can't go wrong at this place. And the banana nut muffins are pretty great too!

l_pX6eHbsEDCRFfAbNcYMg.text: Ashely was our server and she was amazeballs. She was attentive, friendly, and on top of her game. The food was delish, as usual. The restaurant was clean, patrons were happy, and staff was great.  When you walk in, make sure you ask for Ashely!!

j3xqjHKRdz2RpnNfcSjzUg.text: Second time here. Fast, friendly, filling. Decent prices. Ample coffee.  Will come back.

HIQqkLcGIMIXXLl_jK1ppQ.text: OK...there comes a time when you must have an Intervention with those you love. I guess its no different with the restaurant you love...and so its time for an Intervention.   No one...NO ONE likes your "works" potatoes, frozen premanufactured potatoes which are then fat fried and over seasoned...yuck. And then offering a substitute of McDonald's hashbrowns...or rice?  Good breakfast restaurants always have GREAT potatoes...please, PLEASE take a look at this!  You know what...we just decided between this and the "big" pancake policy - we are just going to find another breakfast spot that gets it. Good luck to you and your crappie potatoes!  BTW...nothing to do with the servers...they have always been stellar.

j23yPUE2PxW6X3eBCvuVcA.text: Every good breakfast joint in town will at some point have a wait, but the breakfast is worth it.  Large menu and efficient staff.  Try the French toast sandwhich!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food coma

ulxY7xwyiKWncacwttDlvw.text: Great breakfast hearty portions.  Nice way to end vegas trip. Wide variety on menu. Veggie omelet  HUGE and packed with veggied, couldn't eat half it was so big. Buttermilk pancakes  nice and fluffy we ordered 2 for the table to share.  Endless coffee a nice touch,  not greatest coffee but fresh.  Overall stellar food.

HXKdMITSrnq8_ZXmtB_60g.text: This place is cute! The food was delicious, they are very generous with their cheese and they melt it all the way though, as melty cheese should be! The portion sizes were just right. Our waitress was Chelsea, she was very perky in an inviting way, that makes you feel right at home, and she took very good care of us. I give it 4 stars only because it is no, "Hash House A Go Go." It is by far one of my favorite family owned restaurant experiences. The staff was the friendliest, they have unique & delicious food with a large variety on their menu, and are extremely clean. I live in Orange County but will definitely be back when I'm in town visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cinci rancheros Chili. Yummy, but a little on the sweet side for my taste. Nicely put together though and BOMB melty cheese!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast. Was yummy!

9sQCZ5_RhLFWFGoY18izww.text: Great food, cheerful atmosphere. My server Candice was very helpful. I've been here before and enjoy coming back whenever I'm in town.

11XE2mddW9yEvv8rL8YRIw.text: Egg works is the prefect place for breakfast. With so many options in the area for breakfast it was a hard time to decide where to go, but after checking that the resturant was zagat rated and had great reviews we decided to check it out. The atmosphere inside is fun with wide area with many tables and booths to sit in which helped with us getting a table right away, the service was great and you get a free in house made muffin if it's your first visit. The options are amazing ranging from omelets to French toasts so any taste can be satisfied. They have great coffee and offer military discounts, so defenetly drop in if your in the mood for great food.

44FlKdc2RMWA4s5DCUdxmQ.text: First stop in Vegas, had to grab the Stuffed French Toast and Donna is amazing! Definitely will come back!

yz5bu4juRyOtYQBXR2QKng.text: Chelsea killed the game as she served us with a smile on the counter table seating section. She was adamant on making our first experience something to politely share with others!

44nsHpv-Ni-QnQfWuCToKw.text: My husband and I try to eat here at least three times in the year. Ashley was very helpful and convinced my husband to try the day's special, which was delicious. Pretty much any form of the Eggs Benedict is amazing. Also, the banana nut muffin.... Take a whole loaf of the banana nut bread with you!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib Benny.

9BJ2YiHfYhR9pHiV5qzIvg.text: If I want to go to a breakfast restaurant to get satisfied AND full,  this is the place. Their skillets are really great. I ordered the "Works" skillet that included eggs, fried potatoes,  onions,  mushrooms,  green peppers, ham and sausage. Very tasty.  Add some black pepper for some subtle spiciness and you're golden.   As for the service; it's wonderful. Donna was our server for the day and she was very courteous to our needs. Really great service from her.  The only reason I did not give a 5 star rating was because of the pancakes that I ordered. I always order pancakes for every meal. My dissatisfaction was that their batter does not seem fresh. The only way I knew that it wasn't,  was because the pancakes were very tough to cut. My only assumption is that the batter is already pre made throughout the entire day and thus the gluten is already activated and hardened. I believe the goal to a good pancake is to NOT premake the batter and just make a fresh new batter for every pancakes order requested.

7m5pmm4u_CRLOyHmx8Z0LA.text: We had breakfast here with our two little guys and we consider it a great choice. We were seated immediately, served quickly and the food was good. We ordered the standard eggs benny (yummy though hollandaise was different without the traditional tang, but still tasty), the santa cruz breakfast burrito (which had an awesome tasty sauce drizzled over it), and a waffle with strawberries and whipped cream (super tasty, kid said better than mom makes and I wasn't offended). While we waited our waiter brought out banana nut muffins that our kids loved. Would definitely go back.

x1AU_bOHvD_03sx7OGDfjA.text: Food was great and our server Kat was awesome! Second time here... Wish we lived in the area to come more often :-)

X_bdjBCBpZi6mnl7vUNncg.text: I love coming here! My niece wanted cereal and it blew her mind she was able to set it up and pour it herself. Candice was fantastic and despite being busy was very quick to help us when needed. Will definitely return!

DnCT1mBkAUXKTaf7HP-DgA.text: The food is delicious: pancakes, spam, special bennys, omelettes - they have it all and always made just how you want it. The staff is super accommodating of special requests (like my soft bacon which is always cooked to perfection). Every server is wonderful, but my absolute favorite is Ash! She is so nice and friendly, especially dealing with my family's insatiable need for water and coffee. I'm always stoked when we end up in her section

HyVG8Vp9nHdpo-PsmXYNlA.text: Great breakfast spot off the strip. It's where the locals go, and for a good reason, the prices are very reasonable and the food is off the hook!! You get a huge yummy banana muffin with your meal. My bf got the country breakfast and he loved it. I got the blackened prime rib eggs benedict, and it's one of the best eggs benedicts that I've had. It's little pieces of steak on top of a croissant with perfectly cooked eggs. We also got a sample of the chili which was also delicious so we decided to order it to go since we were stuffed. It doesn't seem like you can go wrong with anything on the menu since this place really knows how to cook breakfast right.   Also, the staff is extremely friendly, very helpful, and patient. I can't wait to go back, and if you haven't been here, it's worth getting off the strip for an excellent breakfast!

9eX1OYNotGGP8j6h2p66NQ.text: Tanya is a great server. It was our first time there! Food quality is good and prices are acceptable!

0yKOtqVvUYUt0Gc-VYoPsg.text: Great food and better service! Donna was amazing! She gave us a couple of delicious banana muffins and did great training Eddy.  He will be the next great server!

4A2xoEl-PjNkNXgF0SEl7Q.text: I usually go to the Egg Works on rainbow and both times I've come here I have not been pleased with the service. Being that my business has moved to this side of town and I love the food I decided to stop in here and have been disappointed. Both times they forgot a food item in my bag with my pickup order ! To drive all the way back to a restaurant during lunch hour is such a hassle. Then, when I called the manager to let her know my muffin was missing she said "well the cooks said they even gave you 2 muffins and threw in a free muffin." Lady, do you really think I would call all the way back to a restaurant to lie over a missing muffin ????? Seriously. Smh.  Then I order a kids juice for my son, and the cashier says its a large juice and it was a kids size juice for $2.70. That's way too expensive for a kids size juice which is even weird because their menu is not expensive at all !  Double check your bags before you leave !

XyMnmqmoHM-Gmhp8hpBA-w.text: Four travelers passing through las Vegas for a couple days, we picked this place for breakfast and it did not disappoint!  Our waitress was nice enough to tell us honestly that the cappucino was not worth ordering, but our cheesesteak, Santa Cruz skillet, stuffed french toast and veggie crepe were all fantastic.    Pro tip: almost anything can be ordered in a half portion (half price + 1.50) and is still a generous helping!    Would definitely eat here again

3UhpDstffTUTWrWHXAJP5g.text: 4.5 stars but im going to bump them up to a 5 cause of their banana nut muffin and how quickly we got our food  their "benni's" are DELICIOUSSSS.. i love eggs benedict and their take on it is so good.. plus their servings are ginormous so youre definitely getting what you pay for.. we also had one of their omelettes.. delicious.. there's not a negative thing i can say about this place.. im glad it's right next to my house but i'm really sad that i only get to go home once a month..   theyre not open late so go early.. my friends have been raging about this place and i finally got to try it out last weekend.. definitely added to the list of places i have to go whenever i stop by home

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benny and loco moco

J8IpBQk6iLCGSRm7OD6u-Q.text: The is a great place to eat. Only open for breakfast and lunch. The Banana Nut Muffin is a must and comes with most breakfast specials. My go to is the Stuffed French Toast. but the pancakes are very tasty as well and dont forget the potatoes i like them cooked well done. Its about a 15 min drive from the strip but well worth it and not over priced. I have visited this location at least 5 times. i go every time i'm in Vegas. Cant wait for my next trip

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Center cut New York with eggs and works potatoes.  Delicious

q6-dSfnOSQc5kFXn7CyfdA.text: I love egg works, simple as that. The food is always great and the customer service at all of their locations, especially sunset/eastern is top notch! I have tried a lot of the menu and my favorites are: Reuben sandwich, the Works Benny, and the chicken salad! Seasonally they offer carrot cake French toast which is to die for! Our waiter Perry was awesome, checked on us enough and was very friendly.

pyF5r0b3w-sft2YAYPl5MA.text: First timers!  Sooo glad we found this one. Hash was awesome--ACTUALLY HOMEMADE!!!  Banana nut muffins BEST we have had hands down. Wife had a two egg omelette that was still huge. ROBERT has only been there 4 weeks but seemed like he has been there forever. HIGHLY recommend him and the food!

I7OWSYl8NuYo-Oxe1ad6lA.text: Ash H. was our server and she is awesome! Super friendly and quick service! We're visiting from Chicago and we're always trying to find the best breakfast spot in every city and Egg Works did not disappoint! They are super quick and a well organized team. The food is exactly what you want for breakfast food - the veggie benny is great for any vegetarians out there. Thank you!

vo7jbxP5TE-oQ67OkFj8Dg.text: Great place for breakfast. We went there based on yelp reviews, and we were so happy with our first visit that we visited again the next day.  The food is great, especially the potatoes made in hot sauce...all servers are very helpful.  Robert was our server - very friendly, very attentive...made both our visits very pleasant.

o7DrA7UCFyxffwZYuXMMcg.text: Breakfast was wonderful, as always! I had the carnitas omelet special, and couldn't finish it. It was big enough for 3 people, and was so good that I are way more than I should have. Our server, Candice, was great - friendly, fast, and checked in on us just the right amount!

zAiY7LjPrqO_S1isgX5WHA.text: Devine! What a find in this city of a million to one. I had the country Benny which was the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had. The potato side was so delectable I nearly teared up with happiness. My taste buds were given Such a treat my butt on the other hand will be running around the lake daily so I can indulge in this spectacular restaurant.

9bhDk_iRHMkBVd9MdknZlw.text: Excellent breakfast place and friendly helpful staff! The food is fresh, the omelets and breakfast burritos will start your day off great!

cWShmIJnmd1d2vKpwoPZrg.text: My family loves to visit egg works whenever in Vegas. The banana nut muffins are delicious and the Loco Moco Hawaiian style breakfast was so yummy. Everyone that works there is very nice and helpful. Our waitress Donna was very friendly and gave us great service.

GpisYSJhUiQLkq5aPmNS2Q.text: Its alright. Good service. Food is well prepared but nothing great in my opinion. Worth the price but probably wouldnt go back.

ybY072eC8Waf4dCksXIfCg.text: My family came from out of state to visit me for graduation. And we decided to come here the next day for breakfast on a Sunday morning.   The wait was about 30 minutes but the food was nothing short of amazing. Great homemade taste delivered at a reasonable time{im a waitress, I would know}. The food came out piping hot; waitress and staff are hospitable.   Definitely my new weekend breakfast spot.

2RZ1EwmmQd33kzQPxBQW-g.text: Great food for a reasonable price. Also excellent customer service!! Will definitely be back the next time we're  in town.

FmfIIx-fojUkTFbdwAv_FQ.text: PK was a fantastic server at the countertop where I sat.  Immediate with the coffee.  On the countertop I read that now they offer substitutes for eating healthy such as half portions, cooking spray, instead of oil, fresh fruit, egg whites, 9-grain toast.  Pretty amazing!    The Carrot Cake French toast was to die for.  A must!  Every time I come here the food is delish.  Also the healthy egg whites, turkey bacon, fresh sweet fruit & toast hit the spot too.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cordon Bleu half portion!

JIVuS39pRE1nruKeMRaF9Q.text: The best loco moco ive had in Vegas, you also gotta try the banana nut muffin. Theres always a line at this location so you should call ahead unless theres only two then u can sit at the bar. Great customer service and they are super fast.

VCwaEkJ11o7cx5nA1LhzAQ.text: Shout out to Jamie, who provides amazing service! If you are lucky to get to sit her section you will not be disappointed!  Never tried a bad dish here, ever! I love the Works Scramble (I ask for my chicken blackened and ask for turkey bacon) and the Taco Skillet.  To be honest my favorite part is the bottomless coffee, you get your own pot of coffee and vanilla creamers at your table :)  I also love that you can request "no oil" as a healthier option! They now offer gluten-free items too (gluten-sensitive)  Don't forget to check in on Yelp to get your free muffin! They always serve it freshly out if the oven!

TVWX63aC0stLiP-ngvJL-w.text: Cassandra helped us out today and was awesome!!!! We had a great breakfast and perfect service. We will definitely be back.

Iuuc5cwzCwxgnk3YCrPz1A.text: Love Egg works! Great breakfast place with friends and family.   Came here at 2pm with my boyfriend before work and it was not busy. He always orders the Island Favorite (Portuguese sausage with egg and rice) and I usually get the Spinach benny. Everything is flavored perfectly and yummy!  Great service, Will be back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach benny!

dtlICMFpWJh7vrA_b2tNwA.text: Short one-liner review: Affordable delicious brunch place off the strip with easy access and parking, large portion sizes, relatively short waits (though I went on a weekday). Get the banana nut muffin and look for the Groupon to save.  ___________________________________________  Such a great place for breakfast/brunch!   The winner was their banana nut muffin. It's free with check-in, but also seems to be included with almost every dish. I'd say you're a fool if you pick toast over this delicious warm muffin.   I tried out the hash with over easy eggs and potatoes. Many places serve potatoes, but these potatoes were noticeably EXCELLENT. Now I understand how potatoes should be served everywhere!  I also had a bite of my friend's loco moco and that was great as well.  Service was above and beyond. We were waiting on a friend and ordered ahead for him, and they were able to keep the food warm as we were waiting.   BONUS: There was an awesome Groupon for this restaurant, which means our meal was extra affordable (it already is a pretty sweet deal for how great it is). Seriously, check this place out!

QxCBrXtyxox_3c5koC3UIQ.text: I've been here a few times and the quality of the food & service has always been steady & good. It's a tad bit loud but offers a few comfy large booths, which I love. It's good for breakfast or lunch. Great location to or from the airport. They offer a good groupon deal so check it out and save some mula!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq chicken salad, little pieces of cold cubed chicken and incorrect lettuce. Avoid!!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A cute guy I found there eating a huge burrito
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with onion rings (upcharge for the rings)

pjbeOhrnUIoxW-hIXDtWXg.text: Amazing breakfast joint! They have a best seasoning for their fries and eggs here, and it's even available for purchase up front. Service is always kind and helpful, and the food makes it all the better! Reasonably priced and in a great, common location. Perfect for Sunday brunches and mornings. Wait time isn't that bad either, usually 15 minutes or so. Overall, awesome place to eat!

qRpT8uAOBTOwRPsb_MbbSQ.text: This place is amazing!!! Love the service and waitress we had. I ordered the county fried steak and it was so good!! The gravy was very flavorful and the potatoes we to die for definitely my favorite!! I love that they already add butter to the toast and the eggs were okay. My husband got the stuffed French toast and that looked Amazing ! He said it was great! My daughter got the mouse pancake with chocolate chips and she love it!  I will definitely be returning!

L47CF0SPg-aVGMw9CAyf8Q.text: The food is great especially the muffins but service has gone done the staff seems irritated and rude most of the time I use to like going here but I rather go to Denny's at least their staff has better customer service

8M_SyzhIGwW6vVObEAQSYw.text: The omelette was excellent. Fair price for fresh and delicious breakfast. Also had the French Toast. Service was quick and efficient. Server was very friendly. Thank you.

MBB0bsORZh_Kj8jR4vx_tw.text: This place is BOMB!  We picked up our rental car and eagerly searched for a place with some yummy grinds! Low and behold, Yelp never fails us and we found this gem just a hop skip and a jump away from the airport.  Convenience at its best!   We got here around 830 and there were still parking spaces close to the entrance and lots of tables available.  We were seated promptly and were given menus to start with.  The menu is vast and full of variety.  Breakfast and lunch options.  My boyfriend settled on the biscuits and gravy along with some orange juice and I chose some hot cocoa with whipped cream and happend to stumble upon some local Hawai'i plates!  This made me feel much closer to home and I excitedly chose the loco moco medium with sunny side up eggs!  Biscuits and gravy is my boyfriend's go to meal though he probably would have chosen the loco moco instead if he saw it.    We both get our food and my first bite of the loco moco I made that sound, you know that sound you make when something is made well and brings you back to fond memories of the last time you ate it?  Yup, that was me.  It was delicious! Perfectly cooked and the gravy was tasty!  They also have those delightful banana nut muffins that were just as good.  We loved this place so much that we went back our last morning in Vegas already knowing that we were each going to get the loco moco!  Now that we found this gem of a place I'm pretty sure we'll be visiting it every time we go to Vegas now.

LQdq2Gikn_djJhg2GzdH0A.text: You will have to wait to eat in here on Saturdays or Sundays. It is worth the wait! Their huge menu is printed on newspaper is different than most places, and filled with colorful illustrations. So many choices it will be hard to choose! The cubed hash browns here are the best in town, and you can actually buy Egg Works Seasoning before you leave!  If you can't eat large portions, you would be best to split a breakfast with your friend or family member. I don't always check in here, but this is my favorite place to eat breakfast, and I prefer the location on Eastern and Sunset to the other one.

bw4yb60zsUDp_TGqTeb5ug.text: First off I have to say that I really enjoyed the interaction that the staff had with one another. Everyone was cooperative, helping one another out in the kitchen and out on the service. The manager, Ashley, does a very good job being involved and being hands on. I was observing all the action at the breakfast counter and she had hawk eyes for everything that was happening and made the service run very smoothly.   For a heads up, if you are alone or with another person I suggest going straight to the breakfast bar. You'll experience less wait time and you still receive awesome service.    I had the pleasure to have Kristopher as my waiter and the moment I sat down my order was taken.  Hats off to all the staff and their hard work especially the chef. Everything was cooked beautifully. Upon receiving my food it was presentable and the quality is consistent from the steak to the eggs (which I'm very picky about).  Thank you for a great start to my morning (:

tgDfGVuxTMdsk8IyFPdpvA.text: I've been to Egg Works before, but this was the first time ever coming for lunch. I actually was kind of surprised that they even had lunch items being that I only think of this place on the weekend and solely for breakfast, but their lunch was actually not too shabby.  I came with some coworkers for quick meal during a break between a seminar. I started with a glass of their fresh squeezed OJ first (gotta get that vitamin C in). It was definitely fresh & tasty, I'd recommend it! For my main meal I had the Works Tostada Salad without the meat to make it vegetarian friendly. This salad was HUGE! I think I managed to eat about 3/4 before I gave up. The flavor was very good, I liked the red & green sauce to top it off. The only negative about this mammoth was that the shell gets soggy on the bottom from all the toppings and breaks through. Meh.   Overall it was a tasty visit and I'd come here again for more lunch or breakfast goodies.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works Tostada Salad

X4au7r40hRq-eo-AUVHsGw.text: Food is very good and service  is fast always a bundle of joy to come here always a chill relaxing place to be with great breakfast options. try it one of our favorite breakfast place

iSKW9gNEadmfhEhnuIU0xQ.text: After looking at the reviews we decided to visit!  This is the BEST place we've ever been for breakfast! Don't let the people outside deter you from eating. The wait is short because food is out quick and they keep it moving! Everything is delicious!!!! The food hit the spot! I had the chili relleno stuffed omelet! That was soooo good! The banana nut muffins are incredible!!! So good, we took some home! I forgot what my Husband had but the picture is below, lol This is the place I will be bringing our out of town guests! If you are just passing through, venture off the strip and get some breakfast that will make that "night of drinking" disappear lol

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uETfJbmZs1HcnoXlG7a7Cg.text: If you like country everything, you will probably like this place. If you are used to more affluent places, than you wouldn't.   Straight and to the point.

WwZokiQd98saHfjg7K_5gA.text: They have a huge menu which I love because know matter what you might be craving, they'll have something to satisfy you. I have been many times, tried many things (egg sandwiches, corn beef hash, pancakes, etc) and it is all good!!!!  I also love the banana nut muffin that comes with many of the dishes. It's huge and sooo goood. Feels like an extra dessert. You can save it for later.   Give this place a try.   They have a really cute system where you flip this little sign over at your table to say whether you need service or not.  I love the decorations/characters of the entire franchise. So cute!

CpuQB8-CU38hnfGUoo9zcg.text: Mmmm i loves this place  Client bought me breakfast . It was awesome . I'll be visiting

5Tu5YbS7_TWHMxM2aLIZxA.text: Great Breakfast, luv the Banana Nut Muffins with Butter so Delicious! I always take my family there for Breakfast, Brunch or Lunch

I had the Island Favorite which was with Spam (or Portuguese sausage), 2 eggs (over easy for me) with rice and banana nut muffin. For this diner, this breakfast checked off several of my boxes: sweet (muffin), salty (spam), chewy (rice), rich (eggs), etc. It was tasty and came out quickly. Service was very attentive and my coffee cup was never empty. The staff is very nice and no matter what my group needed, everyone jumped in so we didn't have to wait for "our" server.

Huge menu, large enough print my husband who forgot his reading glasses could see.    Fun, positive energy from staff, every person handling food used gloves or tongs!!!   Kitchen staff kicked some serious butt pumping food out that all looked wonderful.  Was a good spot to sit so we could get an idea for what to order next time.    Our server Kat was awesome and very attentive to refills and our needs.    Katelyn was so funny (& hungry). We will be sure to sit with her if possible next time!!   GREAT place will be back!!

YSJOlruSSYfauPfg1jpIKQ.text: Love this place! My daughter and I go to lunch every week after swim class! They never disappoint.

zWk1hKHZDRggMb69edmuZw.text: The menu is extensive and there's a great selection of breakfasts and lunches to choose from. It took me a while to decide what I wanted to order. Meanwhile, since I checked in, I immediately showed our server the free banana muffin offer when she took our drink order. She happily pushed the button on my phone to claim the offer and  promptly returned with a nice warm delicious muffin. My husband got the corned beef hash and eggs. It was yummy.   I ended up ordering the garlic mashed potato omelette, which has bacon, egg, cheese, garlic mashed potatoes, green onions, and a dollop of sour cream on top.  I noticed that all of the omelettes came with their hash brown potatoes, so I asked our friendly server about it. She wittingly said, "You can get fruit instead of the potatoes if you don't want 3 kinds of potatoes..." So that's exactly what I did.   It was delicious! I ate very bite. Yum to the 10th power!!! The fresh fruit consisted of a watermelon triangle, a slice of honeydew, a slice of cantaloupe (hiding under the honeydew), a slice of pineapple, AND an orange wedge. Wow! Since both of our meals included a choice of bread or muffin, both of us asked if we could take our banana muffins to go.   As we were checking out at the register, my husband asked, "Do you guys make and bottle your own hot sauce?" She replied, "Yes, and we have groves for the banana muffins..." LOL!   We had a nice visit and will be sure to return next time we are in town. Thanks for the great food and awesome service, Egg Works!

RRBjBXePrEDN_fp3C2ho_Q.text: The service here is great. Our waiter was very nice and funny. The menu was very cute and fun. It was in the form of a newspaper, and it has a lot to offer.   I ordered the Waffle with Fresh Fruit (strawberries) and Whipped Cream. The waffle was a little limp and soggy feeling, and not a big fluffy waffle like I was expecting. Also, some of the strawberry pieces did not look appetizing, but it was fresh so you can't do much about it.   However, this place is EGG Works so obviously their specialties are eggs. Too bad I was in the mood for something sweet. I'll definitely give this place another try if I'm out in Las Vegas again, and this time I'll try an egg dish.

Kfs2dL4pnZryZddEu2BkTg.text: We have eaten at the Egg Works on S Rainbow Blvd and like it very much.  We saw this location after picking up our Silver Car rental (which we enjoyed very much). We ate here twice. Our first breakfast was great, so we came back.  It was a Saturday morning at about 9:00AM and it was very busy.  The had no open tables, however offered us to eat at the counter. We took it. Our server Ashley came over right away. My wife ordered Brad's scrambled w/out tomatoes and I ordered two eggs scrambled hard and one Portuguese sausage link from the side orders. It arrived with in 9 minutes. The eggs were cooked perfect along with the sausage link cooked crisp.  It was a great sausage. Our server Ashley came over several times to see if all was well.  This will be our new breakfast place in Vegas.

Then another group of people come in after us and is seated next to us with menus and drinks, coffee and water specifically..it took roughly 10 minutes for ANYONE to approach us about our order...we changed our mood to the sad egg and only then did we received service from the establishment!!!

UtSnFl3pQnhkUVrjnfSJbA.text: Cece is probably the best server that I have seen in a long time. She handled are large party with ease, class, courtesy & a little bit of sass. I would come back here just for her.

NKUwAVPVMzCP7dmtokmSMA.text: Busy but worth the wait! Air conditioned, and clean the employees are friendly with their customers and amongst each other makes this place for a pleasant and delicious "eggcellent" breakfast. Been coming back since I found the place a month ago!

W6hGKj98yCqJQdUPpWuk-Q.text: We were visiting from San Diego and quickly looked on yelp for a breakfast spot, this did not disappoint!! We were seated immediately despite there being a wait for larger parties. Our waitress was so friendly and I was happy to take her up on the free banana nut muffin for first timers... it was delicious! Both our meals were amazing and came out quickly. When our meals arrived someone came out to apologize for the wait... they said they had to remake my omelet bc it wasn't to their standards the first time... they take pride in their omelets! But to be honest, I didn't even notice a delay... I still thought it came out fast! We came back the very next morning to get food to go.

But it was still delicious.  Bonus points: the banana nut muffins are incredible here!  :)

The waitress was ok she wasn't anything great.  Seemed like she had some regulars there that got most of her attention. At one point she started talking to them across the room from our table then just left.  We were chit chatting it wasn't important but I thought it was kinda rude. We won't be back.

xbxtXKW6aeHK9hov_z8ldg.text: My boyfriend really loves this place. Like, he craves it all the time. I am a fan, and I really, really, really love the banana muffin. The people are always friendly, and they do get very busy, due to their reasonable prices, good location, and good (and generously sized) food.   I normally get a Hawaiian style breakfast: Portuguese sausage, eggs, and rice. Sometimes I get the avocado and bacon omelette. I also had the crepe once. They are all good, and like I said, the prices and portions are good.   So why minus one star? For me, it's not something I crave that often, and I have been to better breakfast places. I would definitely recommend them, but I can think of at least two places (off the top of my head) that do breakfast better.

kHoeuXSLueb9adTzdvfh1Q.text: Bomb bomb bomb! So worth everything about this place! The eggs are fresh and delicious  the drinks are amazing and the servers are so nice! Very highly suggested.

One very good sign, this place is always very very busy! It's kind of odd that they are only open until early afternoon, kind of seems like a waste of a building, but they are so busy, that breakfast must pay for everything.

I had the bacon, eggs, pancakes and biscuits. The biscuits were so light and fluffy they melted in your mouth. Although the food was awesome the best part of Egg Works was Candice. urm7L0zcSdoTqPusRiadYg.text: I went on a Friday for lunch, and the restaurant was humming but not crowded (I've heard the weekends are a super busy here). We had a great server and the food came out perfectly well and quickly. Being gluten intolerant, I just ordered some eggs and sausage, which were delicious, but looking at the AMAZING french toast and waffle plates my companions got, I did get jealous. It would be nice if they had more options for gluten free dining, but what they have is adequate, and service was very good.

I had orange juice and my order came with a choice of toast or muffin. muffin was was warm it went well with meal. Kid friendly they give you crayons and paper.

2SKUF8w5UofXlHbSeUXDyg.text: Ashley is by far the best server. I only come for her ! She's kind and sweet makes us laugh. If you want a good time while enjoying amazing food go to her you won't be sorry. I'll always be back just for her service.

DgkfHTn8jr2m2kDPw0hdgw.text: My new favorite breakfast place, to bad there isn't one in California! Had the Mexican omelette and my husband had the Mashed potato omelette. Yummy! Everything tasty. Great friendly service. Can't wait to return

lbhmXXGo4Jdh_rhUgrhlSw.text: Two weeks had passed since the original review and after a couple emails with Egg Works exchanged I was assured that they had fixed the problem. I had returned on 05/23/14 and ordered the Patty Melt.  I must say I would have instantly traded this burger for one that was well done. At best, triple-extra-well is the best way to describe it. I had noticed that the food was taking a long time to cook -- and the reason was that my burger needed an extra 15 minutes on the grill. If only there was a way to post a picture on an "update". Briefly described, both the bread and burger were on the grill far too long. One side of the burger patty was blackened and crunchy, like it was forgotten. Forgotten, but still served to the customer. The bread was grilled to the crunchy consistency of a cracker.  After this visit, it is safe to say I will not return.

oVNuQZMLWTcYrzMSpzSYkw.text: Good food and really large portion sizes. My party and I didn't allot enough time to sit and eat it all but it probably still would have been too much for me to finish. I had the bacon and onion skillet which was delicious. It comes served on top of seasoned potatoes and topped with eggs done how you like them. It's a good value for the amount of food you get but it would be better if they could sell you less food for an even cheaper price (not that it's very expensive at all). I just feel like it's sort of wasteful as no one was able to finish their food.

c5V0bMm7ZaeBO3sBPIVoHw.text: Really nice area even better restaurant. They put the egg in egg works. Service is fast friendly everything rocks with this place. Highly recommend it if you have the means.

DvqgpQyc2jqnMs8h7zwBXw.text: Donna was the best server I ever had! Very attentive!! The food here is absolutely amazing as well. I just moved here from Illinois in March and have been here almost every month. The banana nut muffins are the best!! Try it and you'll love it!

GkdvnbxiKoyOOAc0Jb3_hQ.text: Huge amounts of fresh and tasty stuff for breakfast, delivered by quick and courteous wait staff. All four of our group thoroughly enjoyed our meals, and only one of us got more than half of the food eaten.  Doggy bags for breakfast??  Well worth a try; a hidden delight.  And if you are lucky enough to get Sandra for your waitress, say hi!

07jlM7wNFjZbCGTSnnBLDw.text: I don't live in the area but whenever I'm in town, I always stop here for breakfast. Their waffle with whipped cream and bananas is insane!   They have the best servers there, too. Based on my visits, DONNA is the friendliest, funniest and most engaging of them all.   Great job Egg Works! Can't wait for my next trip. :-)

j3a24CF_C4Yo0nRDzrWivw.text: Food was way to salty for me. Not good for people with high blood pressure. But they give a lot of food.

KBnL0JbP9QXAH5Zc4-4niw.text: The food was outstanding. Our server Card  (did I get that right? That's what's on the receipt. I called her Cher) was a brights pot in our morning. She was so quick and friendly. I had a Florentine omelet. It was as good as it sounds. This was our first breakfast stop in Vegas but we will certainly return.

fwSgMwfPUiLQDjVBj-ROtA.text: I love egg works. It is one of my go to spots for breakfast. This particularly spot is my favorite because PK gives the best customer service. He is friendly and very personable. I would highly recommend PK and this location.

gurfwRywAgz0dGEYhq_Lnw.text: Really good good avacado and bacon omelet. The banana nut muffin was delicious, and they bring you a carafe of coffee!  We sat out on the patio, the airplanes overhead were low and of course loud and often. But it's a cool spot with very friendly wait staff. Oh and the chorizo scramble is very good, my partner loved it!

gj5exgYInWTZaYpMTdWK6g.text: My wife and I will visit this place every time we go to Las Vegas. They have quick friendly service. And their chili Rellenos omelet is to die for.

awHmbbeuK95p74jolQEOcg.text: Great staff and the banana nut muffin is to die for! It was so good :) Will definitely come back!

tEJq3-_0ZIEg8-p5KGsWKQ.text: Love this place! Great service and well prepped food. Never had a bad experience here.

s_z0IsMRkzDSYTNP8TUJOw.text: My girlfriend and I wanted to check out somewhere new for breakfast. Little did we know that Egg Works was the same company as Egg & I which we loved. Pretty much the same menu with a different name.  Country Fried Steak was awesome! The batter was crispy and while the meat was juicy. The gravy was thick and flavorful, but not too overwhelming. Chile Rellenos - it was good for an American restaurant. Banana Nut Muffin - warm, buttery goodness. Free with Yelp Check in! Habla Diablo Potatoes were fantastic! I'd come back just for these.   Service: Good. If you need something, you can just flip the metal egg face to indicate that you need service.

Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak

1SrR-pqYafqIi8K-niIpCQ.text: Awesome menu with tons of options. I like that they had options to substitute meat with turkey products as well.

zmNBRCnM26nuoxpVmJsCDA.text: I have always liked this place. The service is great and the food is always awesome. However, my last visit I had the The Works Skillet Breakfast and I was a bit disappointed. I felt cheated because there was hardly any meat. It was basically potatoes, cheese and veggies. I would have just ordered the regular breakfast with sausage or bacon. It was still very tasty just missing more meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CKvGgIuaNXAOHsHT5S_W_g.text: If you're in the mood for breakfast, this place will hit the spot. Convenient location, great breakfast, friendly service and even better breakfast options.    We were immediately  seated upon entering. Dani our server had coffee was in my cup within minutes. Thanks to fellow yelpers ordering was a breeze. Ordered the stuffed French toast. I couldn't resist the picture of one that was previously posted. Awesome service from Dani, will definitely be back.   Tip: check in for a free banana muffin!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aSwTXqoSnvHMmn2vnNAnjA.text: Great fast service and yummy food! We enjoyed the country Benny and it was delicious! Teresa was our waitress and she was sooo great! We never had to ask for refills of water. And to top it off,if you let a first time customer you can try one of their signature muffins!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut muffin
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benny

xgv8R4nNsS3pCAnG00ehFw.text: I was in town visiting friends In Las Vegas this past weekend... We had breakfast there on Sunday and it was OUTSTANDING!! Tina was a great server!! Banana bread was off the charts!

0dSolHvb_SaQMN1X3giycw.text: Egg works is a really good place to get breakfast. This location is near the airport, so very convenient if you are just arriving in Vegas and hungry. The portion sizes are HUGE. After eating here, we decided we didn't even need to eat lunch that day.  Each entree is around $9-$12 and could feed two people.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aJhuYOsCiE2bC3Vk3d9K2A.text: Egg Works is our Go-to breakfast and brunch place and where we always bring visiting family and friends to for a hearty meal. Today, after a long run, I wanted to eat a good hearty meal to satisfy my hunger, so naturally, we went to Egg Works. Our hostess Jamie was very friendly, attentive, bubbly, & enthusiastic. She kept checking on us and made sure we needed everything that we need to make our meal satisfying. I even claimed my free Banana nut muffin upon Yelp check-in. Even though busy, she came to our table asking for our apologies for not being able to assist us fast but the fact is, she still assisted us in a timely manner.  The food is immaculate as ever and the serving was big enough to share leaving each of us full. Everything that I've eaten from this establishment since my family and I began coming here are all good. No disappointments to date.  The only issue that I have is our receptionist, the person who welcomed us first and who sat us, Abby was not stellar. When we entered she said "Hi" while yawning! What the heck! She asked us if we wanted to sit on the counter and upon replying "No" she told us that it will be a while before we'll be sat, we said that's fine, then two seconds later, she says: "Oh, I didn't see that table over there is open, you can be seated now." I wanted to tell her to have a strong mug of coffee first before resuming her duties but I decided not to. We also saw her seat other patrons and she kept yawning! If I owned this establishment, I would not want any of my staff, especially the ones who greet the patrons first to be yawning every chance they get. Geeze!  A part from our issue with Abby, our time here today is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slaying the Traditional Breakfast Benny and Short stack Pancakes.
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Banana nut Muffin upon Yelp check in &amp; coffee. A perfect combination.

aQbh19SSZP2VQpd1kmsm0w.text: *****FIVE STARS*****!!  Yay!! Egg Works!! You deserves my five stars!!  & esp. to Waitress Donna, we had outstanding service, during our visit: 9/23/2015 This is my first time at this location & 2nd visit to Egg works.  This is my "must go" to place, when I vacation here in Vegas.  *I also recommend this place to a friend who was visiting & she thanked me for the recommendation.   We stopped by after 11am on a Wednesday & the place filled up fast when we left.  There were many people waiting for a table. This comes to show how popular & good this place is.   I love how they have cute signs on the table & on the shirts, all egg-related.  This place is cute!!  &  for all those missing Hawaii! They have: loco moco, Portuguese sausage, spam, & Aloha Shoyu!!   I like to mentioned why Donna is so great!!  My order is a little complicated but she managed to get the request in & asked the cook if it was possible.  My order: the country ham breakfast My request: ham well done, eggs:  scrambled & over-easy starch: half rice & half potato & YES!! exactly as requested.   My other half got the omelette breakfast & he enjoyed it.  We both enjoyed our breakfast & our experience @ Egg Work.  We had an EGG-ceptional time!!   Try the potato & of course the banana nut muffin.  These are so yummy!!  I really love how the potatoes are cut up & seasoned so well.  & the muffin is so moist!!  ( check in on Yelp for a free muffin) Thanks Yelp & Egg Work for this offer!!   See you on my next Vegas Vacation Egg Works!!  I hope to have Donna as our waitress again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
