B591G9rRSVMSMkj7X13YXQ.text: Just amazing ! Quick service and food is amazing. I definitely recommend the steak and eggs , covered in gravy !

1XGkJCQPf9DO-cnC-MejEQ.text: We have been to this location a few years back, and did not enjoy the idea of being hurried through our meal. However, we liked the food last time, and decided to give it another try. We were determined this time to not be hurried through our meal by the wait staff.  We were seated at a two-top in the back next to the counter seating. We ordered quickly, and received our food quickly as well. We ordered the Bandito Scramble. This included chorizo, jalapenos, cilantro, cheddar, diced green chilies and a side of 'habla diablo original salsa', topped with sour cream. This also came with seasoned potatoes and we chose the banana muffin over the toast.  The scramble was pretty tasty. It was not spicy at all, and the combination of the salsa and sour cream made it even better. The salsa was nothing special. It was more like a picante sauce, very mild and not chunky. The seasoned potatoes were alright, but seasoned way too heavily. They were red from all of the seasoning. My guess is that it was Lawry's seasoned salt.  I would have preferred a lot less of this on the potatoes.   On a Sunday, our wait was about 20 minutes. Service was quick, and friendly. Not too bad.

UJkbad0bSJZkQCz9UWxC6A.text: We visit Vegas a few times a year and there are breakfast places on the strip that we'll hit up, but they're often crowded and expensive. Egg works is in a really convenient location if you're flying in and the cost is significantly less than what you'd pay on or near the strip.   It's got a typical diner feel. Newspaper style menus with about 50+ items to choose from in all. I got a skillet with bacon, sausage, eggs, potatoes, and cheese for days. The portions are huge and you will NOT go home hungry. My wife ordered some sort of open faced croissant sandwich that came with potatoes on the side. It was sooooo good.   Honestly, the biggest surprise of the whole meal was the banana nut muffin that we got. When you think of a banana nut muffin, it doesn't exactly stir up the same excitement that you'd get for other breakfast food, but let me tell you...these muffins are to die for! They come out warm, so cut it in half and slather that baby in butter and you are in for a treat!   The service was very good despite the restaurant being super packed. We were always getting refills quickly and our food came out right on time. They're really a well-run operation which is just as important to me as the food itself.   Overall, a fantastic experience that is probably more of a hideout for locals than it is for tourists, but it was wonderful. We'll be back next time we're in town.

3e9wV4-EDe0BlHFzMutITA.text: Food is always great at Egg works. The Jueveos Rancheros hands down is the best I've had. Customer service at Sunset location was outstanding. Though busy, our server Donna never missed a beat. She was Fast, friendly and attentive.

lKN9DzJRHj380glijX38YQ.text: ... Its ok food. I  been here twice. Once I got the chili,  and the other time i got the Spinach benny The benny was actually wonderful! Perfect combo of raw spinach and yummy sauce!  I do recall my mom getting a breakfast burrito and it was hideous. It had gravy and all kinds of shit in it. Just nothing acidic to balance it. It was eggs and gravy and meat. No salsa or tomato. She kindly asked the waitress to change her order, it was  yucky. She did, and everything worked out...   We asked for a coffee cup and the girl put the cup rim down on the dirty table. I understand that is how you set up a table, but usually when the rim is down there is a napkin or paper doily under it. She just didnt get it.   Good thing: they put a sign on your table that lets the staff know if you need anything. Thats a good idea!  Prices are good! Location is great. Not sure what I keep missing about this place that others are raving about? Maybe I am not ordering the right stuff???. Sorry. If that changes I will def update this.

O0_JqvrdRSfiGg3A3cgqJA.text: Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating. The service was really good! If it's your first time here you get this bomb ass banana muffin. SO GOOD. Must try!  For a breakfast place, I thought the food was ok.

b_XXQJmjkT7ZSq5P4XiI6Q.text: Who would have figured that this place would have been so good in a small nondescript strip mall?? You gotta come tot his place...  a. Location - Not bad, but kind of hidden away at the Park 2000 Strip Mall on the Northeast corner of Sunset and Eastern. Not quite visible from the street, but there are some signs.  Plenty of parking.  b.  Ambiance - I was pleasantly surprised by the feeling of the restaurant. I was thinking that it would be small and budget like.  It was rather large, well lit, and the feeling was just right. A bit homey, plenty of room and a feeling like, this is comfy!  c.  The menu - OK, I am generally not too confused and know what I like. However, this place has an amazing menu.  It is like a local newspaper with several pages.  From these amazing egg/bacon/ carb combos, to hawaiian breakfast, to omelets, salads, hamburgers, chili the cincy way.... everything sounded so good.  I opted for an omelette with sourdough toast, and I am saving myself for the hawaiian breakfast and for the chili over spaghetti.  That sounds so cool... You cannot go wrong at this place, the choices are quite amazing.  d.  The service - I would say, this is more than great. They check on you all the time, they are professional, very courteous and very friendly.  I think they have servers that believe in their company, in their product and proud.  It is such a great feeling.    e.  The food - I described the menu, and the food is just as great.  Everything here works well. It just clicks. I have already come back since this lunch on Saturday to try out the meals on Sunday morning which is a busier time at their other location. Guess what, it was only a 15 minute wait.  Denny's Ihop,  WHO?  Never again.  GK says, for a great experience, try the Egg Works.

xRm3VTJ_6L-kYttAdMENlg.text: Both food and service was excellent.   The sides with our one lets were great with many options for those that are diet conscious.   We will be back.

DFCe0GfDJ5L4gfNlwWgJHg.text: I debated giving Egg Works 3/5 because the food was just ok but the service was good, especially since we were a large party and split checks were no problem! The waitress was very nice, I believe her name was Diana. As for the food, I had the Sundance Omelette. The omelette was tasty and had a good portion of ingredients including spinach, tomato, artichokes and feta cheese. My only qualm with the omelette was that the egg was cooked well and came out hard on the outside vs soft and fluffy. The coffee was of average quality. I like that they leave the coffee pot at the table for you for instant refills. I substituted the potatoes for fresh fruit on the plate and I got a nice assortment of melons (3 kinds), pineapple, and grapefruit. Good little place for breakfast. The free banana nut muffin with Yelp check-in was a nice bonus!

cTyvDC3dbHrRB5nbpeBtNA.text: I always like going here or their location on Sahara and Arville.  The menu's items have a good variety, and the food always comes out warm and tasty.  In the years that I've been frequenting the establishments, I haven't had bad service. This recent experience, going around noon, was no different. The funny thing about going in that time frame is that their busiest period had passed. Hahaha... According to the boyfriend, there was like 2 servers to 1 table, constantly checking on their patrons, and still able to have a good time with co-workers.  Anyway, I like their skillets, particularly their Chicken Fried Steak. The boyfriend likes their Patty Melts. I think their fries and red potatoes (breakfast plates) are seasoned the same way. It's just yummy. Hahaha... I like the way they leave the coffee pot with the table so I can just help myself unless that runs out. I think the only thing I didn't like about this experience was paying for the bill... The ladies didn't acknowledge me when I walked up to the desk. They just talked about fixing another table's bill, even though they all made eye contact with me at some point. Then when they were done, the cashier just held her hand out for my bill. Eh.

nlmYR17b8iYG6bE88lQ-Rw.text: I'm not a huge breakfast person  but I'd have to say the breakfast here is quite good. Pancakes were light and fluffy and the chorizo omlette was yummy. The portions are large so it's enough for two. The service was also good. Wait staff came around to check on you quite often.

PKxlC_QawIpUBRSrL4IJww.text: Didn't have to wait since we opted for counter seating. It is a bit loud and hectic but it's quick. The service is quick at the counter, not as much chit chat, right to the point. I was hungry so it was fine. Though I usually rather get a table, take my time and get great service here. The menu selection is amazing! I love, love the fact that they have a vegetarian eggs Benedict. I get everything I could possibly want! Tomatoes, spinach, avocado with poached egg and a perfect sauce- not too sour, good consistency, not drenched. Couldn't resist and I wanted the best of both worlds so convinced my friend to split the stuffed strawberry cream cheese French toast. I've been dreaming about stuffed French toast since first having it in Hawaii. This hit the spot and made my Vegas experience! Have to pay at the register in front where they have a selection of sauces and seasonings to take home. There was quite a line up. Wish I could just pay at the table and go. My experience this time was more a 4 star with the service, counter seating experience, and line up but I still gave 5 based on past experiences and the food.

YEpX9S-Wq0o8wrMb3Fnalw.text: Hit the egg works on the way out of town. Delicious food and Cris a.k.a. MC was a delight to have as a server.  I hear they are famous for their omelets so I got the western with the potatoes and a banana nut muffin.  Bottom line here delicious food and if you want some good banter sit in cris's section

_J0Ge4b_3ORswotDUvDHbA.text: We used to buy salt licks for our horses each summer, since salt was not something they naturally came by and needed. I, however, am not in need of a salt lick. But I got one this morning for breakfast.   Potatoes? Completely crusted in the house seasoning, which was at least 75% salt. They glittered in the florescent lighting. Even slightly crunchy...and not because they were fried to a crisp. It was SALT.   Gravy? Lukewarm, but that's okay, I couldn't eat it due to the salt level.   Bacon? Appropriately salty.   I should've taken the leftovers to my horse. I'd never have to buy a salt lick again.

ePLLyzmM1t2EmeW3Dgtdvw.text: Great place, fast service, Maya was super friendly and nice. My wife and I really enjoyed our meals and we are sorry we didn't know about this place sooner. We will definitely return!

59dKaYWQMv_unFDUIJRk3g.text: I always seek out good breakfast/brunch. Egg Works had such great reviews I couldn't pass it up, even while on vacation. I'm glad I didn't. Maya, our server, was super friendly and helpful, and our food was amazing and fast. If you like breakfast food (or just food in general), you should try it out!

mJ2GVGDb-Nxq6AdI___d7Q.text: truly three stars.  huge menu, good variety of food, quick to be seated, large portions.   slowwww service (it took us nearly 10-15 minutes before someone even came over to say hi after being seated) and the taste of food was standard/expected for breakfast food.  nothing memorable about this place, but that wouldn't stop me from coming again.

7lcIZcOhvq5WVUKBnS88zQ.text: Good breakfast, huge menu, something for everyone to chose.  Natasha was our server and she was fun and enthusiastic.  Very accommodating too.  I wasn't feeling eggs so much, so I went with a crepe.  It wasn't your typical thin pancake crepe, its more like a very thin omelet.  Still, it was tasty.  I wanted all the sauce on the side and turkey sausage instead of bacon.  I got turkey bacon instead, but that was fine because my spouse said the turkey sausage was spicy and I don't do spicy.  I also wanted my banana muffin ( unwarmed) and to go, but it was warmed and presented to me on a plate.  No biggie, I just packed it in a box to go.    My spouse had the blueberry pancakes with eggs and turkey sausage.  I did think that was slighty pricey at 11.55, however, I did have a groupon( 12 for 20) so it was still a decent value for breakfast.

EUdihyY4PZxWjTYIdQjPHQ.text: We ate here last month.  Incredible service and food.  The country potatoes were the best.  Wish there was one close to us.

yUI6k8rw-RnFB5jyfgsGgA.text: It was a wonderful experience,we need one in Seattle,I am not a story teller but fore and foremost it was worth a visit

WwlRQa76MWh915r200bi1Q.text: I think it's Vegas's best breakfast. The eggs are very tasty. And the price is also reasonable. There is also the possibility of turkey Bacon and turkey sausages. Especially I would like to mention from the waiters that MAYA was very interested in us and I was very satisfied with the place. If I come back to las vegas, I will definitely come here. I would recommend anyone here. This is las vegas's best breakfast and best egg.

5Qgiy-3X52CBidjgFOxFcQ.text: Got brunch with some friends on Sunday. It was quite busy, but the turnover was quick. I got the stuffed French Toast which is unique and really good. Sweet and savory is definitely my thing and I'm glad someone turned it into reality. My only complaint is the upcharge for substituting the potatoes with sliced avocado, since on the menu the latter was slightly cheaper. But oh well, I did create extra work for the kitchen, and it's a diner. So I'm being a bit nitpicking.   My friend's cincinnati chili spaghetti looks...very interesting. But I've never seen pretty cincinnati chili in my entire life either.   My favorite part about the set up of this place is that they give you a whole container of coffee that you can fill up your cup by yourself, so you aren't just sitting there waiting for a waitstaff to come by and refill your cup.  Our waiter Robert was very friendly and hilarious.

wx36KjAsTTQ35AHOTX_tWQ.text: We had breakfast here. Son got the mashed potato omelette and loved it. The potatoes that came with it were so good. Even the wheat toast tasted great. I got pumpkin chocolate chip pancakes and was in heaven. Our waitress was very helpful and attentive. Used a Groupon with no problems. We will definitely be back.  Love this place.

MLvC6gu9walYeYpzzpKwaQ.text: Donna made our Sunday a little brighter!!!  When we came in, we were told the wait would be about 15-20 minutes.  We were seated in 10 minutes! Donna, our server immediately greeted us and took our drink order.  She was so pleasant throughout or meal.  She has such a cheerful personality.  She interacted with our toddler daughter and made her feel extra special!  My husband ordered the Corned Beef Hash and I had the Waffle Works.  No complaints!  Food came out in a timely manner.  Eggs were cooked just as ordered.  Everything had a great taste.    We'll be back!

VARgl0dN5qgzAkUTY5H1Hg.text: I had the works omelet and added advocado.   They were super generous with the advocado.   The omelet and home fries were delicious.   My husband got the tuna melt.  He was very pleased too.  We will definitely be back.

Lno28VDXL05m1ZpIZvNHQA.text: Excellent food! Fantastic server: Donna did an outstanding job!   Had a table of nine and she kept everything in order and we really enjoyed her cheerful attitude.

FAr0ODXsqpOtrivmHJzLhQ.text: Went here for breakfast before our training meeting today an not only was the service great the food is always amazing.  It is hard to get disappointed with the food selection and taste at this place.    Depending on the time which we try to make it early, there is never a wait, the coffee is good and the as I said above the food is amazing.  I will have to look at the receipt again for the server we had, she is tall with blonde hair and she is one of the friendliest people I have ever met there.  She is always cheerful and really cares about her customers.    Those who go in there often enough she will get to know you and will treat you like a family friend.  I highly recommend this place even though they no longer show appreciation to veterans.

RM0uX8A36j2nb6xYE4euHg.text: Our new favorite breakfast place here in Vegas. Can't go wrong with their food. Everything is so good here!! Staff are nice and friendly, Donna is our server today and she's SO awesome!! :) And don't forget to get their banana nut muffin instead of a toast, you'll thank me, it's the BOMB!! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BOMB!! Banana nut muffin..oh yeaaaah!!!

Bk6LkbDj4i5PJfrtbAmyXg.text: Customized for healthy eaters loved the buckwheat pancakes.  Server gave us more energy than the coffee lol pk I think his name was. Great place overall

sX_9SVv6NeVjx7TqJ8jT5w.text: I came to eat here with my sister and my mother on Monday. The food is on hit! Like the portions are great and everything was so yummy.  The look of the place might not be fancy but it's very clean and welcoming.  The service though. The service is what is making our family is excited to eat there again when we return to Vegas.  Candice I hope I spelled her name right. She was soooooo sweet and super attentive and just a delight. Like she made the experience THAT much better.  I can't wait to eat here again. I wish we had one in San Francisco  Thank you egg works!

eGkF0_CyqDo7fAoxyktCmA.text: We found this place on Yelp after a disastrous visit to the Crown & Anchor. This is everything a great breakfast place should be. Despite it being a "mob scene" on a Sunday morning we were seated and served pretty quickly and the breakfast was delicious. GO THERE FOR BREAKFAST.

tzASIUVPAOrStymHYP77RA.text: All I need to say is that this is not The Waffle House . This is the go to family breakfast/brunch spot! Those Diablo seasoned potatoes.... all that!

wDdQEgrpFYviOhIJ32f1Iw.text: Ashley was our server!! She is great!! Too be honest we have never had bad service at egg works!! We live in Chino Valley,Az. and everytime we come to Vegas we make sure to have breakfast at Eggworks!!   You can't go wrong!!! Love love it!!!

tNr5Eeays5fqlNW6QUCDHw.text: Really like this place for breakfast. Have enjoyed every breakfast item I have ordered. Service is great. Nice portions. Not a long wait I have been here many times .

HnQtEJMSyBMa8lQPQLQiog.text: This place cares for their customers. They care about the food and they provide!   The wait is reasonable and should actually be longer and I wouldn't mound the wait.  It's hard to compete with the strip but this place beats them hands down.  The staff are friendly very focused.   We had a party of five and nothing was missed.  We enjoyed our meals and were ready for the rest of the day.  The manager noticed that I didn't receive my food in the same time as my group and offered me a to go serving of their famous banana nut muffin. So yummy!   I enjoyed a banana waffle with whipped cream, eggs over easy and bacon... again so yummy!   My brother enjoyed his country fried steak and so did my friends.  I'll definitely be back again when in Vegas.  The place was clean and the crew were very polite.  See you guys soon!   Thanks for the excellent service.

y90ncAlUsutPDQ1qqsc2jA.text: Every time we come, we're satisfied. We love everything on the menu and the fact that everything is made to order. You can also get half orders! Be prepared for a short wait on Saturday or Sunday, but it's well worth it. Would recommend this place to everyone.

cI7YLANLhbU9bKPfTrSlrA.text: A large, really solid outlet of a local chain that serves diner-type fare, but in heaping portions and with a tremendous selection too.   The breakfast portion of the menu spans 4 pages, with myriad choices, whether eggy items like benedicts, omelets, scrambles, skillets, crepes; or other breakfast fare like burritos, pancakes, waffles, French toast, hash, biscuits & gravy, or country fried steak. So much calorific goodness to choose from that I had to come twice! The biscuits & gravy was perfect comfort food for a winter morning, while the omelets were quite hefty and came with potatoes and a choice of toast or a warm, housemade banana nut muffin (yes, please do choose the latter).  There are also more substantive non-breakfast dishes here like burgers, sandwiches, and salads. Service is super fast and efficient here, and there are plenty of seats, whether at the counter or at many tables throughout the fairly large venue. Simply lots of good stuff served fast.

0t4OYuka8B7aUZk0GNWDqA.text: Our waitress Shay was awesome! Great service to go along with great food. Love the Chicken Fried Steak and Veggie Skillet! Don't forget the nut muffin ( free if you check in here)!

JClP6wtKG1SmkfOnK-ITSw.text: Olivia (Liv) went above and beyond to recommend menu items since this was myself and husband's first time here. We read reviews previously  and decided to go here for breakfast during our vacation in Las Vegas. The menu has so many options to choose for every appetite! As we waited Liv asked us if we had any allergies to nuts or bananas, we said no and she brought us the BEST banana muffins we ever had....best customer service ever! Liv you made our visit memorable, definitely will pass along to our friends and family that will visit soon in the future!

QYGrDI1EZPoh83jMcoheow.text: Breakfast was delicious and our server, Cassandra, was AMAZING. She was friendly and very attentive. Made for a great Father's Day outing for our family.

QwQ5dNindAugnSCfI14nCQ.text: This is my FAVORITE breakfast location! They have the best potatoes and the food is always amazing! The staff is always friendly and kind and very helpful! Their banana nut muffin is so delicious! The hard worker that helped us, Chris is a very nice and deserves a raise!

i1AFKkI8PMQJ9fn7zaqbvQ.text: Always good and consistent. Staff very friendly. Mimosas are the best ever !!!! The potatoes are amazing the eggs are always perfect and the kids love the pancakes

541CWhbgrbtQQMaByYAT2A.text: Stopped by Egg Works before heading back to LA after reading about it in a little magazine that was in the taxi. We decided to make the trek out because of the free breakfast entree coupon. The yelp reviews looked great, so we decided to head to Egg Works instead of a typical Sunday brunch on the strip. Whenever we woke up that Sunday morning, we packed and stumbled to the car to get some breakfast. After about a 20 minute drive from the strip, we finally arrived at Egg works.   The place is relatively big, so the wait for 3 wasn't about 15 minutes. After being seated, we were promptly served drinks and then was left to look over the extensive menu. I decided on a side order of the corned beef hash and the Green Chili omelet. The omelet was extremely large. It probably had 3 whole Ortega chilies, a ton of cheese, and another ton of cheese on top. The omelet was good, but nothing special. Along with the omelet came a side of home potatoes that seemed like it was tossed with a whole bottle of Lawry's season salt. If you like that stuff, then you'll love these potatoes. If not, I'd see if they can cut the season salt next time. The corned beef and hash was interesting. It was more like corned beef and mashed potato pancake that was crisped on the flat top.   Overall, if you have time to venture beyond the strip, check Egg Works out. You won't be hungry after the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Means I&#39;m satisfied...for now...
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili relleno omelette

4yKCwsR85P6wJbhdzfItdg.text: Delicious seasoned potatoes and I always do the steak and eggs.   My family also loves the Cincinnati Chili.   They get busy but they are great at getting waiting time expectation to you when you arrive.

g6IeiTBh9F5ONaj22bGJfQ.text: The best breakfast place in Vegas. The service is the best. The staff is very friendly. The food is delicious!! Try the waffle works, if waffles is not your thing ask for pancakes instead.

QZdLrAHdoj4exgZ47J_c4w.text: Quick courteous service. Generous and tasty food. All the positive comments about the banana nut muffin are True. Come here just for that.

Sb10E3DNGzwetWr4KHXauw.text: Egg Works is one of the best places to eat breakfast in Las Vegas. i prefer to eat here than one  five star, highly rated brunch buffets in Vegas. They do not serve sushi and crab legs like the buffets, but the food is delicious, fresh and always hot.  My favorite thing on the menu is their pork carnitas crepe. Breakfast is served with a fresh, yummy banana muffin. They make one of the best BLT sandwiches. They serve fabulous bloody Mary's. And to go they sell delicious carrot cake.  There are five or six locations throughput the city and Henderson. I have eaten at three of them, each which had stellar service. The servers were hard  working and seemed happy with their jobs.

NcFwcDlZZZ7yAfdSqhkEWQ.text: So my boyfriend and I were hungry and found this place while we were actually sitting in Hash House a Go Go, and decided to bail on Hash House for this place :) Parking is everywhere - there's a huge lot in front. So when we got there we were seated pretty quickly. Our friendly waitress took our drink order, then gave us a few minutes to decide what we wanted to eat. As soon as we were ready, she took our order : I ordered a chorizo breakfast burrito (no bell pepper or onions), which came with hablo diablo potatoes. My boyfriend got a bacon ham and egg skillet which also came with hablo diablo potatoes.  Then we waited...and waited...and waited. Finally the food arrived, and mine was correct, but they accidentally gave my boyfriend's order to another table and gave him the wrong item. The waitress noticed the moment she put it down on the table, because there wasn't supposed to be mushrooms in his. We thought that it was going to take a really long time to redo his skillet, but it took less than five minutes to bring out a new one.  The burrito tasted amazing, and tasted even better with hablo diablo sauce on it. The potatoes were deliciously seasoned with hablo diablo dry seasoning, which tasted like obey seasoning.  My boyfriend really enjoyed his skillet as well. I tried it and it tasted delicious with the Hablo diablo sauce.  I would definitely come back here despite how long the food took. I just need to make sure it's not when I'm absolutely starving aka hangry :)  P.S. they have a check in deal for a free banana nut muffin

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon ham and sausage skillet with sour dough bread
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sad egg - we need attention! Lol (we didn&#39;t use this)
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo breakfast burrito with Hablo Diablo potatoes

LJW6XorQPnmR2XJ96G-wfg.text: This post is long overdue & has been in my drafts since late March. Anyway, I'm not a breakfast person at all, but my husband & kids are, so based on the excellent reviews we decided to try Eggworks. Man oh man, was that the best decision we ever made for breakfast!   The place was super packed & even so, the service was still excellent...that says a lot. From the greeter at the front door, to our waitress, & the gentleman that we paid our tab with we experienced nothing but smiles, friendly service, & nice conversation.  Now, the food...AMAZING! It's been so long so I don't remember the name of the omelet I ordered, but it was delicious & a HUGE portion. I'm a girl that loves to eat & can eat large portions, but even this I couldn't finish. Also, I'm picky about my breakfast potatoes & most restaurants just can't get them right, but Eggworks makes some damn good potatoes! My husband loved his bacon cheeseburger & fries too & cleaned his plate. Their food is so fresh & clearly their chefs/cooks know how to perfect flavor & texture. My kids also loved their plates & not only because they were delicious, but because they were fun to look at (pancakes/French toast with faces on them). If only my hometown or a neighboring town had an Eggworks...they just might have made me into a breakfast person.

zI3L9L94VTQlLKj69GTjKw.text: I'm in love with this place. The menu is extensive and honestly everything looks amazing. I bet I could order something new everyday for a year and still be excited to eat there. Our server was Kay and she was EPIC! She was kind and patient and gave no sign of inconvenience at my friends most special special-order requests. I ordered the Mexican crepe and it was so good I ate every last bite. It came with a side of potatoes and those were good too--but the main egg dish is what this place is all about. I tried bites of 2 other dishes and they were equally scrumptious. They have free WiFi here and the network/password is prominently posted. Thank you for an egg-mazing breakfast with fabulous service!

vhwjzDKRWAPfcs2WmlVWKQ.text: Get those Habla Diablo potatoes man. They're the best. Real good breakfast spot, reliable. They have a lot of locations around the valley and they're all great. I like to work there sometimes.

pQoxf0Q9Prlff_FWb0NC5A.text: Consistently a pleasant experience, became my go to breakfast place lol, Service is always fast, food is always hot, correct, and delicious. You can tell this place is ran well, 10/10 will continue to come back !

mtesZ-uKNg2Hl0Ntr9P5iw.text: Oh. My. Gosh. This place will rock your socks off! The value versus quality and portion was off the chain! I ordered the Chile relleno omelette which had a whole Chile stuffed with cheese, topped off with chopped cilantro and a big dollop of sour cream. You get a choice between toast or their banana muffins. I opted for sourdough toast. It also comes with their crispy habla Diablo seasoned potatoes- similar to using Lawry's salt by more of a paprika kick.   My husband got their blackened prime rib Benny- a skillet of prime ribs pieces layered amongst eggs and tons gooey cheese. It comes with their signature potatoes.   Yelp check in offers a free banana nut muffin. Our waitress was nice enough to bring my husband and I each a muffin. The muffin was sooooo good- dense, moist and absolutely melt in your mouth.   This place is busy but the staff handled it with friendliness and patience.   I'll definitely come back whenever I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There&#39;s a whole Chile relleno inside
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb banana bread

B3x-wO12ZWvsUmsCiyZ9PA.text: Nothing special. The place is located in a sketchy-looking strip mall. The place itself is so cheesy inside. They tried to go for a country feel and failed. Everything about the food was overkill. I ordered a veggie scramble and to my surprise it came covered in cheese. To the point that it felt like I was just eating melted cheese and not the veggie scrambled I ordered. The potatoes looked great but they were SO overly seasoned I couldn't eat them. The best part of the entire meal was the banana nut muffin, which I wouldn't even think is that great on its own, but given the rest of the meal, it was the best part. Skip this place and find somewhere else to get breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OoZbVAX8WgB6GfxW08Cddg.text: Wow! wow! wow! This is a great place. First time here, was extremely busy but were seated immediately. We sat for a while purposely before ordering so we could take a look at other people's plates. To our amazement, everyone's plates were filled the brim. Our wonderful server, Ethan explained they don't do senior portions however they do 1/2 orders.  As the picture will show, it was more than enough. The coffee was brewed to perfection and the muffins were so good we had to take some home. Every egg dish we ordered was delicious. Special thanks to Ethan for providing us great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mA2_M9UjN6XllmVaWEpf7g.text: Really cute breakfast joint that sells what else? Eggs, eggs, and more eggs. Omelettes, scrambled eggs, benedict, Poached Eggs, you get the point.   But we were the odd man out and ordered French toast and pancakes LOL. I ordered the corned beef hash with eggs over easy and didn't realize until I ordered it that the corned beef was from a can. Womp womp. My brother ordered their maple bacon French toast, which was just maple bacon cream with some regular French toast LOL. My friend ordered the pumpkin blueberry pancakes, and they were okay. This place does breakfast really well without anything fancy, but it wasn't over the top great.   5 stars for great service, and three stars for the food. So I'm going to average that and make it three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z3IxcK0T_QoQZ4jB2HH9Lg.text: Always read about Eggworks and finally tried it. I love the black smiley egg sign at our table which means everything's good and flipping it to the yellow frowny face means we need assistance.  We just needed a new bottle of ketchup and our friendly server was on it. The service is so good here.  I ordered Country Eggs Bennie medium and wow, it was perfection. I requested the country gravy on the side and our server remembered to have the cook prep it that way.  Also, this menu offers an island style cuisine which is brilliant as Hubs ordered what else? Portuguese Sausage with eggs over easy. Their signature banana nut muffin is amazing. Not too sweet or oily but moist and airy.  Also at our table were tablets where we had a choice of paying at our table or at the front.  There was a slight error as we had inadvertently pushed the gaming button. No prob, they took that off the bill. The decor is traditional, family friendly, country theme and very cute. (Outhouse sign for the restroom area! Lol.)  We were lucky to come in at a good time as it wasn't crowded at all and we found parking easily. We'll definitely be back to this or any of the Eggworks locations.

cPwmHwWeLqAqWKeqRHbD_w.text: First time coming here and the food did not disappoints. Where else can you choose banana Muffin or toast.  The muffin was extremely delicious and warm out if the oven.  The portions was more than enough.  I ordered the country fried steak skillet with sunny side up over their diablo country potatoes.  My husband ordered the steak and my daughter the country fried steak and eggs.  The wait staff was attentive and provided great service. I will definitely come back the next time I am in Las Vegas!

XdVwYWNvaL2K2b5QiTHGRQ.text: The quality of the food is impeccable and I have never left Eggworks without a huge smile on my face.  Cute decor as well the place looks like a little farm!

JAmlzyFkQxqW3i3A9RkSOw.text: Good place for breakfast and brunch. Though it's a really really busy diner, and the queue could be really long! We opted for the counter seating, zero wait time.  The staffs are really busy but also really nice, checking frequently if we needed anything.  We had Chilli Omelette and Centercut NewYork Steak. Food was good, as expected.

BbYypHJJq2B30o2AINc_nw.text: Good place to have a home style breakfast and wallet friendly off the strip. However BF and I went on a cold day and they sat in the patio with no heaters. If we chose to wait until a table opens we would be out last on the list despite already waiting 40 minutes. No bueno. If you're going to sit people out, at least have some heaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n41UlZCzXhHZm0lCgkKV6Q.text: The chicken chorizo hash is my favorite item on the menu. The green chili hash is awesome as well. Get them with their salsa on the side which is nice and spicy with a lot of flavor. The coffee is decent here too. Next I'll have to try the Chile relleno omelet. Such a huge menu I just have to get myself to venture out and order something different every time.  This is a breakfast and lunch place so they close early. The atmosphere is very family friendly neighborhood kind of style if that makes sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OWX3MYViIup8fgyS_PjU0Q.text: Love the food. Love the service. Love the atmosphere. Not fond of the tiny sitting arrangements don't plan a "meeting" just go to eat.  Worth it.

c1-zZYk-VAuNlzUnt_jhDQ.text: This place is super cool and I will go again!!! Their banana muffin with nuts are delicious. I also Love the little train that goes around the restaurant indoors. I'm sure every kids that would visit this place will be fascinated. EggWorks staff want to make sure that your happy with the way you order the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian French toast are the best!!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is you are not happy or if the order is not the right way you can just change flip the egg face to sad...
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mfwK6DYGwe4q5PkjrsXN_Q.text: Friendly, quick service, and the food is amazing. The portions are absolutely gigantic, so be prepared to get both breakfast and lunch. It's a very country atmosphere with wood-like floors, a saloon entrance to the bathrooms, and country music playing. I am not into country music, but it kind of adds into the whole atmosphere. The best part? They pour you a cup of coffee and then leave the carafe. Every time I come here I try something different, and every time I leave thinking that's the best I've ever had. This is my go-to place for visitors from out of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet cordon bleau
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potato omlet...ohmergawd

7RaLw2oPMXi6b8S_nZBt8A.text: Great place for locals to grab breakfast.  They have patio seating thats pet friendly, i've even seen them offer dog treats to the pets.  Portions here are quite big so if you're not too hungry you can possibly share one order between two people.  Considering the portion sizes the prices here are relatively cheap.  If you're looking for a breakfast joint that serves huge portions at a relatively low price then Eggworks is your place.   If you're looking for a knock your socks off tasting breakfast and want to take pictures thats eyes pleasing to post on social media, look elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X32k1W8zEZviQt35k1VbKA.text: Shantel is an awesome waitress! I had the Chile relleno omelet, it was delicious!  Will definitely come back next time I'm in town.

lIgmYAPAG5FZuZsFwqE73w.text: Danielle helped us today and she was awesome! Very eggcellent service! Always asking us 8f we needed anything and making us feel important! Thank you!

pbZQ0fmfjE2a-y0la17gbQ.text: I really wanted this to be better.  I had opted to go here because Blueberry Hill had a huge waiting list, plus the reviews looked good so we tried it.  The server was super nice and food came out quickly - both great signs.  The food however was just a little lacking.  The pancakes were dry and my Mexican egg dish was just so so.  The potatoes, while plentiful, again were just ok.  Would probably not return here again.  Next time, I will just wait at Blueberry Hill.

17vVQ9NR_X7hMXiedsYfrg.text: ANY egg choice you make here, you can't go wrong. Everything is EGGcellent and EGGceptional!!!!   I have eaten here for breakfast SEVERAL times and whenever I do, I am not disappointed.   What wins the BEST breakfast award, you ask?  Drum roll please:  The Mashed Potato Omelette:  Bacon omelette stuffed with garlic mashed potatoes and melted cheddar and jack cheese, dollop of sour cream bringing together my two favorite meal times, Dinner and Breakfast to make my new best friend BRINNER!   Best side dish award?   Corned beef hash and the FAMOUS banana nut muffin that EVERYONE has mentioned in their reviews!  My awards are the most serious of all breakfast awards- My cat told me so.

jz9vULDisYNtgbVyLIjbRw.text: As always, Egg Works rocks it out.  Great food, friendly staff, quality every step of the way. Our server, Ashley was attentive, knowledgeable and very friendly. The Island Favorite is always my go-to choice for a taste of the islands. Special orders are always OK!

jrH1UsgcnrSUPnF6l2LzcQ.text: What a great find for us. As first timers we weren't sure what it would be like. When the waitress (Donna) found out that we were first timers she brought all three of us banana nut muffins fresh out of the oven. Unbelievably delicious. The food was fantastic for my two companions, but my eggs benedict were very salty and I could only eat one. When I mentioned it to Donna I was blown away by the response. She brought us a loaf of banana nut bread on the house and took the charge off of the bill. She also gave us some discount tickets for the next time we came in. It was above and beyond. We will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas. Excellent, excellent experience.

-4ko7MGOu1sBqOlBVEMbEg.text: This place is ALWAYS a great place to eat! Sometimes there are long waits but only because they have delicious food. I would recommend to come during a weekday because the wait is much less than on a Sunday. I will always recommend this place to anyone looking to simply have a great meal. Our waitress, Macy, was especially delightful. Amazing service and sparkling personality. Thanks!

ajtvUh1vqhWvO_OEeulXGA.text: Awesome place for breakfast.  Candice, my server, is always warm and cheery.  Couldn't be more helpful or attentive to the customer's needs.  Omelettes are to die for here.  God Bless this place.  Best breakfast place in all of Las Vegas.

peH4Y38rQK3TO5R8TMDfzw.text: Our server Sarah was amazing!! She was so friendly, greeted us quickly, checked on us often, and cleared our table quickly. She made it a great experience!

Vwugr9xUfvzEYkQV2cJbkg.text: We sat at the bar on a busy Sunday morning and Shantel had the greatest attitude and awesome recommendations! I highly recommend this place if you have nothing planned after so that you can take a nap after the huge, delicious portions.

zdr4bqPNC9OxsYOEYZnOUQ.text: We're in town on vacation and wanted to try a local place for breakfast. We're so glad we came here! Our waitress, Donna, was so sweet and attentive! She gave us free muffins since it was our first time, and even gave us a free loaf of banana nut bread after the kitchen messed up an order. Of course they fixed the check too. The food was delicious, the staff was amazing, and we will definitely come back here next time we're in town!

qu7YaBUiUC7UhBaCcy__YA.text: Had the prime rib Benny, and the chile relleno. Both were amazing. Kathleen was a great server!

QvTfjTQpOT1h4XHxZW-3Eg.text: CANDICE is hands down one of the sweetest most attentive servers I have ever had at egg works. Great job on the hiring. Thank you for serving us this morning we will definitely be back to see Candice and have some amazing muffins!

xI_tB67Vx1ydCpVTGAwc0Q.text: This is our 3rd time here in about a month and we are blown away every time!  Today we had Donna as our waitress and she was AMAZING!  She was quick and our order was perfect!  The best day to go is a weekday so you don't have to wait too long but it is definitely worth the wait!  They have a huge menu and always have amazing specials!  Have the bloody mary it is the best!!!

oRioela0bRayjN7vBhyYMw.text: We were looking for a local type brunch spot - NOT a Vegas buffet. Egg Works was well recommended here so we found our way. Definitely locals eating here. My husband had the Santa Cruz burrito which was yummy. I had the French toast which came with Apple compote. Deanna, our server was happy to get me more compote which made my light and fluffy French toast perfect. Service was great. There were many waiting when we got here and we still had a table within 10 minutes.

_4vhq5vtRULPLbsANoPJ6A.text: Everything here is delicious! Waffles are great. Their toast is buttered for you. The banana nut bread is a must have. And the potatoes are diced nice and bite sized with great seasoning. Great breakfast option, especially since it's better than IHOP and the lines are shorter

6vZftBuaCdCUTgzJf5vJTA.text: I've wanted to eat here for the longest time, and I finally made it out. I must say, I definitely wasn't disappointed! Our wonderful server, Donna, gave us a couple (delicious!) complimentary banana bread muffins after finding out we were first timers, which I thought was awesome. I had the Works skillet, and it was beyond amazing. The mix of all the delectable tastes together created a perfect dish! And my boyfriend very much enjoyed his waffles. I think we found our new breakfast place!

I7OZ0u4UlCm1Ps345eiTAQ.text: Donna was our server & she was fabulous! The omelet she recommended was so yummy, I ate every bite. We love Egg Works.....best potatoes & banana nut muffins. I encourage everyone to treat themselves to a great locals breakfast & make sure you ask for Donna.

d30wb9Sr7oIKXfqMUGC5ng.text: Egg works is probably the best breakfast restaurant chain in town. We usually go to the new one on eastern near seven hills. This one is pretty much the same in quality service and excellent food.   Donna was our server and always close by to check on what we needed. We never had to wait long for refills or anything else. We might have to start coming to sunset over eastern because Donna was so great.   We had different omelettes today and both were delicious. The potatoes are always amazing even though I'm usually a hash brown guy. Won't stop coming to egg works.

PEkFR7G4AaMYFDffwS7q1g.text: It was a good hearty place for breakfast. Nothing earth shattering on the menu and no gluten free bread but that's ok. The eggs were cooked well and the bacon was crisp just the way I like it. The kids loved this breakfast of french toast for my younger one and a french dip for my teenager. :). The best part of the meal was the service. Hector was super. He was warm and friendly, fast to bring us drinks and get our orders. He gave great advice and followed up well. We felt like we were well attended without being nagged which is a hard thing to do and we really appreciated his great service. Definitely recommend for a solid, yummy breakfast with good service.

2rSL2ypKYI8vcWaFbrTM8Q.text: This is an awesome restaurant. Food, breakfast, and muffins were all great. Obviously it was packed when we got there, we waited 15 mins and it was all worth it. The waitress asked us if it was our first time and we said yes and she gave us free muffins. Make sure you use the groupon discount if you are cheap like me!!! But I paid it back to the waitress as a tip. She was awesome!! Very attentive and helpful with making our choices.  We will go back again and will recommend them to friends and family!!

lF1nuwar-EH-h-hKXa27Mg.text: Great breakfast food and excellent service by PK!!! Will definitely go back for another friendly and delicious breakfast.

QaNRv3taiBBx9H7EyWit2A.text: Can I just say excellent?!!  I wish they were open longer hours. They have the best tuna melt sandwich I have been able to find in the Las Vegas or Henderson area.  They have many other items including their breakfast items that sound wonderful I just can't break away from the tuna melt!  I have only visited the one on Sunset and Eastern but every time I have been there excellent food and excellent service.

e3ZFhqbxIIRh0wmf6JmV_Q.text: Crowded for a good reason.  Hearty good food.  Had a burrito and was great.  Potatoes are interesting and unique and yummy.

RWqfqmXaT1SB6HRzq2ghuw.text: Bacon avocado omelets are very good. They might have the best breakfast potatoes too. Muffin starter is also very generous but is so good it ruins the appetite because you can not stop eating. Good friendly service.

eATbJrp3BCEb-80qZXGVRw.text: We were looking for breakfast close to our hotel off the strip and yelped this place. What an excellent find for breakfast/brunch. You really get a home feel with the great food and the beyond excellent service. Las Vegas has a reputation of rude people, but Egg Works has done a great job finding hospitable waiters.  I got the Skillet Breakfast with chicken, mushroom, and spinach with toast. The portion was large and packed with ingredients to get an excellent taste. Also, if you check in you get a muffin for free. I waited for the toast but my waitress was running all over the place. It is urged to flip the egg to a sad face if you are not happy or need something. I flipped it for 1 second and the quickly the concerned waitress came over to see why I wad not happy. She quickly resolved the issue and was so nice about it. Jaime had a great attitude and I wish all waiters/waitresses were this helpful. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the neighborhood and looking for some family friendly breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet Breakfast - Chicken, mushroom, and spinach

HKeo8W3ERV6mZIaUbm7NFw.text: Always a great place for breakfast. Shay was awesome and the best server ever. Always my first stop for breakfast in Vegas.

iDgs_70bQuOnlPljZzQfWg.text: This is the go to place for breakfast everything was amazing here. The service the food the atmosphere. If you like good food come here! They have a big selection and everything they have is most certainly delicious!
