5e_nezyRLfHQ9brVpO081g.text: Great family atmosphere! I've come down to this fine establishment with the family and also with co-workers during he lunch time hour and their service never ceases to amaze me. The food is great and good portions. They have plenty of options for breakfast lovers. They also have a Hawaiian option which was a nice treat. You get a muffin if it's your first visit make sure you let them know!   My only gripe with this place is that they don't split the bill or give you separate checks.

WlxTSIvlH1zkvKsQSUm5yg.text: Service was good, but the food made all 3 of us sick,and we ordered different breakfasts.  Pricey, mot appetizing, and a health risk-RUN AWAY!!

9oJP6jDRVgl9gxdQiGAI_A.text: This place is awful, my wife and I were both ill after eating here.  I should have known, each time I asked the waitress how something was, she told me she never tried it.  Now I know why...too bad she didn't share that!

-2CSie7KbMq5mUS_aApHdQ.text: Olivia was an awesome server I will definitely be back. The breakfast was great and the banana nut muffins are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelette

4OviWDfBCcQOEzH9KlOd3A.text: Was in Vegas for rock and roll half marathon. My wife and stopped for breakfast. Waited for a table for around 20 minutes. Service was good. I ordered the biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon also came with potatoes. The potato's were very salty I wasn't able to eat them. The food was ok. My wife had a omelette and it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast bar.
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable omelet.
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy.

c_DNNBkH-ytnErdfeiwJBQ.text: Easily the best breakfast in the city, and no question the best corn beef hash I have ever had. Every other hash is out to shame with this one.

9QRwXRS-GMoiGNa0-AgIKw.text: Wow!  Breakfast lovers this is worth the trip!  We contemplated Gabi at Bellagio yet opted for low key, off the strip breakfast before we dive in to crowds and casinos.  This place is exceptional!  I had Brads Omelette.  I did substitute bacon for mushrooms.  So I was boring right, no Benny, no stuffed toast, yet I felt it was one of the best omelettes I have EVER had.  Brad must be a big deal and the menu is huge so Brad, consider a "Brad's with bacon" it was out of this world.  We shared a warm, fresh, banana nut muffin that was on the house from the relationship with Yelp.  It was incredible too!   Most important though.  The service.  The young people who greet you are exceptional.  Our server Chris awesome.  From the minute you walk in and they greet you at the foot snd seat you, to being seated, to being served it feels like family.  And is a great marketing engine for the good people of Las Vegas!  Great job guys!   This is not a fancy place. It is practical.  If I didn't know you t was a chain I would have sworn it was a stand alone family restaurant which it must be yet they have preserved that personal touch as they have expanded.  I am from out of tow, great personal Vegas experience.  Wonderful way to start your day off strip or before catching a flight out early off strip.  Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is Brads Omelette with bacon substituted for mushroom, Simply Amazing!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brad is apparently a big deal cuz he has a &#34;Barn Room&#34;!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V6y45LUW8V7f-Eeo29ZpFw.text: I love eating eggworks. Our server was wonderful this morning. The food is similar to home cooking. I would not recommend the sausage links but I would recommend any omelette. There's also a lot of vegetarian options to choose from. This place is also great for a hangover!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ry95u2N1iv3wbGvz_pF69w.text: Just stumbled across this place.  Great service and food at reasonable prices.  Highly recommend.

RDijNCIfPeLu2d-12hiejA.text: I absolutely love their breakfast options. The servers are quick, friendly and very accommodating. I come here at least twice a week with my kids for their breakfast options. I usually get the chili cheese omelet and its amazingly delicious. While my kids love their mickey mouse pancakes with a side of scrambled eggs. I definitely recommend this place. Come here and you wont be disappointed.

8utcn0ROWElWfv4p_TsieQ.text: Banana nut muffins are good, good service good portions for the price for breakfast. Omelette is filling and good size. I like the potato side with the omelette instead of the usual potato thin hash browns certain places use.

UStmepYc6FqKG3JMSLf3Rw.text: You can never go wrong with this restaurant. The variety of items they offer and the quality of food and the service it's just amazing

iegKUAI0a77SnhMtvLPb1g.text: If you find yourself in Vegas, AND you have a slight hang-over AND you're in a rush to fill your stomach with SOMETHING don't come here. Keep your vegas strip lovin butt away from this local gem. If, however, you want the best eggs in Vegas served with the genuine diner service at the speed of light you've found your place.

HUuDo8segSETqjlpUhdKMw.text: Amber was our server, she was excellent!  Blackened prime rib benny was delicious, my boyfriend got the stuffed french toast which was amazing. We were greeted and seated promptly, coffee pot on the table for easy refills.  Wonderful meal.

pSgf3v7x5wnv3_pO0QA6tw.text: Absolutely love this place food is awesome staff is great and we will continue to come back here! A little added bonus for our visit today is that were enjoying our breakfast in the rain and our waiter Christian has a awesome personality and was verry respectful to my family! Keep up the good work guys!

chW44pxVp8i1DxohTvviog.text: i wrote this place off as being just another breakfast spot for a while now but this was out first stop today! and man was it the right choice!!!! its my new favorite breakfast spot.  the omelets are stupid huge and comes with a mountain of potatoes.  both of ours where perfect and they come with delicious banana muffins ( some came home with me). i cant wait to try there banana nut french toast next time.   we shared a plate of the pancakes, there not bad but they just didnt seem all that spectacular but in all fairness we where already stuffed when we got to them.   our server Ashley was amazing! its hard to find some one who is excellent at there job and still fun.   overall its a little on the spendy side for breakfast food but the quality and the service justify it. we WILL BE BACK!

oef6hNiZG74_bV98TYGTlA.text: We love this place. Tasty food & friendly folks. We got eggcellent service this morning from James. You should send that guy to disneyland!!! Lol!

MmZWZm9j0LDnRmz_OKAdog.text: Food is exceptional! Best breakfast in Las Vegas complete with mimosas! The skillet breakfasts are huge but set a great base for a Las Vegas vacation!  Donna is the best server! We will definitely be back!

rDCtNYnpZrPhkzNZiK3mKA.text: Love this place a must when in Vegas. Our waitress Candice made it very pleasant to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy and huge!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow!! Yummy!

Jy3wRlZNLYMdjIuWDZfkvA.text: Brady was our server today HE WAS ASWOME Love the hair. :) a bit of a wait but that is to be expected. Staff is always friendly doesn't matter what spot we go to we have been to 3. Had to flip our egg because our katcup was empty not even one sec someone was helping. Love this place.

syM6qY8AeJwv0bV-jy4q6w.text: Brandy is a great server. We came two days in a row, and ordered some of Brandys selections- great idea!   We went around 2:30 and we didn't have a problem having a seat in the bar area (one day) and the main dining room (the second day).  Anything you have will be great!

dT8q4DhbUfmuhUaQnOl6Jg.text: We were a party of 4. We had their traditional eggs Benedict, the vegetarian eggs Benedict, the French toast with strawberries, and the plain French toast.  my eggs benny veggie was awesome English muffin fresh sauce really good the French toast is a big portion and I was with small eater so they could have shared an order.  Service was really good and prices were reasonable really reasonable this place was busy and you can see why. Highly recommend it for breakfast

ZKbafWysz3lcwct23Fx_ig.text: The chili relleno omelette was the bomb, add the sour cream and salsa.... Party in your mouth! I can't wait to come back to Vegas to have it again... It is a must try fo sho!!

qWXxnfOrt5coGwzFgU91YA.text: Donna provided excellent service and was attentive to our needs. She was pleasant and provided quality service. Table 36. Sunset and Pecos on Saturday May 9 2015.

HNno5EeGCRqutLRvRMXhrQ.text: Nice little breakfast place. Good food, friendly place. Our server Ash H was egg-cellent :)

iji5Uh-hNducWOMWOFsBYg.text: Just stopped here a few days ago based on Yelp reviews for some breakfast and it did not disappoint!  Great service and food was tasty!  Nothing blew me away, but was a legit solid breakfast stop.  Will definitely come again someday.

sow7LZf8gr9bCVq4KuSfwQ.text: Welcomed and seated with NO WAIT. Rare for here. Rosa from Mexicali was our waitress. She gave me her list for Christmas and I gave her an iPhone, iPad, and a car...she gave us complimentary muffins.   The muffins were wonderful. The coffee hot and smooth, the avocados in the omelet were scrumptious.   We had a great experience and I want to take Rosa home. I want to take all these folks home and into a kitchen just like this but at my house.   I am never disappointed here. Merry Christmas; Happy Hannakah.  Santah

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa and Egg Works BOTH?
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OOedjd9DrF_6QebUyL93sA.text: The food is good & the service is always great! Never had a bad breakfast here, only thing I don't like is there were people smoking on the patio. There is nothing worse than trying to enjoy breakfast but having to do it while inhaling someone else's disgusting habit.

IvaR2bp-SXBf3qoZ39lvlg.text: So glad that we found this place when we were undergoing a week long of continuous alcohol consumption in Vegas. Us girls were being obnoxious drunk bitches at 11am when we stepped into the restaurant, yet our lovely server treated us with much friendliness, even sitting herself at our table as we chit-chatted our way into placing our orders.   With her recommendation, I tried the corned beef hash with two eggs over easy. According to my memory under the influence, that corned beef hash was the best that I have ever had. With ample home-cured corned beef and perfectly cooked taters and eggs, I soon was under the spell of food coma. So, friends, come with an empty stomach, and prepare for a satisfying and reasonably priced breakfast in Vegas.

bNPQCiXzZS5sQGN_U7e9ZQ.text: As simply put, mediocre at best. There was so much hype about this place and even had to wait 15 minutes. Why wait 15 minutes when you can get virtually the same thing if not better at other breakfast places? On top of that, my waitress was very slow to serve us.   My friend, girlfriend, and I had already chosen what we desired yet, we waited an additional 10-15 minutes. It was busy but there's no excuse for waiting that long. I got the corned beef hash which was not that well cooked and the hash was shredded way too excessively. It was almost as if I'm tasting carnitas. On top of that was scrambled eggs, which there is nothing bad you can say about standard scrambled eggs. The potatoes were actually quite good. They had some kind of salt and spice that was addicting. But there's a problem when the side tastes better than the main dish.   Overall, mediocre food, below average service. Would not consider this an option for breakfast brunch. I would rather starve and wait for lunch if I had to.

Jx-qV7zmffu0jBZpsdRTVA.text: My first time in here and the food and service was outstanding! Brady was an excellent server and took very good care of us.  I ordered "the Works" omelette and a banana nut muffin and they were outstanding!  We had to wait 10 minutes to be seated but it was worth it.  The place was full but they were efficient in handling us.

e_v-XJcUiB5p27mu4dIRMg.text: Pretty good.   Everyone in my party was satisfied.   I only got eggs and yummy sourdough toast this time but have been here many times before. Stuffed French toast Italian sandwich and Mexican skillets are all yummy!!!! They offer half portions that are huge too!!!! They have flavored coffee creamers too!   Won't hesitate to come back.

j_4ZX43ixXZImgrlTZOHcw.text: Great food!  Large portions!  My eggs Benedict were cooked perfectly! And the muffins were to die for!  Thanks for the excellent service (Jessie)!  We will be back!

DETVzPIts0D3qzNCive9JA.text: Best breakfast spot in Las Vegas.... Every time I come to Vegas I have to eat at egg works. Erika was the best server

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin is a must
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon avocado omelette so Delicious

UMK8ETvHFe6_UU2-5Dviyg.text: The food is pretty consistently good...especially the muffins.  We substitute their tasty potatoes for refried beans...don't get me wrong.  I love potatoes but it can really add to your waste line (or muffin top - haha) if you're eating badly all the time.

Jf2oSNg_HfALjWW65Kl-pQ.text: We have officially lived in Las Vegas for a year.  How have we never been to Egg Works before now??  We literally live right down the street and we drive by this location almost every single day. I'm honestly ashamed of myself.  Now I have seen this place on a weekend and it is crazy packed! But, being a Tuesday mid morning we were seated right away and it had a decent flow of customers.  Maya (our wonderful server) came and greeted us right away. One of the things that stood out to me the most about our entire experience is that everyone working there seemed genuinely happy to be at work. Everyone was bubbly and all smiles and it definitely made for a great dining experience!  The hubby ordered the Chile Relleno Omelet and I had what I would describe as being their personal take on Biscuits and Gravy.  Everything was delicious! We especially loved their potatoes, they had a wonderful seasoning with a light kick!  Another major bonus is when you check in on yelp you get a free Banana Nut Muffin! So moist and tasty!!

wY9rEeMNwW5J7hCfc0Bm1A.text: I was lucky enough to get Ash H. as my server today and let me tell you...she knows A LOT about eggs and their origin. If you have any egg questions just go ask her. She got me in and out of the restaurant quickly and the food was amazing. She also wrote a heart on my receipt which now explains why she gave me a larger piece of fruit than normal. Love is a crazy thing....but anyway go eat here.

0o4cLVjmLpgIPpdkE6LQWg.text: Great food, decent service, middle of the road prices.  Husband and I have enjoyed different samplings.  Pancakes, omelets, original benny, french toast, etc.  All good!  Kids breakfast meals are limiting.  There is only one pancake option.  It's a mouse pancake with a weird face on it.  No bacon or sausage.  This is a major issue with my ten year old.  He is too cool for the face and wants some meat.  He has ordered lunch or off the adult menu to avoid the mouse pancake.  I tried to talk him into asking the waitress to not make it a mouse and we could add a side of bacon.  Instead our server talked him into an adult meal that he had for breakfast the next day too and I threw away the eggs.  I won't be back with the kids.  Three times now and we just couldn't make it worth it.  I would like to try without kids.

_tXhijpPV2pLDsJ5E65noQ.text: Eggsceptual food and eggcellent service.   Reina was a very attentive server. Eggsceptual food and eggcellent service.   Reina was a very attentive server. Eggsceptual food and eggcellent service.   Reina was a very attentive server.   I hate the fact that I was forced to install the Yelp app in order to post a review.

q7wvxAHioNhRj39cQFQ0Qw.text: They have the best Banana Nut muffins, great customer service and the food is delicious. Jaime is an awesome server.

J3JBsxFM34T-InLJWlsUPw.text: I love breakfast!  It was my first time here and EW2 didn't disappoint. Even the 20min wait was worth it. Great, friendly service even during a packed house at noon on a Sunday. Accommodating our large group was not a big deal.   Reading over the newspaper like menu, there were so many items to choose from even three hawaiian dishes! I went with The Works Skillet, even though the stuffed french sounded amazing. The works skillet is packed with flavor and textures. I really enjoyed the banana nut muffin as well. My sis got the Haole Moco and that looked very good as well. The other orders in our party all looked great. (drool)  Being in Vegas, I had to keep the vibe going, so i got the Greyhound (vodka and grapefruit) and it was darn good.   Also, we had two birthday celebrants in our party and our server brought out decorated banana nut muffins with a candle. We all sang "happy birthday". That was fun!  EW2 you're now on my list of favs in Vegas! Being off the strip, it's a nice little drive away from the touristy atmosphere.  Also read, Joanne C's review. :D

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. greyhound, banana nut muffin, the works skillet... yum!

DRFsrgvr9QuDaytByp3EwQ.text: First time here.   Nashay is our server.   She is very pleasant and helpful.   An excellent worker.  First we started with a muffin.  That was excellent.   The meal I had was a chicken fried steak skillet.    It was delicious.   The coffee was very good as well with little flavored creamers available.    Over all, this meal was perfect.    I will return again.

YQW8bfgEqm1OnQwNoksJuQ.text: Great food and service was fantastic. Will be back. The staff was friendly and made sure I was happy with my meal.

MMSrG45I-ItbZd1W7n5tgQ.text: Are you a fan of Egg and I on Sahara?  Then this is the same place with a slightly different name.  In fact, it's the same newspaper menu too.  The difference between Egg and I and this place, so far, is no wait.  Usually when I head to the Sahara location, I have to wait.  I will come over here from now on.

tx5cICQ-JfXd7RY5qpi45Q.text: The best place to have breakfast away from the strip, food is delicious and great variety, can't go wrong.

AeCFNaYUDc0SMo5FXPmkPA.text: On this freezing day, we were greeted by our wonderful server Candace! The food was great and she was awesome!

bMci1Il-BE6Fhtvjd32Geg.text: Such amazing food!! I've taken maybe three bites and I'm in heaven! Thank you Ashley H (our server) for being so awesome and letting us know what's good for our first time here!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tradition Eggs Benny with extra hollandaise on the potatoes!!!

vH3zhsWyZWbpmP5vGI0tQw.text: This place is awesome food, service and atmosphere get a 10/10, Cris our waitress was very helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this place! We will definitely be back.

0VvzCNorR3n5xakgsi1lQw.text: The food was fantastic. All plates came with more than enough food. Prices are reasonable. We were a group of 5 adults who came in at 9am on a Friday and all of out food came out in a timely fashion. The place is REALLY clean so I was super happy about that. The decor is great. Music is playing at the perfect volume in the restaurant (for easy chatting) and in the bathroom (for self conscious peoples).

GWyyWvuRPHafgDilfuIzdg.text: I Love this place for breakfast, great food, reasonable prices. Donna took care of us today and she did a great job, very courteous and friendly. We got seated right away and was greeted by Donna promptly. We are visiting from out of town and this is a great local spot to go when you want to avoid the crowds. Make sure you use the Yelp check in offer to receive their yummy banana nut muffin for free!!!

Not-E8IDKTjMvH7AQHAF-Q.text: We were looking for a great place to eat that wasn't a part of the strip, and was relatively cheap but better than Denny's. This place is awesome! Great atmosphere. Tasty breakfast food which is higher quality than any other breakfast place we've been to. Relatively inexpensive prices.   Very impressed and we will definitely be back next time we come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool way of signaling you need something!

Csl2NBb2G9KKnbQOwlBn4w.text: I had the prime rib Eggs Benedict and would highly recommend it. The hollandaise sauce was done very well and I liked the use of a croissant instead of an English muffin. My friend had the chorizo corn beef hash and he was not so pleased and felt it was rather bland. The bloody Mary's were not so great either. Very plain. I gave four stars because the eggs Benedict was so good.

CdrnKRW8rZX8XQW2JbJQVw.text: Amazing! Service was awesome! Everyone seemed to enjoy their job. Food was GREAT and out to us within a timely manner! Wish I had a egg works where I live! Definitely recommend trying if you're ever in Vegas.

aWTDhLiBodYbISzb7NeSxg.text: Great service from Donna on Sunset and Eastern!!  Thanks, Donna!

3-310l8mwtA9zwQbFArVgw.text: Donna was GREAT! Our first time here and it won't be our last. We loved it. Best Biscuits & Gravy ever. Don't even think about adding the eggs and meat...too much food. A++++++++++

GT9WZhE8Ip3134rHKGfdDQ.text: Came in for breakfast, blueberry pancakes delicious, service PERFECT with Ashley! My son had a cheeseburger with the works style, said it was the best cheeseburger he's had in awhile!

SAhkpwZmk85tGNWZaNfS7w.text: I was pretty impressed with this place. Nice atmosphere, good prices and very friendly! I had the corned beef hash, it was homemade and you really could tell. It was really good. This will now be my goto breakfast place!

Ks5wzfqGIyTFXoM5jbMQzg.text: Visiting Vegas for the weekend - our group of 13 came here twice...everything was great. Donna, our server made our dining experience a memorable one. She provided great recommendations with a smile!

ZDQgUOtfgb-LltYr7i6UyA.text: The service I received today was mediocre at best. First I received something I didn't order that my server, Ashley, assumed I ordered, but definitely did not. Then my table had asked for banana nut muffins and she forgot to bring those as well. I normally go to the location further South on Eastern Ave toward Anthem and have never had an issue. The server seemed to have a very lackadaisical attitude about being at work and did not try to please our table. Along with this, the manager on duty apparently wasn't capable of buttoning up her shirt or moving around very much considering she stayed in about the same 5ft of space my entire visit. Just didn't look or act very professional. I will keep my business that the other Henderson Egg Works location considering I have a much better experience.

ZLohWYj4wWdNhvVhfSGSSQ.text: Donna should go to Disneyland!  The avocado up sell in the veggie omelette was fantastic!

nOE0uU43l0rie5Ufb3NooA.text: Four stars for the food, 3.25 stars for the service:  Food:   The potatoes have me dreaming for them at night.  That seasoning is delicious and it has just the right texture.  The first time I went here I had a crepe with avocado and pico.....I can't remember the name of it but it was delicious.  Service: Hmm it was okay.  It could have been better considering that they have eggs on the table to show your server whether you need service or not.  I thought it was genius at first but then began to think of how impersonal it is.  I enjoy servers coming up to me randomly asking how everything is and my water magically re-appearing.  That's when you know your service is good.  The fact that they rely on the clients to passively flip a sign is kind of a turn-off.  Come and talk to me... I won't bite.

vFhIcmDf0aVoe3aTeWhZPw.text: I came to Egg Works with some skepticism.  I am not a huge fan of eggs.  The only reason I came was to attend a focus group survey meeting.  I came a skeptic.  I left a fan.  I ordered a Hawaiian breakfast.  I had rice, Spam, eggs, and fresh fruit.  It was great.  I love Spam and the egg yolk mixed into the rice was a delicious combination.  I have not been back since that time because it is not on my side of town.  If I do make it back though, and I hope that time comes, I want to try the biscuits and gravy.  I saw somebody order that and it looked awesome.  The plate, more of a platter, was huge.  The biscuits, though thoroughly covered in gravy, looked to be big and fluffy.  Even from a distance I could see the sausage in the gravy.  I must try this.  The food I got was great.  The food I saw looked amazing.  Service was a tad slow but it was a busy Saturday morning.  Wait staff can only go so fast when the restaurant is near capacity.  That is another sign that Egg Works is nothing short of grand.

oEozd7G1P6pXbjdP-SolsQ.text: This was my first visit to this location.  I had been to Egg and I on Sahara and decided to come here for their Bloody Mary and breakfast.  It was delicious and Alohalina provided great service!

IR3FkqlUa6EDu8LoTB7TbA.text: To be perfectly honest, I'm not the hugest fan of breakfast food.  I realize this is odd. However, this restaurant does something I don't care much for very, very well.  I always have special requests regarding my breakfast food (egg whites only, I don't eat potatoes so I always have to make substitutions) and I've never felt like I am being a nuisance.  Their omelettes are divine.  The service is always friendly and quick.  I can't really say anything bad about Egg Works 2!

30dx2zy-zohJPUgWZiwybg.text: The food was just out of this world and the server Daria was the best grade A+ all around thank you for a great breakfast I'm full okay later

zqcpFFz6_3jYKxBE4jt0nQ.text: Wow.. I was pleasantly surprised!!! My hubby and I went here after purchasing a groupon. When we walked in, it just looked like a regular old place... to my surprise it wasn't. The food was good and the service EVEN better!! We will be back for sure!! Our waitress was Christina S. She was amazing!! Very friendly and helpful!!

0OAjYbqwXgm5-FpkX14Tmw.text: Great place to have a good breakfast!! Everything was really good and great service!! 5stars for u 2 Candice!!

GCpPfJ19F_Dd1gcm0U4Rrw.text: My only breakfast house. Best in Las Vegas always a friendly staff and the food is amazing!!!! Have to get works crepe or enchilada omelette.

OT7FoBIoy5blY3cuvlf9wA.text: First time here and DONNA made me feel so welcome and provided excellent service!  Delicious food as well!

K7HjVB3rrvDrnAS87HqHVw.text: Love escaping the office for an early lunch when I am craving breakfast.  Always good and the perfect size for me when I order a half omelette.  Candice is a great server and it really has a family feel.  If you sit at the bar it is almost like dinner and a show watching the staff interact.

iD5JiQcqgy0lZqr8sJix7w.text: Food was wonderful, service was excellent,  ask for Donna her service is amazing and she's a great person!

zmntnQdDKVMqZ7v3xHar3A.text: Solid breakfast with a very extensive menu---seriously they have every breakfast option one can dream of, with tons of Vegetarian goodies!  Not gourmet quality but always good.  The service is great and the staff works as a team always.

wq5mrhREalVqtXWs6v5hng.text: Kudos to anyone who does not have to take a box to go because the portions here are huge! It took us a while to sort through what we wanted to try, but we ended up with the fiesta skillet (with salsa and chili), the country fried steak skillet, and a cup of chili. The main orders also came with a banana nut muffin that the BF really liked. His country fried steak was much better than mine, and I think that was partly because the salsa didn't taste fresh (I envisioned something along the lines of pico de gallo, I don't know why) while his gravy was sooo good. So that would be my recommendation. The chili was fantastic too. We ended up taking half of each skillet, plus almost 3/4 of the chili home. And I swear we were hungry to begin with!  I think this is a great option if you are looking for more local food in Las Vegas that's off the Strip. Oh, we also found a buy one entree get one free coupon from a coupon book (the ones that you get anywhere on the Strip) that we forgot to use. Ugh.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

okJv1LuVBXccKqZKIAlx2A.text: Awesome breakfast and brunch place.  We had our family reunion in Vegas, so there were 31 of us.  They didn't take reservations on Sunday, but they were very accommodating for 8:00 am and a party of 31.  The service was awesome, our server, she was so personable and on top of things, a real PRO!  Their egg dishes are humongous, 4 eggs!!  And a lot of delicious sides.  The chocolate chip pancakes were a hit as was the waffles and all. Of their egg dishes, their scrambles and egg combos are delish. Sis had the egg crepes, too yummy and big. Such a diverse and large menu, you will be sure to find something!  The seasoned potatoes were awesome.  Great restaurant, great service and awesome wait staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 egg omlettes
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

Fa9awnqfVHWeD48p6rCDiA.text: Excellent place to have breakfast off the strip. Love the service and food. They are so accommodating and very customer service oriented. Our server Jessica was simply amazing. Will definitely come back.

vT4e21xp1Je_IZNYHht6WQ.text: Wow, I feel bad for everyone who wrote glowing reviews.  They obviously have been subjected to really awful food all of their life.  I got the chicken fried steak with over medium eggs and one of the muffins everyone raved about.  Everything came with enough salt to preserve my digestive organs for the afterlife.  The potatoes are cheap, frozen cubes soaked in season salt...inedible.  the gravy was also way overseasoned, might of had some potential if not for that.  The banana nut muffin was nothing to write home about and had a weird texture.  The husband got the avocado bacon omelette.  Though he is a hearty eater, two thirds of his food was left behind.  The omelette had a ton of cheese melted over top, usually a good thing, not in this case.  The cheese looked plastic like and he said it tasted microwaved.  He too had a large portion of blood pressure killing potatoes.  The kid had chocolate chip pancakes.  Nothing to write home about but apparently way better than what we got.  $41 for this lousy meal.  When we paid, the lady asked how everything was and my husband replied very salty and terribly overseasoned.  She responded by giggling like a school girl and telling him the total.  Way to handle a complaint there.  A $2 egg mcmuffin beats this junk any day.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheap frozen potatoes soaked in season salt, inedible!

YVkiz3_HVrBHOKbZmFqw1Q.text: I come here for lunch during the week bc it's fast delicious & close to my office. Marc is an awesome server. Very friendly & provides great service. One of my go to spots for a weekday lunch.

0hU6X_Jd23fftqvzImVcRQ.text: Extensive menu, generous portions, great flavor... and friendly staff to boot! We'll be back!

RI30HJ9HXD6_k10LfzP47w.text: Rob was a phenomenal server!!! We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast!! The carrot cake muffins and carrot cake French toast are equally delicious!! Looking forward to our next visit! In the meantime we are headed back to Cali with full tummies and smiles! Thanks Again Rob for taking great care of all 13 of us!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FsIJuWAUeuoU9kW7uTF-Lw.text: I had read the reviews online and wanted to try it.  The food was pretty decent the portions were large.. We took the muffin with us when we left and ate it for lunch on our flight back to TO.  Omelettes were tasty and my husband's home fries were good.  I had fruit on the side in place of the home fries and it was a decent sized portion.  My husband liked omelette house more so we'd probably not go back.  However, I would recommend this place if you are in the area.

VDJda4Rml6KoCDIqihzNxA.text: Great service and great food, quite the menu! It's a little noisy but worth it. This place feels like it's been a mainstay in Las Vegas for a long time. No matter what you want for breakfast they've got it. The wait staff is always in a big hurry but they manage about 95% accuracy. I have to say that it's one of my favorite places to eat breakfast in Las Vegas.

N03bt4pnQAsdkCsoSEDsEQ.text: Had the mashed potatoes omelet and it was delicious!! Also don't miss the opportunity to try their banana nut muffin!! Was one of the best breakfasts i've had on the road!

s-IJAA8EXw2iYiN4wZsTBw.text: Went for brunch earlier todat. It was my first time there and I loved it! I had the Mashed Potato Omelette and it was sooooo good. My boyfriend had the Fiesta skillet, also good! Get the banana nut muffin they are to die for! Sami was our waiter and she took great care of us. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed Potato Omelette!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh out the oven! This banana nut muffin was sooooo good!

IEEHf-7cCfCq-jKue9uN5Q.text: No wait at the Diner Bar. Excellent food, Potatoes are Fantastic. Cappuccino was great as well. Will definitely be back.

-tbeIMPRZEdvZx470LgLXQ.text: There's places where I want a table, and then there's places where you sit at the counter. This is definitely the latter.  As I sat down, I noticed the sign above the toasters: "You don't have to be crazy to work here. We train you."  And I instantly fell in love with this place.  The food, while excellent, is almost secondary to me to the controlled chaos in the serving area.  One gentleman with complete control of dishes exiting the kitchen. While servers, including Shantel, my server, seamlessly flowing in a narrow space.  Definitely not something I could pull off. Yet they all made it look so easy.  I hope to get back here again.

m5X1rplAZBUVXoLcH3gO-A.text: Great breakfast!!! Nice vibes. Great presentation the side of fruits was amazing. Wonderful waiters especially Robin

rrd2vMSeXXxUR1wcpsYP8g.text: Gotta try the Prime rib egg benny! Austin made sure the poached eggs r perfect when he served us the foods. A must come breakfast place in Vegas.

SvTC7IEaEliLKhzesA8RDA.text: I was uneasy walking in.  It is a huge space with tons of people waiting for a table and the background roar of the hungry breakfast crowd is hard to ignore.  But before we knew it, the hostess is calling our name and we're being shuffled through the restaurant to a more than accommodating table.   Christopher, our server, was great.  He checked on us frequently and was very courteous.  I had the special for the day, the firecracker scramble.  It was cheesy, spicy, saucy, and huge!  Everything I wanted.  I actually fed the last of it to my fiance -- I was defeated.    The banana nut muffin is ridiculous.  I don't know what to make of this thing.  The muffin top isn't your run-of-the-mill rounded little top, but a flying saucer of sorts just perched right up there like nobody's business.  I'm upset we didn't get a dozen to take back with us.  Ain't no muffin like an Egg Works muffin!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firecracker scramble -- breakfast special.

ONbVjf7oz0HJUwSmLa5T1A.text: Egg works is the breakfast place of heaven! Everything you order here taste amazing! The stuffed French toast, unstuffed and the sun rise mountain are definitely my top two go to breakfast meals! The service is great, food is great, what else can you ask for.

1kM97qpsThXNfgPClkd9DQ.text: We've always had good food and service here. Very large portions are a plus as well as it is a great value!

4hBtAcJPyQG6TRke4nlBBA.text: Ash H. provided egg-cellent service. Ordered the County Benny and it was great.  Food: Amazing Water quailty: Good Bathroom: Clean

dvCF2L8B0iadmbZUcA_AgA.text: Awesom job, Ashley! Loved the food and the waitress was terrific. The mashed potato omelette was yummy licious!

oHYuArUErIAaChkDWeUWaA.text: Shay rocks Thanks for the amazing service. The food was awesome and our wait time was perfect.

idK6RArs6SfoB6WAGJk2_Q.text: Excellent service, yummy food, awesome portions! Got a great deal on Groupon: $26 for $40.   We beat the rush before 10am on a Sunday and only waited for about 5 mins. Greeted promptly and food was fast. We ordered two orange juices but the server offered a carafe to get more for our $. The server also gave us a free muffin because everyone had but one. He also helped us out with the menu, answering any questions and giving us ideas. Also, the portions were huge. I only ate half my omelet.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mash Potato Omelet, 3 stack pancakes, banana muffin, and loco moco
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6oaCCK8_HgLLpuOJAAD0-w.text: I arrived at 11:42 am and this place was packed to the rim and real busy too.  There were those guys in front me and said "2 and first able seats" and the lady said " it's going to be about 35-40 mins wait time" and ask for their cell phone to text them when the table came able. So many people waiting to be seated but since I was a one person, I was able get a seat at the counter.  I was able get the corner counter and be service pretty quickly. OMG bad idea to come on 11:45 am to lunch time and real busy and so many people waiting. After 5 mins, she took my order of coffee with my French Vanilla creamer, Waffle with 2 scramble eggs and ham. I waited about 20 mins for my meal to be served. They were so back up in the kitchen and about 12:20 pm the ticket service shut down and no tickets to be enter for about 15 mins. But I was lucky I got my bill prior to the shut down.   So my bill was $14.29 all together without the muffin ( add $1.95 for the muffin to the bill).    Over all I'm very happy and my stomach is totally Satisfied.  If the counter is able on very busy day, up to 4 people together nicely.  If not, you'll need to waiting Patiently!!  It's worth the time and effort!

tWoIS7Ok3ZYosK0Pi-bjzQ.text: Rating is 4 because  - excellent service  - friendly  - wait time for 2 is only about 10min and they text you when the seat is ready  - -1 star bc it's too much for me. What's too much? It's literally heart stopper with high calorie and there's no fruit/salad. Better, cheese, mayo... lots of salt.. you'd like it if you're into that kind of stuff. Not my favorite. I won't order California crepe again. Potatoes are good, again it's very salty.    What we ordered  - California crepe with bacon mushroom and cheese  - banana muffin from Yelp check in  - classic eggs Benedict  - lemonade  - coffee   Tip:  Now I like it when my drinks are unlimited refill so I'd recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Er4B5_VNF8RzKeP2qDUxGA.text: My favorite breakfast place in Vegas! Prices are reasonable, the service is always great, and the food is to die for! My favorite is the stuffed French toast and the homemade banana muffins.

vkcrYx-UJzsgulqY3TtaDg.text: I LOVE this place and ever since I found it years ago, I always make sure to make a stop when I am in Vegas. I rave about this place and always tell people to come here because it is genuinely one of the best breakfast joints around, and considering I travel a lot it's saying a lot. You may be asking then why I am giving it a 3 and that's because they (today) they changed the way/recipe of their skillets and I was not made aware so I ordered it and to my surprise it was literally like eating a whole bottle of salt. I don't eat salt and the flavor literally made me spit my food out. I don't complain about food EVER but it was so bad that I needed to say something. The manager came over and informed me of the change to the way the prepare it that took place the day I came in (my luck) and offered to make me a new one. By the time the new one came my stomach was so upset that I couldn't even eat it. The waitress did everything she could to help and was apologetic as was the manager but still didn't resolve the issue. I hope EggWorks goes back to their old way because this place truly is amazing but I don't want to pay to eat salt.

y5P1FLBV_QnpgpQErwTA4A.text: I love this place. I want to try new breakfast places around town but always end up coming back here instead.  THE POTATOES YOU GUYS!!!! ...the potato seasoning is so good (they also sell it at the cashier so pick one up on the way out and put it on everything you cook at home). Everything I've tried on the menu has been delicious - eggs benny, omelettes, skillets! Service is always fast and friendly. Try the Bloody Mary!

nwFYsxAzTlE-eO3dtnOUdg.text: Great staff. All smiles and work as a team.     Sunday's are busy but worth the wait.

Dexj3FL4-NXMl0-ee_5Wtg.text: I changed my review to five stars due to the fact this third visit was a success. Recently I put three stars due to the poor service but this visit really improved in service, plus Sara(our waitress) was very attentive and friendly, that it changed my perspective of Egg Works. I would very much like to come back again for the great food and the friendly service.

u9sdi31xxoMK4r_Qo1Y9Bg.text: I have waited until I've had three bad experiences at this location, and yesterday was it. We went on Sunday for my partner's birthday, and waited 30 mins for a table outside, although there was only one other couple on the outdoor patio at the time (8 tables outside).   When we were seated, another 10 mins before a waitress asked for our drink order. That took another 20 minutes for coffee to arrive (without cream/sugar).   When we ordered our drinks, we shared our fabulous YELP checkin bonus of a free muffin. When the coffee and orange juices came out, there was no muffin. We reminded the waitress of the muffins, and she came back with one of the two muffins, and no butter, about 13 mins after we reminded her (yes, we'd started a clock at this point).  We reminded her we had two checkin muffins, so she went for the other muffin.  17 minutes after that (now we're 1 hour, 17 minutes into our visit), she brings out the other muffin and wants to take our order.  We explained we just wanted the bill, and we'd go to a different Eggworks.  We waited 7 minutes for the bill to arrive and then deposited $5 on the table and left. The manager followed us out to the parking lot and offered us a coupon for "Buy one, get half-off the second meal."   This particular location has been nose-diving since November of 2017; I doubt we'll ever return. This location went through a period last fall where the potatos were drowning in heavy spice and other condiments, to the explanation of "Our owner likes it spicy, so he insists we deliver it that way." odd that other locations weren't like that. The location on Eastern is much, much better, the staff is better, parking is harder, but we've never had ridiculous waits, never had bad service, and always very much enjoyed the experience there. 30 mins further from our home, but well worth the extra drive on a Sunday morning where relaxation is the goal.

eKy3FqK8uBeN8O5RxbGNeQ.text: This place has probably the best breakfast I've had at a restaurant in a long time. I had the Portuguese sausage with egg whites and hash browns. I also had the strawberry stuffed French toast. Everything was excellent. The staff moved quick and seemed like they had been doing this for awhile. Everything and everyone worked fast and efficiently. I sat at the counter in the back and the young waiter was great. He made sure we had everything we needed. I can't remember his name... but he was great! Oh... and the banana muffin we got while we waited for our food was excellent! Next time I'm in Vegas it will be a must stop!

ICToZZ-87Jp0M8Ge4yqI9w.text: I was excited to check this place out after seeing images of their breakfast potatoes on yelp. They looked so crunchy, savory, and delicious! We drove about 9 miles off the strip to eat here and unfortunately the experience was just okay.   The environment is very homey...and old timey with a farm mural all over the walls and a "general store" by the entrance. Their eggs were cooked really well I'll give them that! I ordered a skillet and I really wish I hadn't. My skillet cane with potatoes, chilies, a hugeeeeee amount of cheese, and the over medium eggs on top. Sounds good right? Might have been good if it wasn't totally and completely smothered in their house salsa of which I wasn't a fan. This made the potatoes have no crunch, the cheese was overkill, the salsa was subpar and not spicy at all, and I basically only enjoyed the eggs.  Service was fine. We were able to order quickly and were checked up on. When we went to the register to pay we were ignored for a couple minutes while the two working at the register were chatting nonstop.   I definitely would consider coming here again because maybe I just didn't get the right thing. This place definitely seems to be doing something right to draw such a crowd.

wtLuVO4-5wx55U8_8YvPVA.text: I'm be honest I'm not a big fan of breakfast Especially the time you have to be up to eat that. But this food was pretty good I had a tasty breakfast sandwich with the best banana muffin I've ever had. Service was average. This place is just a good place to have a nice american breakfast

lnNJMWW6hShzTOVEdoEssg.text: Went to Vegas on March 11th. When I got off the plane, my sister and I was super hungry so we did a search for breakfast places near the airport and Egg Works came up. This place is AMAZING! When we arrived we were greeted by the hostess and was seated right away. The server came within 3 minutes and took our drink orders. My sister ordered their mimosa and I had regular coffee to start. After drinks the super nice server took our meal order and once it arrived OMG I fell in love with this place. I wish they had a Egg Work in Maryland!   Overall, our experience was positive here. We came back again on March 14th before we left Vegas to head back to Washington DC and the food was very consistent. Will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas very soon.

QUelae5s-4vI01LLhYrIWg.text: Delicious if you love comfort food.  Portions are generous.   A must if you want so yummy food at good prices

e3za5FcMCMhGz-f5rqaRGg.text: This is a great place to have breakfast and it is a sit down restaurant in which the customer can eat out side on a nice patio shaded from the sun or in the inside at nice tables. If you like eggs this is the place to be their scrambled egg taste just like mom used to make on weekends for us kids. Sometimes the servers seem that they don't want to be there but work is work.

xxY5vukDZKqz9YgY8uigFg.text: I absolutely love loco moco and i couldn't imagine finding AMAZING loco moco here!! It's so yummy and the meat is super duper juicy and thick! I usually get over medium eggs for loco moco so the yellow egg yolk can be runny with all the gravy, rice, and meat combined! The rice was sticky and perfectly cooked, the egg is exactly how i wanted, and the meat i got was well done and so flavorful! I couldn't imagine having this amazing loco moco and beating my all time fave place to get loco moco (L&L).   The service was super fast & caring. The server was really attentive and the food came out fast as well! There wasn't a wait time despite it being packed! I love how there's a variety of american breakfast dishes as well as hawaiian! There's so many different dishes options. The portion plates are huge as well! Their menus are adorable newspaper style, with a lot of cute decorations around the restaurant. I love eating breakfast here!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOCO MOCO - Well done patty with over medium egg, sticky white rice, and gravy!! (Also with a banana nut muffin!)

2TefMjxLpk55v7LE5fIlEQ.text: First visit eating from this establishment was a disaster.  My co-workers and I ordered from here and when I received my order, I was disappointed.  I ordered a Cesear salad and tortilla soup.  I received a regular house salad with Cesear dressing and the tortilla soup tasted like they dumped an entire salt shaker in it!!!    I called the establishment, speaking with a manager, Cat, and she was very apologetic and rectified the situation.  I appreciate her thoughtfulness and the fact that she was genuinely sorry for what had happened.   After reading these reviews, I will still stop by and see what their breakfast is like!  Thank you again, Cat!

eKeizb76tzMuLLm2tE_MjQ.text: Best breakfast hands down. Had me a skillet with a side of pancakes. Delicious. Waiters are friendly and the food comes out hot right away, deff going back in my next trip to Vegas

KA3k3qf3Fn95T9OsibleHA.text: The 3 pigs omelet was so over cooked. It made it taste bad. I cant believe you would allow that to come out of the kitchen. Sad part is the cook knew how bad it was and decided to plate it anyways. You were on a short wait, but that is no excuse. The fruit was wonderful. Will not return.

k2iAWDvMm7V2ZxtkeD03eQ.text: This location is great!!  Awesome service and food all the time.  I had a mashed potato omelette and it was to die for!  I was concerned that it would be dry since potatoes are starchy, but it had the perfect texture.  It's a bacon omelette with garlic mashed potatoes inside, cheese and green onions on top, and sour cream on the side.  Whoever came up with this recipe is genius.  I had to add my own salt/pepper as it wasn't as seasoned as I prefer, but the quality and value were spot on.  It will run you $11.99.  You get a choice of toast or their homemade banana nut muffin -- the muffins are made with love and sooo delicious..they're how I initially got introduced to Egg Works.  I wouldn't overlook Egg Works if I were you; you'll never leave unsatisfied.

W-NJ4swm7Cdc_vbkMSuQHw.text: came here for breakfast time around 11am on a Monday and it wasn't packed at all! it was also my first time here and the service was amazing. They also offer a check in for a free banana nut muffin, which was amazing! Also don't forget to check out their Groupon offer!   suggestions: if you're not into breakfast platters like eggs, pancakes, etc, I recommend getting the Club Ranch Melt or the Works Cheese Steak sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. top: works cheese steak with Cajun seasoned fries bottom: ranch club melt with Cajun seasoned fries

iIhwaphrnbsbsYc7yF4dow.text: Great service, great food.... I mean... how can u go wrong with eggs?  I love the ambience and their walls!! Very comfy.... the server was very attentive and funny. He accommodated my kids who asked alot of questions, which I encourage them to do. Their menu is sooooooo long... lol... I loved it! So many options.... portions are really big....   The free home made banana nut muffin with Yelp check in is very moist and must use fork or they'll all end up under your fingernails.  The onion rings are the best I've tasted! The potatoes aren't as good as the reviews said they were and the sauce in my omelet was a little salty.... but still a definite must return. There's so much more to taste!

MyyhG0RIDItN8cclMdqruw.text: Omg this place is delicious! Big portions as well.   What sucks is there's like no internet service inside and the WiFi can't connect. Had to go by the wellsfargo to open my groupon to redeem my coupon. Just take a screen shot of the voucher to save time.   I got the works omelette minus the mushrooms & ham & added spinach & avocado. It comes with toast and potatoes. Omg this omelette was amazing! I loved it cause they cut up everything really small, so it's easier to eat. The potatoes were real good and seasoned.   My sister got chocolate chip pancakes and they were delicious! Very chocolatey.   Everyone loved their food.   Feels very country inside.   Definitely would come back here. The price you cannot beat.   It's cool they have a black and yellow smiley on the table. If you need something just flip it to a yellow smiley and they will help you.

j5UEAaqJbYEmVf8Wespkwg.text: 3.5 stars  Came here for breakfast, and got the homemade corned beef hash, eggs over medium, english muffin which also came with their famous Diablo potatoes and a free banana bread muffin with yelp check in.  The corned beef hash, although home made, was the shredded type with boiled potatoes; Kind of like they are trying to recreate the canned type.  I prefer the cubed pieces of corned beef and potatoes that are then crisped on multiple sides.  The eggs were cooked well and the portions were large for the price.  What i liked most was the seasoned potatoes, i think most of the breakfast dishes come with them too.  They are crispy and taste like they are dusted with creole seasoning i wish they just threw in some cubed corned beef with these potatoes, that would be an awesome corned beef hash!  Also the Banana bread muffin is terrific and worth ordering instead of your bread choice.  Service is friendly and efficient, they leave a pot of coffee on your table so you can refill yourself as needed.  I thought that was a terrific idea, since it frees them up to service other people rather than going around and constantly refilling everyones coffee.  Theres also an iPad thing on the table so that you can pay for your meal at the table, also another way to free up the servers so they can service more people.  Someone else in our party also got the Gumbolaya a combination of Gumbo and Jambalaya, it was ok, but nothing special.  I'd definitely come back for the banana bread muffins and the Diablo potatoes.  Need something? They have a happy and a sad egg posted on each table, if you need something just switch it over to the unhappy egg and someone will come by and ask if you need something.  Its almost like a Brazilian BBQ where theres the green light and red light.  Though they seemed very efficient, i dont think anyone really need to use this.

Eayj9ry0XolAz339ZHHeig.text: Second times the charm! Tried a different location last time we were in Vegas and it wasn't that great. But this location made up for it.   It was busy, but we got seated within 10 mins for a party of 4. Our server was a familiar face, when I say familiar, he was also from the Islands. Friendly and attentive service, Ethan was very welcoming.   We ordered:  Chile Relleno Omellette, the Bacon Avocado, bacon egg sandwich. All the meals came with potatoes and a banana muffin.  Everything was seasoned just right. The portions are generous. We had to take a meal to go. We shared a great conversation with Ethan. Next time you're in Vegas, stop by for a hearty, comforting meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Relleno Omlete

61ND-5jzYaaD2FjlIBQ0qg.text: Chris, you are the best.  Our server was so welcoming for first timers. He made sure we tried the banana nut muffins and left with a box of them!  We stopped at this location for breakfast because it was close to Ethel M.  They have large quantities and are big on quality. Everything was good. Came in on Sunday morning around 10 am and the wait was only 15 mins. They work as a team, so the service is great.  I had the blackened prime rib benny on a croissant. So flavorful. My son had the chicken fried steak.... we all had some of his breakfast. It was a lot and very tasty!  My daughter ordered off the kid's menu and she had a cheesy egg scramble. She wasn't able to finish hers because she kept sneaking bites of the chicken fried steak. Their breakfast burritos are also big enough to share.  I would definitely go back again and try some of their other options.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Need attention, flip to the yellow egg

EGpOksO7cLg4jZabRAg_hg.text: I drove past this place many times whenever I was in Vegas and I've been meaning to try it.   I finally got a chance to try it this past holiday weekend with my boyfriend and friends and was very impressed. Not too crowded, got seated right away, and because I checked into Yelp that day I got a free banana nut muffin, which was delicious!!   The menu was a little overwhelming , but they have a lot to offer and I was not complaining. I was torn between getting a traditional eggs Benedict  and corned beef hash. But as someone still looking for the best eggs Benedict , I had to try theirs.   Food came out fairly quickly and the portions were pretty big, especially the fried potatoes.   As of right now my favorite eggs Benedict is still from Squeeze In , but their eggs Benedict was pretty dang good and had good flavor. My favorite part of the dish was the fried potatoes as it was like having French fries in the morning and the really good crispy ones.   Overall, I was pleased with this place and would come back for some good breakfast. I am aware they have multiple locations throughout Vegas and assume the other places are just as good. Def a place I recommend stopping by if you don't want to get an expensive breakfast and somewhere that is outside of the strip.

F3mzdt5qESHn25HA2XAexQ.text: Love this quasi quaint breakfast stop. Was surprised I had not heard much about it via advertisement. But boy was it good! Friendly staff and quick service and delicious healthy well priced food. Excellent combination of things to make my breakfast worth venturing out and trying a new place. Good job Egg Works folks!! I now have another go to spot for a good breakfast without a big price for me. Yay!

_k1J9i9kRhIobT-QGoT5JQ.text: Egg Works is local chain for Breakfast & Brunch in Las Vegas, NV.  Established in 1988 and renamed to Egg Works in 2005.    Egg Works is known for their famous Cincy Chili along with breakfast favorites, signature sandwiches, and homemade soups.  I ordered the following: - Mimosa - *licks lips* - Spinach Benny - described on their menu as "English muffin grilled golden brown, topped with Canadian style bacon, fresh spinach, and two poached eggs and smothered in egg-ceptional hollandaise sauce" - Banana Nut Muffin - free with Yelp check in (when I visited in March 2019)  Loved the food and service!!  ENJOY!!

p9Z0c1cC82tq8h41vfxlWg.text: So much food for a great price. Banana bread was AMAZING! Super moist and delicious. I got the prime rib benny and it was . I thought it might be weird with croissant instead if muffin, but that made it 10x better. They give you honestly too much potato. You'll be full and you'll be happy.  only gripe: cinnamon roll kinda sucked. pretty dry and not fluffy.

MU5_hqrf5TxHU8Uu35eaSA.text: My husband, two sons, my daughter and I stopped in to eat brunch for my daughter's 23rd Birthday on July 3rd.  It was busy, however we didn't have to wait very long for a table. The host seated us at a large booth that was both clean and comfortable. The menus were at the table so we immediately perused their breakfast and lunch offerings. My husband ordered the eggs, sausage patties and fruit. My son ordered tortilla soup, my other son ordered a Philly cheesesteak sandwich, my daughter ordered a Denver omelette with fruit, and I ordered a yogurt parfait. My husband and I chose coffee and ice water; my daughter drank lemonade and my sons ordered Pepsi.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive. She was patient as well because my son didn't like the Philly cheesesteak; she took it back and substituted a cheese omelette with home fries for him because she stated that they want customers to be happy with their meals. Come hungry because they feed you here! The portions are large and filling. They use the freshest ingredients and everything is made to order. My daughter has Celiac Disease so she has to be very careful where she eats and what she orders. It's possible to eat here but one must inquire with their waitress or waiter prior to ordering their food. We checked in on Yelp and received a free banana nut muffin-yummy! This is the second time my husband and I have ate at this restaurant but the first visit to this location which is conveniently located close to McCarran International Airport. We used a Groupon and I had to pay $24.00 more dollars plus I left a $10 tip for our wonderful waitress. I recommend dining at one of their restaurants. We've been to the Eastern location as well. Their restaurants are clean, welcoming and efficient. The staff is great!

DnIuQGUGgilV0y8GDdENaQ.text: In town to visit family. This location was nearby. We tried their other location on the east side of town on another trip. Both times I left disappointed. To be fair, I'm visiting Vegas. So I want something memorable. But that's just it. Their food is not bad. It would stand fine alongside Denny's and many an American diners. But there are so many unique and above par options in Vegas, why waste the opportunity?  FYI if you do go, stick to breakfast. The burger taste like it is over mixed with A-1 Steak Sauce.

K-bXkQodIaCxm40iWUalPA.text: We initially visited here because of the great Groupon that they had and I am so glad we did come because the value and the food was top notch.   The service was spot on and she was able to answer any and every question I had about the menu. The menu was super cute and was newspaper style. Also it included a lot of variety with different options for people.   The food portions were very large as you can see by the pictures. I ordered two meals and it was under the Groupon amount.   The atmosphere is that of a small diner with wood furniture and decor.   I definitely recommend the chocolate banana muffins as they are freshly baked that day and are to die for... really they are that good.   I would definitely come back if I'm in the Vegas area.
