hj-dEVaaN-CU33o5Q0Oxig.text: So if you ever end up taking an early flight to Vegas, stop by at this restaurant. It's been around for a while. They have an extensive menu including spam and eggs. You will find that most dishes are tasty but be prepared to wait a long time for your food. The service is inefficient which was a bummer!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

niNOosbLHcvPcpfDu054ww.text: I visited Egg Works not too long ago with a large group, and the staff were accommodating, attentive, and friendly. The meal began with the banana nut muffins; the other reviews check out- the banana nut muffin is moist and delicious!   For my entree, I ordered the Benny with Spinach; a classic staple of your traditional millennial brunch. Let me start by saying the portions for everything, including the Spinach Benny, are pretty big; and as someone from California, these prices are more competitive than what we have there.  The English muffins were a bit soggy, due to an abundance of hollandaise, a lack of something to separate the hollandaise from the muffin, and what I believed to be a very lightly toasted muffin; however, these are all things that can be adjusted on request. It doesn't change a well poached egg, well-prepared hollandaise, and great portions for a reasonable price.  If you're in the area and on the hunt for a brunch place, give Egg Works a shot- I didn't regret it, and I don't think you will either!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Benny - Eggs Benedict with Spinach

hERHzfQ60begO9DFA7O5Rw.text: Had brunch here while traveling to Las Vegas. Cute environment and nice service. Most importantly I had the best crepe here! Will def. come back for a breakfast if I ever visit Las Vegas again!

bGgEADBbMZILZG-XrWk1Ww.text: The environment isn't the most fancy or nicest, but the service and the food more than made up for it! Our server, Nashay (hope I spelled that correctly), was AMAZING! Super friendly, helpful, sweet, without being overly intrusive. She really made us feel special, too. Give that girl a raise, cause she has customer service down to a science!  The food as always, was solid. We both got the French Toast combo, and it was more than enough food. Coffee was hot and fresh and Nashay even brought us some flavored creamers.   The yelp check in bonus was a great surprise! Yay muffin!   If you go to Eggworks, you will be in for good food, but if you're lucky, you'll get seated in Nashays section!

6nxmLPGn0gDDIfwKBAF3rw.text: Fantastic and Savory!  We are from out of town and we're looking for a good breakfast so came across this place!  Egg Works!  The wait is reasonable, food amazing and the service to say the least.  Our server Cassandra did an amazing job helping us.  Definitely placing Egg Works on our favorite list for when in town again. Thank you!

GolvRjNdeQsIHyO0l3beFQ.text: Found in Paradise, Nevada- this place is a True match to its location name.  The feel of a True country eatery only minutes from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas strip.  The newspaper style menu offers any breakfast option you could want.  The True peak of this dining experience are the complimentary fresh-out-the-oven banana nut muffins for first time patrons. A must visit to start your day in Vegas whether your prepping for a day at the slots or gearing up to head north for hiking and beautiful views.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash

J6yWXGBt8lQ00fH6Ki6xRw.text: Best breakfast place in town. My husband and I come here almost every weekend. The food is always made fresh. Always huge portions, and at a reasonable price. All the employees are extremely friendly as well. My favorite thing here are the habla diabla potatoes, or as I call them "crack potatoes". Today we brought our pups with us and ate on the dog friendly patio. They gave us a bowl of water and some milkbones for them.

PT8YSOJTnZLpCoThF76SNg.text: Hubby and I went on a business trip recently, and turns out our hotel for us did not have complementary breakfast. Which is fortunate for us because we came here every morning for breakfast while in Vegas. Yes it's that good.  Service wise we were always seated right away. Waiter was always attentive to us. The first time  we got there, our server noticed I was checking in on yelp and she got me the banana nut muffin with out me asking.  Food: They give a lot of food. Whatever I ordered I could never finish. I love that they have lighter options that you can sub out instead of potatoes.  Most of their breakfast meal come with toast or the banana nut muffin. GET THE MUFFFIN. Seriously, it's good. They bring it out nice a warm and you can put like a slice of butter and it will melt at make it ok so yummy. In all honesty though it doesn't even need the extra butter because it nice a smooth.  The first day I got one of their skillet dishes. It had spinach and chicken with eggs (preparers the way you like it), all over the diablo potatoes. I liked how the potatoes were seasoned. It had a nice kick of spice to it. But if your looking for more spice you can add more of their diablo sauce. I couldn't finish it because I was too full halfway through the meal.   Second day, I was really craving smoothing lighter do I got the breakfast parfait and a small stack of banana pancakes. Again it came with the muffin. This time the muffin was a bit of and edge like it was left in the oven just a tad bit longer, I'm one of those people who fight the the edge piece in brownies-it gave it the little extra bit of texture that I love. I guess I didn't learn from the first time, they came with huge portions. The parfait had mandarin oranges, strawberries, blueberries, and bananas layer in between the granola and yogurt. Banana pancakes was loaded with bananas. It was sweet enough so no need for syrup.  By the third day I was craving some local Hawai'i food. And lo and behold they have some Hawai'i favorites. I saw the loco moco but I really wanted some country gravy. No problem they have a play on the loco moco called the Haole Moco. It was yummy. By far my favorite breakfast item. The country gravy really went well with the hamburger. The mushrooms  also added to the flavor. Makes me wish we have the haole moco back Home.  One take away, come hungry because you will leave stuffed.

JcUiju9sdcOusNFiqUhH-A.text: I've been to egg works at least 5 times and every time, everything is delicious. The banana nut muffin is amazing. They also sell it In loaves of bread and carrot cake as well. I highly recommend giving them a visit. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. Each table has a little egg that is smiling and if you need help just flip it over and now it's a sad egg. This tells any staff member you need help.   Also careful when you order the Cesar omelet  I thought it was Cesar like Cesar salad lol But it means Cesar like Hispanic. Still delicious   Try the banana nut muffin. I cannot emphasize how amazing it is.

-Mb4AeffPPBZFbbZo3IG0A.text: Good place for breakfast, stayed very busy. Plates were huge definitely enough to split so you can try multiple omelets. The banana muffins are freshly baked still warm enough to melt butter. Service was good. Would go again.

3w5yWRpjnB9U9KxoBDtBpg.text: The food was okay, the service wasn't so great. We wanted a booth so we were told we had to wait about 5 minutes which was okay with us. Then the host gave our booth to a party that arrived much later than us. I made my complaint to him about the first come first serve rule. The place was busy so if the host gave your spot to another party who arrived much later you would be upset as well. In addition, our waitress got our side order wrong. We ordered ham on the side of our meal and received bacon. She then made me switch out the bacon for the ham and made me put the bacon on a separate plate. Which I think she ended up giving those bacon strips to another customer....which is not okay. The ham we received was dry and the eggs were dry and unappetizing. The staff consists of young people who lack the responsibility to run a restaurant.

V5GO0WGqpgPO9jkPJPcjYQ.text: We ate here today for breakfast.  It was delicious!!  If you are local or out of towners like us, you really should give this a try.  They open up at 6:00 and if you're flying into town what a way to start your day off right while waiting for your hotel room.  They were great about substituting fresh fruit for potatoes.  Hot coffee was plentiful and we were given great service by Kris.  You won't be disappointed!

Lo7DwiVpAkA2s0g9rkoriA.text: Oh Egg Works, how I adore you! Of course this chain would become big after I move to Los Angeles. This location is so close to my childhood home, every time I'm in town, I come to eat here. I absolutely love this place!  Today was just another 5 star experience. Amy helped us at the counter and was seriously one of the best servers I've ever had. She knew based off my hesitation between potatoes and fruit, that MAYBE I might want half and half! And guess what? I DID! She was very nice and friendly, kept our water glasses filled and sitting at the counter couldn't have been any better.  I got my usual, the breakfast burrito (traditional one) and my husband got Brad's scramble. He was a huge fan of it because it had mushrooms in it and he wasn't aware it would come like that, but oh well! The toast was great! My breakfast burrito was beautiful made and that Diablo sauce really just tied everything together.  The woman next to me got this beautiful French toast option, if I wasn't trying to watch my weight, I would have easily ran off with her French toast.  Can't wait to eat here again, wish these were in LA! So happy they've become successful in Vegas. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qjyATTq7Epw4jlZd9x0mgA.text: Staff was friendly, food wasn't that great. My husband got the hash and it was mushy and flavorless.  I had the country Benny which was ok.  Potatoes were good but super salty. It was busy so obviously people like the place, maybe we just chose wrong?

cJt3FEICzw1ewZuxRE2l9w.text: Great breakfast stop after a long flight from Pennsylvania. In-flight snacks suck and we were starving! After picking up rental car and Yelping breakfast we were delighted to find Egg Works.  Service was friendly and fast. Decor was fun and bright. The food was delicious. I had the breakfast burrito and it was stuffed full, hot, and not too greasy. My wife's western omelet was also a huge portion and the potatoes were very tasty.  A great find that we will definitely visit again.  The banana nut muffin was highly recommended but we were stuffed.

DhPwd3Lp20umDLofAat0Wg.text: I stumbled across Egg Works on a Saturday morning while driving around on a "find a place to live" mission.  It was really busy.  Since I was alone, the hostess suggested one of the open spots at the counter.  I took a seat between a friendly couple and the unfriendly reincarnation of Jimmy Durante.  The menu was overwhelming - which was a good thing since I was pretty hungry.  My server was quite nice, and didn't seem at all rushed in spite of how busy it was (in fact, all the employees seemed to be in a really good mood despite the crowds).  I ordered a coffee and the loco moco.  Both were very good.  I've had loco moco in Hawaii many many times, and this version was every bit as good.  The rice and patty were cooked perfectly, and the gravy was flavorful without being overpowering (they also provided extra on the side).  I consider myself something of a breakfast/diner snob, and I really liked Egg Works.  I won't be a full-time Vegas resident for a few more weeks, but I look forward to making this place a regular breakfast hangout once I get there.

sFM2Ce3SXpNJ6Dp9e5kTug.text: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE. We have been eating here regularly for about 4 years. The food is very good, as is the service. Two of my favorite items on the menu are the Corned Beef Hash and the Chili Relleno Omelet. They both stand out, have a delicious unique flavor. We had a few minor problems on our last few visits and decided to, as politely as we could, mention them to the manager. We spoke to two managers who were both excellent listeners and genuinely interested in our input. They both offered, pretty much demanded, to pay our bill and gave us a loaf of their delicious banana bread to go. It was a very pleasant conversation and was refreshing to hear both managers genuinely concerned about us having a great experience there and we will continue to make Egg Works one of our favorite "go to" breakfast spots.

F3wBWwwm4HnkUpoRkA-kVA.text: Eggcelent..lol. First time we tried here and we are hooked. Portions are huge and service was amazing. Our server Candice was really prompt and she explained the menu thoroughly for us...I used my check in for the banana nut muffin and it was Good! Definitely we will be back!

T0Kjr9v0LKkUWdemYNdSzg.text: This is a must stop for breakfast every time we're in Vegas. The huevos rancheros with green sauce is AMAZING. Service is always great, ask for Donna! She was the friendliest waitress we had all weekend! Great coffee too! The original coffee, not the fancy crap just plain ol good ol fashioned coffee!

wJ7Vl6dbhEYDPhiFfr5rzw.text: Donna was great! Super nice and attentive. Loved the firecracker special. Will be back.

kQ193RHKcHX5FXHYnNWFEA.text: Waitress never explained the pancake works to me. Instead she charged me for two pancakes at $749 and classic bfast for $10.49 so she can increase her tab and get more $ for tip. Shady. Food is good but experience was garbage. Paid $18 for a breakfast plate.

uNvUFSSEMTKzcGRDbE8TJQ.text: awesome service , the food was amazing,it's my first time here and i will definitely be coming back . Donna was was awesome very friendly and attentive :)

UL0nVnOuS4iM-23rHsT2VQ.text: By far the best place to not only eat breakfast but to grab a burger at lunch. I love the omelettes here. Every so often I'll indulge in one topped with their amazing chili. This place is family friendly and the service is outstanding. I can't recommend this place enough.

FteLNTUWUQ8RjDaVYood7g.text: Absolutely amazing! Staff is friendly, food is delicious, lots to choose from and quick service!! Would definitely recommend.

XsTY8RSmtZKxT-4jwDKrlw.text: This place rocks. A shout out to Candace your server here. She's a sweet heart. Of all the franchised stores we've been to here in town I have to say she's the most personal one. Whatever you're paying her pay her more. We'll definitely make the drive out just for her.

B2bMfvKEuFIXu1y8x6zZQg.text: Not gross, not fantastic. We've eaten breakfast here many times. It used to be really good, but the last few times that we've gone the food and service has been disappointing. I like that they'll put bananas inside the kid's pancakes if you ask.   I think we've pretty much crossed it off our list of go-to places, but I'm sure we'll end up eating here again in the future since it's close to home.

VzuZpqqAgkcMS6enpm4pJQ.text: I've seen this Place a million times. I had a class today and I got there early so I stopped in here. All I had was coffee and bacon. They bring you a carafe of coffee which is awesome and the bacon was cooked perfect. The staff was really nice and  attentive. I'm glad I stopped in here.

SlNu8kf2tjE2GTvyy61dsQ.text: Went here for breakfast today like we have been for the past couple weeks.  The food is great and the service is wonderful.  We had Donna today and she takes excellent care of us.  The unfortunate part for me is the management.  I work for Pahrump Honey Company and of course wear a shirt with the company name and drive a car with the company name on it, but in the morning usually have NO honey products in the truck!  Between my husband and I and ALL of the community work we do, we know a lot of people in the Vegas area and tend to run into them out, especially at a popular breakfast spot.  Because of these things I have been accused several times now of soliciting inside the restaurant even while I was asked to join the city council meeting on health for the Vegas valley by a council member and to talk to the people!  Today there were 3 gentleman that had flown in from out of town who started talking to us because of the honey.  They called pver and asked at one point if we thought it better to rent a car or use uber.  We ended up taking them to rent their car after their meal because that is what you do for people, but before we could all leave we were asked by the manager to stop harassing these gentleman and to stop soliciting.  The gentleman were more than happy for a ride seeing as they would have had to walk and I have absolutely NO PRODUCTS in my truck so how could I solicit anything.  I just want a nice place to have breakfast every morning before I start my day.

rEzEiCY-I5u5nQbuKO0Njw.text: My mom, best friend and I were looking for a good place to have breakfast on a Sunday morning. I remembered seeing this place on my drive home one day and decided we should give it a try. The parking lot was packed, so we were afraid there would be a long wait. To our surprise, we got seated right away. That was a plus since we were all starving.  My friend ordered the corned beef hash and it was amazing! It was different from any other corned beef hash I have ever had. My favorite for sure. My mom ordered the fruit plate, which was huge! They serve it with either cottage cheese or yogurt. It looked amazing and the fruit was very fresh. The only thing I would have changed would have been the portion of cottage cheese. It just wasn't enough for the amount of fruit. I ordered a bacon avocado egg white omelet. It was amazing. Plenty of avocado, which I love. I would highly recommend it.     All in all, this was a great meal. My mom keeps asking when we're going back!

pmQFhSXBXqwbTZzdjSsGGQ.text: Everything people say about this place is True! The food was excellent and the orange juice was beyond amazing!

beVpZPraAqdxUUcwoVKatw.text: I love going to eat at egg works. The food is amazing to say the least but our sever Donna was what made the visit pleasurable & fun.  She was very helpful and was fast and efficient. We will be back for sure!  P.s. get the French toast it is soooooo good.

-O_4S8fQBZADMDA5vUSy-w.text: The chicken fried steak was great and the service was even better! I was sitting at the counter for less than 10 minutes before my food came out! Thanks to Donna for taking care of everything!

Zei5j1z-WH3pfOkXgL5SqQ.text: We had a good birthday breakfast for my boyfriend, and Chelsea was very friendly and very pretty. Normally we always go to the 215 and west side location but next time we will come back here.

bnMQv3HBQ6wAi_nD6pVMWA.text: We always go to this location. It's the best for family breakfast or even if you want something quick. Jamie was our server and she's always so friendly when we come in. Try the Chili Relleno Omelet,  it's amazing! Also, I cannot forget to mention ASHLEY the Assistant Manager, so friendly and always remembers us by name. We love it here.

pI6qQFzuMSPrsp21nbd_Iw.text: Amazing food, great service, delicious banana nut muffin. Must try this place if you haven't yet! -Ashley was our server

9LFh3TWys1BZYGUY0loCaQ.text: The food tasted fine but looks processed & not healthy. Service was great but giving 2 stars instead of 3 stars because of poor quality food & the receipt you receive says to submit a review on Yelp and you can win a trip to Disneyland. That's why there's so many positive reviews here.

m5PhNwLKfRlM528Iw53F4Q.text: My boyfriend and I just moved to vegas- and this was our first time to egg works! We sat by the bar and within the first 2 mins of being seated we were greeted and asked for our Oder on drinks. And then our server Brady came and took our order. Me being a server myself I was very impressed by how everyone worked as a team here. Quick and friendly service! The fruit they give is a good variety and great portions! Portuguese sausage was amazing! And I loved the potatoes works! Enjoy our time and experience and we will definitely be back again!

YsyAWoC5dcfjqQ58ParXqQ.text: Good food, large portions and awesome service. Our server was Donna and she was great. Loved the complimentary banana breads. It was our first time there and we will be back for sure.

2nBynjfs8cnlweyBvdWJcA.text: Vegas breakfast buffet?  We no need no stinking Vegas breakfast buffet!  You want the blackened prime rib benny.  That's an eggs benedict, but with prime freaking rib instead of ham and a croissant instead of an english muffin.  Yeah, the french do breakfast bread better than the Brits.  Compare that to a trough of scrambled "eggs" at circus circus.  Yeah, you won't get your three plates of bacon, but maybe that's a good thing.  They give you potatoes too, so that should be enough calories to work off your hangover.  Plus you get off the strip- that place has taken enough of your money.  So come to Egg Works and get something in Vegas that's actually worth every penny.

a7NeHk0D5FxjcaYDePgM5w.text: I have gone here twice in the last week already, and although they are always busy, they try their beat to seat you right away. Both times that I have went, the wait was no longer than ten minutes. Their banana but muffin is hands down the best muffin ever. So is their country fried chicken skillet, waffles, pancakes, & island plates. My husband and I are trying to make this our Monday morning regular place to go to till the day we grow old together. Love this place and their delicious breakfast/brunch foods.

v_OMIfiMGQ38UoC6Gymtlg.text: Great customer service, this was my second time visiting and  I was treated well, and our food was right on time, for a large group like ours 15 of us,I was surprise at the swift serve along with still providing quality food. Great place for eggs

zjx-c4KO76BrW0-gIhAttA.text: I love this place! I live in California and every time I visit Las Vegas this place is a must at some point during my trip! Took my friends here and everyone loved it! This place is always amazing and the staff is always friendly. I plan on coming back next time I'm in Vegas :)

_IeLu7Y__djv3-KJUsFPVA.text: Food was great ...service was something that needs to be improved ..my waitress Candace waited about 10 minutes before asking if I want something to drink she was very loud with The other waitstaff talking about inappropriate subjects....Great food but not a good family restaurant

i4jnpac2bfaspFLV1vm1Qg.text: We have been eating here for years and love their food and friendly service.  Our waitress Maya was friendly,  attentive and efficient.   Thanks Maya!

9pvspylvSOZREZFFwZYZOA.text: Worth the drive off the strip, the food was amazing! Incredible menu selection can't disappoint. The potatoes were seasoned perfectly and the eggs cooked just right. The  buttermilk pancakes were a little too dense for my taste but still had great flavor. Can't ways to go back and try more!

pOZ7Y1VBS2531PRZWfdHaw.text: First off, I wouldn't consider myself the least bit an early-riser (well, not for breakfast anyways).  I was here at 6:30 in the morn, lacking sleep, and I am still able to recall the killer breakfast at this place.  I honestly didn't even know this Egg Works had a location on Sunset (even though it has been there forever), but I'm glad I stopped in.  I needed to make a stop to the airport and breakfast prior to doing so just seemed like a good idea. I'll probably never see this place that early in the morning again though.  So being 6:30 in the am, I figured the place would be desolate, but I was taken by surprise when I entered and saw 3 other parties grubbing on some Egg Works offerings.  Okay, 3 parties isn't much, but seriously... it's 6:30!  That was a good indicator that this place means business.  After people-watching while waiting for my juice to be freshly squeezed from their orange tree that is growing within the walls of their kitchen (seriously it took a minute, but maybe I'm just not as patient during this hour), i noticed that the 3 other parties were regulars.  Regulars equals good service!    Our waitress was very helpful and even made mention of her picks on the menu.  I ended up going with the Haole Moco, which is an Americanized version of the ever-so-popular Hawaiian Loco Moco. Nice!  Pros: * good portion sizes... I even had to take some to go * okay so no Orange Tree in the kitchen to my knowledge, but it was fresh * open early for you early-risers (or late sleepers). * good service  Cons: * service can be a bit slow at times due to small talk w/ regulars  Tips:   They have this little flippy-thing that doubles as a salt/pepper shaker holder.  You can flip over to a different color, which indicates to the waitress that you are in need of assistance.  Pretty nifty.  I'll be honest, I just stared at it for a good minute or two, but since there were obstructions and I was entering the beginning stages of my food-coma, I said forget it and just waited for an opportunity to make eye-contact with the waitress to get the bill.  Seems pretty cool though. I'll try it next time I go and let you know if the waitress actually sees it in a timely manner.    One more tip, look up and watch the news.  It's more informative than people-watching, but I can't say it's more fun.

akUVLxkcEL3QTp3RqxyggQ.text: Awesome every time I go.. fast friendly service...food is delicious chili reano omelet awesome...

SF7IXmUJzTCbjwk_colcSQ.text: The fiesta skillet is by far the best skillet I have ever had! Our server Chris was great, and the food comes out fast.

usAOt4BloelTzFcBbswYKQ.text: I come here every now and then with a large group of people who come every week.  They have never messed up an order or forgotten anything.  Candice is my favorite server! She's absolutely amazing! She's always happy, helpful, and on top of everything no matter how crazy it gets! Thanks egg works for everything!

pJsY46a1tNnr9FLaXcWflQ.text: I've been here before years ago and remember it being really great so today my friend and I drove by it and waited until opening to dine there. SUPER great service and the worker who seated us/took our order was very friendly and outgoing. Plan to be coming by here more often. Eggcellent service

8HuNynbJZxxzoxKt-riTCw.text: I just ingested the best omelette of my life, the bacon and avocado omelette with tomatoes. Yum! Not to mention my server, Donna, was literally the sweetest woman. She took my doodle and put it on the wall (next to my other egg-stravagent piece of artwork), because breakfast at egg works is perfectly accompanied with coloring. My boyfriend also tried to tackle the country fried skillet, a little heavy but oh so very filling, eggs-actly how he likes his breakfast. Overall, we rate this a 10 out of 10, will definitely be switching this to our go-to breakfast place and will be coming back next weekend. Thanks again Donna!

3TOErQQLJEnEH0KDrA5Siw.text: We have nothing but raves for the Egg Works on E. Sunset Rd.  Our friend in California told us that going to this restaurant is a must--the food selection is phenomenal and the quality of the food superb.  What added to the pleasant experience was a waitress named Chelsea who was extremely pleasant, helpful, and efficient.  What I thought was a quaint touch was the way you can make known you need to speak to your waiter/waitress.  There is a yellow tag next to your table.  Under that tag is another tag with a different color (black).  When you flip the yellow tag so the black is showing, your waiter/waitress knows that you want their attention avoiding the need to shout out their name or trip them as they walk by.  When we return to LV in the future, Egg Works is on our list to go for a great meal and wonderful service.

EKxJUqJVRIRXwZoXgJ_PeQ.text: Love it here! We sat down and our server Donna came right away. Service was great and food came within 15 minutes. Service definitely makes breakfast dates, especially so early in the morning. Our server was very attentive and sweet. Country Benny was delicious as always. My boyfriend had the cheese enchilada ranchero and pretty much licked the plate clean!

Jj_aujxSQ2Smc-tn_tycLQ.text: If I could give this restaurant no stars I would. I brought my family of 5 for breakfast on my husband's birthday. First, we were incessantly hounded to have our order taken, asked at least 3 separate times in under 5 minutes...and every time they asked my kids were in the bathroom and hadn't even been to the table yet or seen a menu. We definitely felt rushed. Next, I ordered eggs benedict and when it was served the eggs were raw! As in when I cut in to them the whites oozed out like snot, which is disgusting. However the third and final offense came when I flipped my egg over to yellow for service and when I requested some cooked eggs, the waitress proceeded to explain to me that if I wanted my eggs cooked hard I should have ordered them that way. What?! So I said that all I wanted was for them to be poached until the whites were actually cooked...2 more servers asked what the problem was, again alluding to having them cooked over medium or hard. I gave up, asked them to just take my plate and sipped on my coffee while my family ate their food. I most certainly won't patronize this establishment nor recommend it to anyone I know. Shame on you Egg Works staff for bullying and speaking condescendingly towards your customers. We came in for a leisurely breakfast on a Wednesday morning, it's wasn't a packed Saturday brunch rush...you should let your patrons enjoy their experience!

Zwb5Y32cZSvyRa9ZEpYx1Q.text: First, let me say that this place was very crowded for a Monday. We are visiting from out of town and thought "Great! It must be good." The restaurant itself was freezing cold. And it never changed, temperature wise. They had two hostess' and the one we dealt with first didn't take or name because she said "your first, I've got you in my mind." Ok, sounds good.. it wasn't. She left and the other one returned and seated new people before us. The old one came back and was like "OMG, I'm so sorry, your next." Then the second one came back and seated someone else again!!! We finally got seated and all was ok. The food was ok. Not great, not bad EXCEPT for the pancakes, which were hard. Yuck. Now it's time to pay. We stood in line and in front of us was a man with a Chihuahua on a leash. Yes, inside the restaurant. He had been sitting near us and was there when we got there, finished, but just sitting on his phone. The dog was terrified, and freezing too. Anyhow, at the cash register this man was yanking and pulling the dog.. I said she looks very afraid. He says yes, she's overwhelmed. My husband leans down and let's her sniff his hand and then she practically jumps into his arms. He gives her a little scratch on her back and the man turns around and says Don't pet her, she's a service dog. We said ok. Then he got belligerant with us and said I've got the papers if you don't believe me!!! Then the cashier pipes in, and says you should never pet a dog unless you ask first! I then say, we own a pet sitting business, we are familiar with animals and the guy got even more rude. The whole situation was ridiculous. The dog did not have a service vest and was clearly not a service animal. Poor pup. We felt sorry for her. My issue is with the cashier, Lacey. She had no business giving her opinion or intervening. She was VERY rude and then became very condescerning when I complained about her behavior. So, if your looking for a good meal with a pleasant experience GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. FYI, It's not an inexpensive place either. One star because you can't give zero.

IRM4I6pByr_pAyHIuD3RsA.text: Egg works restaurant good food good service especially Donna our server! Will be back.

4Fwb2b1894_bQ0Uy7s3ZyQ.text: Still amazingly delicious!  Just ate at the Sunset/Eastern location in Henderson - Donna was our server, and the food and service was impeccable as always! Thanks Egg Works!

V9DdcWDx6P4kUvc2vjgxEA.text: First time here and DONNA brought us some warm delicious banana nut muffins as a welcome. Best I have ever had. Then had a great omlete made the way we needed it because we are on a diet. Looking at other tables it all looked delicious! DONNA thanks for being such a great server! Will come back when we come back to vegas!

Z2qCKI9f9opIq9llnLI4Rg.text: Ashley H was our server at the bar this morning and she was fantastic. She was fast and attentive, and overall wonderful. Thank you for a great experience with awesome food!

j-W_qFmY-vGFCzFfNVQJ-Q.text: Dani is the most amazing server, and the food is fantastic! If you haven't been, you should definitely go!!

M0mSYQiUGTL7dyKZIww0rQ.text: The food was awesome! Breakfast is my favorite meal to eat out and Egg Works did not disappoint. As good as it was (including plenty of TV's so I didn't miss my team), it was Maria's professional, accommodating and kind service that made the visit worth a definite repeat.

GuH7azpxJ2Dmj6bAUX6ZbA.text: First time here and I absolutely loved it here! Food was great and Ashley Silva did an amazing job!!

RIe_kx9pBIEeK1D1Av1QmA.text: Our server Donna was awesome. We came from the airport and explained we were in a rush and she took care of all 6 of us extremely fast with exceptional service.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A4CpPvyeKHTnztnuCjR4jQ.text: Always busy and worth the wait-though we usually sneak up to the counter and eat with Shantel. Order the Fiesta Skillet!  And, the best part, you can get 1/2 orders on all the skillets!  They are huge!

d4A-j7KvYCWDfVvD1RU4Fw.text: Place is nutz! 4 of us reading the menu and the waitress, unfortunately I can't remember her name but she was excellent, asked if we'd been there before. Nope. So two minutes later she shows up with a huge banana nut muffin for us to share. It almost killed our appetites, but not quite. I can't remember what we had but it all came out as ordered and was quite good. The waitress, I think her name started with a D, gave this place an extra star.

oFbXmAixyd-xc2Zp--rWAQ.text: This is total hangover breakfast place, very indulgent and large portion sizes. The service was great, they have this cute system where you flip something over on your table and we tried it and we're helped immediately. We weren't hungover but still enjoyed the veggie skillet which they let us add bacon to. Also we were definitely those annoying people that stayed for a really long time and no one gave us a hard time about it, which we really appreciated since we had a lot to catch up on. All in all I'd definitely recommend this place for breakfast.

ce2Dn-YeRHNhpqzrmtbhog.text: Great service! Decent prices.   I am a huge fan of all the different omelets. From the Denver to the garlic mashed potato omelette, you just can't go wrong. I am, however, not a fan of the waffles or pancakes.   Truly worth a try...

efgBhHSJS_SuNgmVq-fVwA.text: I've lived in the area for over 10 years and I finally made it to Egg Works.  Had a lovely breakfast and the corned beef hash was DELICIOUS!!  Get it with tomatoes (like I did) or something other than the potatoes.  The hash has potatoes already.    Our server was DONNA and she was a delight!!  I will be back!!

RACEtKUMa1YzPUGEHMzPOQ.text: I travel a lot, and dine in a wide variety of places from fancy to dives. This place was spot on. Food was good, came quickly and the variety for breakfast was amazing. From Crepes, Benedicts,  Omelettes, Srambles, and standard fare, everything was delicious. Our server was phenomenal and absolutely on top of it. We didn't have to ask for anything from extra napkins to water to the check.

sN_IoeJGi4AzyyFtteCDGA.text: Breakfast food is good and I should've stuck to that, but I went to breakfast without much of an appetite so I opted for their house salad and muffin. Is it so hard to get a fresh salad here in Henderson?  My lettuce was wilted, turning pink at the edges and had some brown spots. I asked them to take it back and the waitress kindly brought me more muffins on the house.   Why would an establishment ever serve salads that obviously are closer to rotting than being fresh.   Henderson, I give up on ordering salads from any of your restaurants. And Egg works, you're on my list of restaurants who rather plate any kind of food than plate quality ingredients and cross fingers that I'll just stuff my face without looking.   5 stars for the muffins though. I'll come back for those and when I'm hungry for breakfast food.   Skip the salad. Who eats that for breakfast anyways ;)

tBA0rDUZZHxju2SHWAedPQ.text: Great hearty breakfast service is a little slow but that could have been because no one explains that they have an egg u flip for service very much like Bubba Gumps lic plate gimmick but food was perfect for the hungry man try the skillets!!

BjLy6_eLDIv8mN38G-ezrw.text: From the moment Donna greeted us until we packed up the remaining food, the experience was fantastic.  Great food, great service.  What's not to like!

0jend3TLbf1UR_eq6MAEew.text: Donna our server was amazing! I love this place and always enjoy eating here. Make sure to ask to sit in her section when you do come to enjoy the egg deliciousness.

nBjCmfwu2zlAVoxNGkDSDw.text: This place is by far the best breakfast place in Las Vegas. I always order half of whatever I order because the portions are huge! I have a hard time finishing even the half size portions.   My boyfriend always gets the waffle works with over hard eggs and a side of works potatoes. I usually opt for the classic with over medium eggs, toast, and fruit. If you want to splurge, I highly suggest the chili relleno omelet.   Everything on the menu is great unless you catch them on a bad day. Today for instance, my over medium eggs were a runny, watery, mess.   The service is usually prompt, but don't expect to see your server again after you order.

oD9W86Ri5IlHhcBHSO5A7Q.text: Check off another place for my foodie bucket list. I got the chicken fried steak and eggs and my wife go traditional eggs Benedict. The coffee was excellent and hit the spot and you can obviously tell that the orange juice was fresh squeezed. Their house potatoes come pre-seasoned, so make no attempt to solve them before tasting. I made that mistake and mine were too salty. The chicken fried steak was good crispy every country gravy was awesome. I opted not to get toast but get their house banana nut muffin. Oh my gosh the muffin was excellent. As for my scrambled eggs to be scramble dry and not runny and they were really well done, almost too browned. Service was ok, she was very friendly and told us how to use the little happy and sad egg faces on the condiment stand to alert her if we needed anything. I would go back again and try an omelette.

0hJJSlx8LiN-QI61yCRi1g.text: Glad to have found this place so close to our hotel. Food was delicious and Mariia was great! We really enjoyed our visit :)

4Tvq8jTVky5ZjmLXRwleTw.text: Excellent food with big portions.   Their banana nut muffins are awesome.  Will definitely eat here again when I'm in Vegas.

fcAtUxVWoGx0KxxGWzxEFA.text: Very good but, remember to ask for eggs soft if you like em that way. Pancakes are very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut pancakes. Taste like banana pudding:-)

cra8etqVPp4QTikmlo_tKw.text: I ordered there corn beef hash. I've had better. The service wasn't on par either.

LidWH9035LUTLJ-qGV92og.text: Every egg works establishment it's great and consistent!! Try news things every time I come!!! Had great service here today with Chelsea!!! Came here once and had Robert...horrible experience but the food made up for it!!! Great food, can't say it enough!!!

PmfkFfpATPPVuSHys9Fjfg.text: It was our first time here Donna was our server she was great help helping us with the menu. Her services was great we never run out of coffee or drinks thanks Donna.

MRmBAZ6YGZte8nnaqL7Gyg.text: Perfect go-to breakfast spot on a sleepy Sunday morning.  Food is always delicious. Our server Donna made our family breakfast a fantastic experience!  Her warm, spot on service made our delicious breakfast even more wonderful!

34A9MbF3ltsP84xrFfbZLw.text: Had breakfast here while on vacation. Seriously, such great food and service! I had the avocado and bacon omelette with potatoes. My husband had the stuffed French toast. Large yummy portions. Our server was Ray, he even gave us all banana nut muffins complimentary since it was our first time. Best banana nut muffins ever!! We will for sure be back next time we're in town. This place is a must try!

IrU8sAHuy_8FCIthsu39jg.text: Egg works is a must stop place, off the Vegas strip! The banana muffins are to die for! Crepes and omelets are rad! Our waitress Candace is flippin amazing. The food was fast and she was welcoming friendly....and also shared our love of muffins! Please please go here this is seriously a gem!

Yv5Us5rL_anco_ToX18CqA.text: I'm sad to leave this review with such low stars. After reading the reviews I was pumped to eat there, but after my food came I was not so excited. My $7 fruit plate was old and yucky. The grapefruit and blueberries were all shriveled up. I had to send it all back. If your going to charge $7 for fruit at least have it be fresh please. The potato hash browns were pretty good. And the staff is super friendly so that's why I gave 3 stars instead of 1 or 2.

_e0vIyLN1M4utByiEuEGMg.text: The carnitas rancheros is to die for.  the service is impeccable.  and you will find yourself unable to resist stuffing their banana muffins in your pockets.  I came here twice on my last trip and will be coming here every morning in the future. especially on the day you leave since it opens at 6 am and I like to leave on the early flight Monday rather than Sunday night.  It's an easy drive from the strip if you just head east away from the madness to S. Eastern Avenue, and then south to E. Sunset. From the MGM, it was like 5 minutes. just on the far side of the airport (and like two minutes from your rental car drop off)

aBN-kNUpz1DOc_DZ2vBj-Q.text: Being Harrassed By Management For Being Approched By Staff and Customers Wanting to Better Themselves Using My Honey ! Im a Local Honey Company in Vegas who Started Eating Here a Couple Weeks Ago , Service and Food is Awesome but Management SUX ACCUSING There Customer "Me" Of Soliciting Business When Im The One Being Approched and Technically Being Harrassed (I Dont Mind So Wheres The Complaint)  ! This Morning Just Happen to Run Into 3 Guys from Outta State Who Asked Me A Few Questions about Uber or a Rental n When I Offered Them a RIDE to Get them a Car just Being a HUMANE Human Being I Was Told If Im Going to CONTINUE Harrasing Customers I'll Not be Allowed Back ?! WhBDj623VcAFSe8KHczdRA.text: First time at this restaurant and I must say that they definitely exceeded my expectations. I ordered the Greyhound for my beverage. I'd never had it before but I enjoyed it. For my meal I got the Fresh Veggie Skillet Breakfast. Those Hablo Diablo potatoes are amazing! I think I ate a few off of my friends plate as well lol. Whenever I'm in the mood for breakfast again I'll have to pay them another visit. Bottom line, I'll be back.

E6xwLn-oTS7Vie-fVwkJjA.text: I had my Easter 2016 breakfast here and it was great. My server was Ash H. I loved her attention to detail and she checked on us with a great smile on her face every time.  Ride a ride for me at Disneyland Ash!!

13j6d3ajIqqsWC6I-GAh_w.text: Always awesome service and fabulous food. We love sitting outside so the 2 year old can watch the planes go by. Ashley kept us happy. See you soon.

ojLyyK0sQXyGW9V4vATmyg.text: First ever Yelp review for me. Love this place and make sure you get served by CeCe and Char! Simply Good people!

Vrhva2vA84Rztx7RiOfXcA.text: Chelsea is awesome! I hope ahe trains all your new hires to have excellent service and attitude like her =0)

e0jt10Flg0Dtt4_DGku9dQ.text: This is my favorite place for breakfast. I like to order the california crepe , omlette style. Fast delicious and friendly service every time! Ashley H is always cheerful and efficient! Thanks Ashley!!

4cp3hCuPB5S7caCr0n2VEw.text: Donna took great care of us.  Perky positive attitude helped make our Sunday family Brunch a great start to a fun day together. Food was great as always!

49FW-A36e2c-C5zdiAHKvg.text: I love egg works!! Come here every time I'm in Vegas. Food and service are excellent, banana muffins sooooo delicious.  My only complaint is that the potatoes are too salty.  Won't stop me from coming back though!

Bg9X1Vi7nxtqKOBWMsAotw.text: Pretty good food , great portions , fair price and friendly staff. They are really busy so. I recommend you come in with time .

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak, really good and big portions I can&#39;t even finish it. !

azprMPXru2Cx_5HtYHUo9g.text: The Banana muffin here is so good! It was tasty, not too sweet and even better it comes out warm and soft. It's a must get when you are here. Service was excellent! We told our server it was our first time and she gave us banana muffins on the house. It's quite clever for them to offer it because once you take a bite, you'll be hooked. There were lots of breakfast and brunch options on the menu and our server helped make some recommendations. We ended getting omelets which were delicious and super filling (made with 4 large eggs). The three pigs omelet was stuffed with ham, bacon, and sausage. It was very savory and would recommend if you like meaty omelets. The portions are very generous and our omelets were probably at least an inch thick! The Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes were also crispy and tasty. Love the chill diner atmosphere here. Eggcellent quality food and service for an affordable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed omelet made with 4 large eggs - super filling!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado and Bacon omelet with a side of fruit - $11.99
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 pigs omelet with seasoned potatoes - $11.25

GRFTZ3BgUi1HCrTzYviFNw.text: Good food and excellent customer service. Very relaxing atmosphere and convenient location.

x-BcvQMAL6RERddHK0US_Q.text: Stopped for breakfast, great local spot with friendly staff and great breakfast! There was a large crowd waiting but they moved very quickly and we were seated in 10 minutes!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Skillet

MQmlMz1XLV2YUC2wqcHQZA.text: Been here before and liked it. After catching the red eye flight we were hungry. Always consistent in excellent service and quality food.   What caught my eye was they have loco moco . Then I noticed there was a haole moco. Found that sooooo funny. The difference is the loco moco comes with brown gravy and the haole moco comes with country gravy (white gravy). I think real loco moco has to come with brown gravy.   Got mine done medium/well with the egg over easy. Described as coming with sticky rice, which is standard rice where I come from.   Comes with a choice of toast or banana nut muffin. Get the muffin, it's da bes. Shows up warm and when you butter it, oooo broke da mout.   The California crepe was good too and a good portion. The Works parfait was full of fruit and looked good.   Our server, Kathleen, was very nice and friendly. She was soooo attentive and always checked on us to see if all was okay and to refill water and coffee. We never got to use the yellow egg. If you come here you'll know about the yellow egg and the black egg.   So, overall all, excellent rating of 5 stars due to the excellent service when we were greeted upon arrival and seated. Kathleen was great and she is an asset to this establishment.   We will return when we are in the area next time. We got a banana nut muffin when we checked in, another plus for Egg Works on Sunset Road.

H9P0mPwGYk7jUPuIkgX4UA.text: Our server was a biker looking dude who was extremely cool. He wasn't invasive at all and gave us a couple Banana muffins after we showed him our yelp app. I ordered the corn beef hash which was delicious. Roast beef sandwich was good which my boyfriend ordered. It's Located right next to the Hampton which was very convenient. Highly recommend !

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MaDnT_YVOByCGUTHozs0lQ.text: I've eaten at this restaurant a number of times for breakfast.....lots of food...they don't skimp.....  Usually very good service and relatively fast.....  I believe only open for breakfast and lunch......I'd give it four fighter jets.....  I was in the air gusrd

A1sJMKobk7nl69zmZH9skg.text: Great place for breakfast. Only downside is that it's so good you have to wait for it. There are times when you can just walk in but some other times you have to wait. This place is worth the wait. Off the strip but a great find. Friendly staff and huge delicious portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place!

390kd1iP9zMDWGPlUOZBIA.text: Very good! We just moved from Georgia and always on the look out for a good breakfast spot. Glad we came here. Clean restaurant and friendly staff. Seated right away. I got the strawberry cream cheese French toast. Highly recommend.

cnmfvnI-hAjYnsWH4KBezQ.text: First time at this place, I really hoped that I knew about this place before. It's awesome! Service impeccable. Banana nut muffin best ever. Totally recommend this place 100%.

3xTb1lp1uqSB0ysT2JFsPA.text: Such a good spot for brunch! So many choices and the portions are large! You got everything you could want for brunch here: bennys, omelettes, country fried steak, pancakes, waffles, toast, & gumbo-laya. Most of the dishes come with a choice of their banana muffin so don't even hesitate!! THE MUFFINS ARE SO GOOD, MOIST WITH A CHOCOLATEY EDGE TO IT. And bottomless coffee for the table if you opt for coffee! Hazelnut and French vanilla non-dairy creamers are at the table. Their diablo potatoes were nice and crispy on the outside, just the seasoning could be a tad salty if you don't eat it with ketchup.   Don't forget to check-in for your free banana muffin!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican omelette
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best banana muffin ever!

x6Bsd0j6R7B1vrcSqno0Rg.text: This place is great. Great food and service. I ordered the chili rellenos omelette, delicious.

oa-QjBvCo0zvMqsKe5RY3g.text: Food is bomb dot com!!!! Okay okay everyone has said it, the potatoes are amazing, the muffins are amazing and so are the burritos!!! Service was good, Lacie was my server, friendly and attentive... upset that after years of hearing from this place that I haven't come sooner!   Not crazy about the Bloody Marys but I'll definitely return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8HpAhtFBdOsgeuCctcd7rw.text: My favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas. Every time we visit we leave the strip and go here! Get the chipotle hollandaise sauce! I got the spinach Benny but substituted for the chipotle sauce. It definitely has a kick but it's SO good!! The potatoes that come with the meals have a spice to them and are fantastic. I've tried to replica them at home but they never are quite like egg works! The service is fantastic as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Benny with chipotle hollandaise sauce

ExwW9wmn2giALPz8-J1ugw.text: This is one of my favorite spots to get breakfast! Whenever we have friends or family in town this is where we take them. Our favorite thing to get is the seasoned potatoes, they have there own seasoning called Diablo Seasoning that you can purchase. The food is always fresh and delicious! A few things I've had are grandmas biscuits and gravy, omelette, french toast, oatmeal, bacon, eggs, waffles, skillets, lol you can't go wrong with anything. I have not had lunch here yet but from the looks  of others meals it looks just as good as breakfast. Staff is always friendly and fast and they always make sure our food top notch!  Also shout out to Cassandra, she was a great server today and very good to us.  I recommend this location as well as the Rainbow and 215 location.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7XULOJGoeIYVAv2fs8i7nQ.text: The best banana walnut muffins I have ever had! Portions enormous and friendly staff!

HzVVhvr2rqGRzbqXCswMlg.text: My family and I had breakfast here and all of us enjoyed our food. The veggie eggs Benedict was delicious as well as their pancakes, and chili relleno omelet. Their banana bread is amazingly delicious...  Last but not least our waitress Shay was fabulous. Super friendly, attentive and overall excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WcoNkD3G04Drx2pUngS52Q.text: Found this place on Yelp.  Had pretty good reviews so gave it a shot this morning for breakfast. The place was packed out the door. Usually a good sign.  Ended up sitting on the patio because there was no wait for that. It was good sitting out there as it was a bit too warm inside the restaurant. This place is right at the end of the runway of the Vegas airport so you do get to take in the planes landing if you sit outside. Had a basic ham and cheese omelet. Pretty good. Lots of potatoes and could not even finish them all.  Service was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kZOJynZypVj-0sKeffdjLA.text: My Sunday cheat day go to :)  Great service and even better food. Can't go wrong with any of their omlates. Go now!

VJWn85V1WJix7WFPvL_Rhw.text: Food was ok. Portions very large. Potatoes over seasoned. All food was on the salty side. We could of easily shared plates. Service was slow and food didn't come out together. One person at our table got served almost 10 minutes after everyone else. The banana nut muffin was served warm and it was very tasty.

9yk7DtiSH2ljDJ9m-qjEzg.text: It's always the best eggs Benedict in town. They have a very large selection of items on the menu even something for someone with celiac disease!

LLmWg39jLTx3JSJsLycAcA.text: Egg Works was so awesome. I ordered Island favorite and it was delicious. I also had some hash and the seasoning on it was bomb.   The customer service was outstanding. Shay, our server was so friendly and on was top of things. Didn't have to wait for water, she also had good reccommendations. Shay was an amazing server, you know you'll have a great experience if she's your server.

9oMTQEyoVKEJea3GReNbmA.text: The manager Amy is outstanding! I ordered a plate and substituted ham for spam and when my plate arrived it only had ham.  Long story short.. The manager amy came over and apologized for the inconvenience and went out of her way to keep checking on us for the remainder of the time we were there and fixed the problem i had with the meal.  The food was very tasty and service was amazing. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who has yet to try it

KPXPlikvNH8s2MlCUjNUyg.text: Great food. Friendly service. What more can you ask for?? We are from out of town and found this on Groupon. What a great place. Highly recommend the banana nut muffin.  I got the classic breakfast. Eggs were perfect. The diablo potatoes had a nice little kick to them.  Check this place out if you're in the area!!!

JF2wNDY2nMjE4aIZH-sKdQ.text: The price was right but the food was average. I had the traditional eggs Benedict which was decent. The potatoes were pretty dry.

QW3JOmN-QcIvpDONv5oqrQ.text: I have been to Egg Works a couple times.  Both times I have been it was a busy Sunday morning.  Despite the people waiting, they get you seated pretty quickly.  The first time I went I had Traditional Benny because I love eggs benedict.  I was disappointed.  They were just ok.  Just last weekend we went again.  This time I tried Grandma's Biscuits and Gravy and my husband had the Bacon and Sliced Avocado Omelette.  I was disappointed again.  The biscuits weren't that good and the gravy had a strange taste to it.  My husband said the omelette wasn't bad.  The servers were friendly but the service itself was just okay.  Perfectly ok but nothing great here.

OQ_HOGVENZ0WlneF_R7u9Q.text: The serving size of their breakfasts are amazing. Fast service. Friendly service. Las Vegas firefighter friend of ours recommended this restaurant as well. Definitely will be back

ohZ7x4tENuLLTErT54oRrw.text: Judd is always so friendly to me and my entire family. Their food is always delicious and enjoying coming weekly.  I wish they offered some type of a reward program like the cracked egg.

luzEYH3oitLVlsnUukqKXg.text: Very good place to eat the seasoned potatoes were amazing! And the banana muffin was so good! I think price wise it was very inexpensive but then again I live in Hawaii so most places are cheap compared to Hawaii!  The loco moco wasn't the best but everything else was great!! I recommend this place for sure! Also we did have a new waiter who just started but he was great! And honest so no complaints....

MiQ257St3ER0BlW19zO_Kg.text: The food is delicious and the staff is always great. Sometimes the wait can be a bit but not horrible. I love the seasoned potatoes and the banana muffins are yummy.

lPoMquy8KctzvNCHzjz3Sw.text: Every time in Vegas we eat here always bomb. The service and the food is always on point. Wish they had one in California.

Lsx47YKc3612xL4tf6JasQ.text: Excellent food, excellent service at a decent price. Our waiter Kris was very informative and attentive,  just a happy guy. Busy place with lots of kids so expect ot to be a bit noisy.

0n2b4FC3UPLU5gFNIu6K5w.text: Such an amazing breakfast! I had butterscotch pancakes, bacon and Cajun potatoes. I loved the salty, sweet, spicy, savory combo. One of the best breakfasts of the year! I can't wait to come back to Vegas to eat your food again! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tuh4H4Gy0EYCjQpsGUgigA.text: Ordered the Strawberry French toast which was great, was not impressed with service from the get go.

eWF74wE8zPLHNcctnoVcMg.text: Egg works has huge portions! I had the corned beef hash, and it was great. What I love the most though was the banana bread. Definitely order the banana bread! The wait time was pretty fast, but they sure are busy. I would definitely go here again in the future.

dh7Zlb-pbVgDnDi3lgKZAg.text: We come to this place AT LEAST 3 times a month. Cassandra is super friendly and made sure my eggs were on point! The servers are always great and the food never disappoints. Lots of options, you could seriously try something new every time and not be bored. Love this place!   Update: do I have a problem because I come to this place consistently every week or so? Yes. Do I regret being the most checked in person at this location? Nope. The food is consistent and the servers are so friendly. Nashay has been taking care of us recently and is super attentive and has a great attitude! Thanks eggworks for the bomb food and staff as always !

4NVghc0Wp8JUM2WevK3YeA.text: My first time here and it was really yummy! Our wait was short-even though it was packed. Our service was awesome (Thank You Jaime for being amazing). The banana (French) toast was so freakin good and so was the French Dip. Those fries though OMG! Couldn't stop eating them!!! Entire staff was so friendly from beginning to end, so we will definitely come back here soon!! Thanks Y'all!!

kvkQb8hIT_rCSH9t4VUZTA.text: My mom and I split an omelet because they are huge. Our Three Little Pigs omelet with avocado added was amazing. There was a bit of a wait at noon on a Saturday, but definitely worth the wait. The food was delicious and our server was awesome. A great way to start our Saturday in Vegas.

5I5YLvtxo1XebzuCPB6fCw.text: Absolutely the best restaurant for breakfast!  Stopped here for a breakfast with family and found the menu to be fun reading.  I ordered the veggie omelet and it was delicious!  Our server, Theresa was so nice and helpful with her suggestions, as there is so much they offer to eat. The coffee was great too!   Highly recommend!!

R5N79ve_uOQOv9G6RqfODw.text: Shout out to our waitress Maya, for always having a smile and providing us great customer service!  We prefer this location over any other location in Vegas, their whole staff always seems to be in a good mood, food comes fast and overall great environment.

SRCvTqNT1fBGA7WdScduzQ.text: This is my husband's favorite spot and we go at least once a month. They're always a friendly staff, always fast with the food, and I have never been disappointed. They have everything from basic omelettes and pancakes to experimental takes (like my husband's mainstay - the chili relleno omelette).  Try the muffin - even if you don't like sweets or walnuts. It's PHENOMENAL!

67u29im6q1tn12o8sE_Cqg.text: I come here for breakfast often. They offer coupons and are on Groupon occasionally so be on the look out. It's always busy on the weekends. If you plan to go between 9-11am (weekends), plan to wait at least 10-15 minutes.    PROS: Bacon & Avocado omelet             Corned Beef Hash             Eggs Benedict             Cincinnati Chili dog             Taco skillet             Fast service             Seeing the planes over our heads from the parking lot

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional Eggs Benedict
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon avocado egg white omelette. (1/2 portion)

9Nmvm6MMJ_goZFOkGZGbLQ.text: This place is amazing they have enormous portions even I couldn't finish it the first time. Love coming for breakfast here.

j98KMU1yoKggiD7FlcPqNw.text: On business I am often on a tight schedule so I stick to the food chains I know. Today with a lighter schedule I wanted to try something new.  the yelp reviews on the Egg Works were good, so off I went.  It was 10:45 Sunday morning, the place was packed with a waiting line, but being a solo I could immediately set at the counter. Looking at the long and impressive list of choices I selected a hard to find item, Corn Beef Hash topped with 2 Eggs Sunnyside,  coffee and Rye toast from the friendly and  courteous SHANTEl, who brought me a carafe or coffee real cream and water.  The impressively quick service bought forth a large plate of Corn Beef Hash  that was delicious.  The unexpected addition was the chorus line of staff working in concert at a frantic pace to make up and deliver the orders.   I will be back on every trip.  I strongly suggest you give it a Go!

qPJwEftyJB-exnsipy80qg.text: This place is RIDONKULOUS and you need to eat here. Delicious, big portions for good prices, friendly service.  It's in a shopping plaza out by the airport, and other than my group there didn't seem to be many tourists. It was bustling on a Friday morning, which is always a good sign to me. My brother and I each got bacon and avocado omelet and our co-travelers got skillets. Only one cleaned his plate, and that was an Olympic-level feat. The bacon and avocado omelet had to have at least three whole avocados in it. I couldn't stop admiring it between bites.   Our server Candice was delightful and a wonderful ambassador for the city and the restaurant! If you're a breakfast/brunch fan and you skip out on Egg Works, I feel bad for you, but only a little bit because you shouldn't ignore good advice.

23rvySR25MRSCVlhVs7GGQ.text: Do not go here if you are a whiny calorie counter! This place serves large portions and the food is really good. Eggs made a lot of different ways, pancakes, waffles, and yummy potatoes. The biscuits and gravy are very good too. Had to try the buttermilk pancakes (just because) and they were so good. I inhaled it.  My new favorite place for breakfast, but they also serve lunch as they are open til 3:00 p.m.

JlENS2ifo5VW5D0Fu_j8tw.text: I wanted to give this place a 5 star but my chicken cordon bleu skillet was somewhat dry.  I was expecting chunks of chicken (maybe I misread the description) but got slices chicken like the kind you get at a deli counter.  The potatoes were good, cheese wasn't bad, but I do feel it needed something else because it wasn't anything special.  My husband got the country benny and he said it was excellent, my daughter got one of their daily specials and she really enjoyed it.  The customer service was great, but since the place is rather busy it does take some time to get your food.  Still a great option for a breakfast, next time I'll try something else.

HbCdm88ec72FKXx7BRMPTg.text: My boyfriend and I go here every Saturday morning. We've made it a mini tradition. The service is always good, no matter how busy they are. We try to order something different every time we go. Some of my favorites are the chicken fried steak skillet, sunrise mountain, the pork chop and mashed potato omelette. I recently got the bacon avocado omelette and they loaded it with avocado! It was a pleasant surprise because so many places really skimp out on how much avocado they give you. This is a good breakfast place with a lot of variety in their menu. 4 stars only because their pancakes aren't that great.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle works!!
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ev75Zu92FH0ttVDCChLCvw.text: Egg works will always be my go to breakfast place! Every once in a while my husband and I will decide to venture out and try a new place, and we always leave saying "we should have just gone to egg works!" I love the country Benny and the potatoes are bomb.com (do people still say that anymore?) anyways... I'm only giving 4 stars because it's hard to mess up breakfast, and I'm a HUGE breakfast lover..so I'm still waiting to find a place that blows my mind enough to give them 5 stars!

dWal-DOsbyft7rKmrZypPQ.text: My daughter and I were seated and first impressions were already bad as the coffee cup in front of me had lipstick on it. It wasn't as if it were stained but more like it was rinsed or not even washed. Order was taken, then a check was given to me the same time the food was brought out. Had to look and ask around just to get a to go container. Issue checking out for the free banana muffin per Yelp check in as well. The muffin was good and the breakfast burrito was pretty decent. I'm unsure I would return after the service and the lack of cleanliness.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My cup upon sitting at a new &#34;clean&#34; table

p9uMGNHSZd5ehF7jibR3BQ.text: If you are looking for really good breakfast this is the place. Moderate in price, the service was good too. I ordered huevos rancheros and they were really good. Bear in mind that the servings are rich so you might not have room for dessert:) I highly recommended it!

L4kXt5LGaM6NaPacXF4Vlw.text: Every time Jim and I come to Las Vegas we have breakfast at least once at Egg Works. Today was not a disappointment it was excellent as always! I had the stuffed French Toast for the first time and it was amazing. Jim had the Denver omelette which is a good standard. The banana nut muffins we took to go for later and they are wonderful. Chelsea was our server and gave us impeccable service.  We love that you get a coffee pot when you order coffee so doesn't run out plus l love to use the flavored coffee creamers a real treat with all the flavor's they offer. All in all a wonderful breakfast experience!!!!

Ah0AuAcc1282oC9nWtXiZg.text: Always a good crowd at any of the Egg Works restaurants, the staff handles it well every time.  Our server this morning was Donna. She was fast to greet us just as we were seated and take care of our drink order. She gave us enough time to know just what we wanted before she came back to get the order.    The plain waffle and ham was perfect with added blueberries on the side.  The Sundance omelette is my goto at any Egg Works and is hard for me NOT to order.  I change it up from the  on menu item by making it with egg whites and adding garlic/extra garlic to it. If you love garlic then it is well worth it to ask them for it with this omelette. It really adds great flavor.  Today I also added avocado and it was so good that I think I will probably keep adding it.    Coffee is always good here and if it's not on the table do not forget to ask the server for the flavored ones for a bonus treat.

hSx8cHBNM3EryLdmrxajKQ.text: This place never disappoints. The long wait is always worth it, so don't let that deter you! The seasoned potatoes are a must have.

ZSCyrv_2U3qNaF5PEy2rYA.text: Yet again we had amazing service and great food! Jamie was so accommodating. We had our dog with us and she brought a water bowl for her and a banana on request. My husband and I don't mind the 20+ minute drive because we love this location so much!

v_2mFO2YLoL2Tx4EMsA23A.text: The service and food was awesome. We love coming here for breakfast on Sunday! Thank you!

DNoleHzDOzAJrZRnJzoHwA.text: The food is delicious..It took awhile though for them to bring our food. The potatoes "habla Diablo" something Is really good! It is my first time here and I will be coming back! I ordered bacon & ham omelette! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lbsOO23WtkGPMXXVDdz5JA.text: Very good breakfast. I had the county fried steak and it did  not disappoint. Gravy has a pitch of pepper taste that just makes it soo good. The potatoes are so freaking good I can't explain you to try yourself

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t go wrong with this. Great all the time

kXvLNCEDO83v6xSIzdMegg.text: GREAT LOCAL SPOT!   The food was delicious, huge portions, tons of options!   Wait staff was fast, friendly and ensured we were taken care of.   Definitely a great place for a no frills, good food, breakfast spot!

r5E9wKHztvwgLmBMdohDSA.text: Amazing service. Thank you Candace. The country benny was eggggcilent.  The corn beef hash was eggstodinary!!! Will be coming again for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One satisfied customer
Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v3LeLa99gCJSRiLT5KWoxA.text: Amazing food, with huge portions and reasonable prices. And the service was great!! Cece was amazing, and very accommodating! Will be back next time we're in town!

5DIx7mm5YlN584_8sD-0_Q.text: I love coming to this place when in Vegas with my wife.  The food is always amazing.  This time we had Maya as our server.  She was super friendly, and did a great job.  Will certainly come back the next time we are here.

Z4_mopp0I5iH5MKOjlMPcA.text: This is our favorite place for breakfast. The service was amazing!! Our waitress Donna was on point with everything!! And the food is the best in town!We love it here

jzeEk5buL6-wrSd9gpwmpg.text: Very good breakfast visit...Candice was an excellent server & very accommodating. Food was great as always.

8EHNnqx1VxaAeerqCUwLNg.text: Took the family here this morning for breakfast, and we had a pleasant experience. The place was acceptably clean, busy, and the service was friendly and fast. While that was all good and fine, the reason we went there was to eat something delicious, and that was not the case. The food wan either delicious nor horrible.. My bacon and avocado omelet was super salty and had a weird taste which reminded me of a dirty grill. The country potatoes were the size of petite green peas and were a pain to eat. The pancakes were small and didn't taste like anything. The island platter was entertaining, because other than a chunk of pineapple, there was nothing island about it. Steamed white rice....not islandy or delicious at all. The Benedict was well prepared, but again nothing popped out in terms of flavor.  We really wanted this place to be way better and add it to our list of top breakfast places, but that didn't happen. There are lots more places to grab breakfast locally, and we are going to pass on this and keep looking.

L7xVHZ1h_abNOrylK7qbRw.text: I came here for breakfast today while staying in the LV area for a few days. The food here is better than average, and the service is great. My server, Alohalina, was the best! So polite and nice. She's the best!  If I owned a competing restaurant, I'd hire servers like Alohalina.  Nice breakfast!

k5fQ50EvGYdR5OIE9PiBDQ.text: We tried Egg Works for the first time today and we'll definitely be back. Our amazing server, Ashley was amazing right from the start. She brought out these warm and delicious banana nut muffins to start our day.  Her menu suggestions were on point and the food was big and classic American! We live on the strip so Egg Works was a breath of fresh air from the high priced and minimalist breakfast dishes we're used to! Big thanks again to Ashley for making our breakfast so great. She's mine and my wife's favorite server in all of Las Vegas.

Y4TBYozbCrnYptEh7v-ydw.text: Kid friendly, great service, amazing food!!!! What could be better?  Char is the best waitress ever.   We come several times a month.  I love that they do incentives for the school district and other teachers.  My son received a free meal for good grades.  Thanks Egg Works for recognizing him.

3qo-BmLsTiU-3rpfTOc3SQ.text: Just had a WONDERFUL breakfast!!! Jamie was out server, very nice, funny and always attentive to our wants and needs. The food was out of this world!!

3sDMQXsNOBIFjnNz2fgzBg.text: This is one of the worst dining experiences I've had to date. Between the condescending waitress talking down to other staff behind the bar while yelling over people eating, to showing my waitress my hard poached eggs and asking for properly poached eggs only to have her return with a dish for me to shovel them into mid meal so she can prove to the cook they messed up,  to her returning to my table with the soggy running poached eggs I couldn't even finish my meal. Worst corn beef hash ever, pretty sure it was canned, also being told I could ice my own coffee at my table, gross.

XXdjLPv7lWVTn99El4vtcA.text: Pros: Excellent Eggs Benedict. Great ambiance and average prices. Excellent customer service.  Cons: Almost three bucks for coffee and it tastes as though it's very low quality coffee made with unfiltered water.

jIUoYBNCGt3qrg0gKE7xZA.text: We came early Sunday morning and was greeted with a smile. Our server Candice was attentive and energetic! I ordered build your own huevos rancheros and the food was awesome, not to mention the portion was enough to feed two. Great experience this Alaskan Eskimo will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zcHGZ6zqkdA21HHrUu8IWw.text: Feel upon this location thanks to yelp and we were not disappointed. Our server Donna was exceptional and guided us to some great menu options. Loved all of them, but a special call out to the mashed potato omelet...it was almost a religious experience. All four of us (we went with our kids) loves every bite and even took some of their banana nut muffins for the road.

P2iHunSpVhYmXVi_3cLRqw.text: Love the menu combinations here! Stopped in for breakfast while I was having graphics installed on my car. I ordered the Mashed Potatoe Omelet,  Amazing! My server, Matt, let me switch my side to fruit as breakfast potatoes would have been over kill. (I love potatoes,  but there is a limit.) Super tasty omelet and the fruit was fresh cut slices. Not the canned fruit you get in some restaurants.  If you are in the area, and hungry you should stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Works - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed Potato Omelet and fruit.

JeUSCVrZXzJw9wuOLnNB2w.text: We had a great time eating here!!  Donna did a great job serving us!!  The Coney Cini hot dog was great!!  The omelets were huge and stuffed with goodies!!  Very highly recommend this place

U3VSKdjv5qQvcU6-rrrRoA.text: We enjoyed breakfast at Egg works. It's a nice little breakfast/brunch place near LAS airport with "egg'cellent" choices.....Our server Candice was great, she promptly helped us with our vegetarian needs. Don't forget to try their banana-nut muffin and seasoned potatoes. They are super delicious. Highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to catch on breakfast/brunch without parking hassle at the strip..

c1nw5A1KTkuXxWIQlYRPtQ.text: My husband wanted breakfast here. It's titled Egg Works and I expected I don't know fireworks with my eggs maybe... Anyway the eggs are mediocre. They cook everything to order so everything is fresh. However the menu  is huge. You just would assume that they do something unique with the eggs and they don't at all. This place beats IHOP hands down. Home cooking is what you get here. Enough food to feed a small town pilled up on one plate.  Ok I feel a chant coming on are u guys ready...1...2...3! GOOD MEAT GOOD BREAD THANK GOD LETS EAT! hahahahahahah....I give it 4 stars. The bacon was crispy and good. I loved my toast with butter and jelly. They gave me a huge cup of orange juice with ice. I'm in heaven.

5i50Ey_fey60NDsDu5PYBw.text: Stopped by while in Vegas since I had a groupon for this place. The boyfriend got a "4 way" Cincinnati Chili while I had a Hawaiian platter breakfast (2 eggs, sunny side up, Portuguese sausage, 2 scoops of rice, 2 slices of toast, and 1 slice of pineapple). We shared everything - and we also had some spam.  Service was a little slow, but this place seems to get packed rather quickly, so if you go before  9:30AM, it might be a little better. When we got there, there weren't a ton of people, but by the time we sat down and ordered, the crowd started to pour in.  They have a "paging" system much like that of Bubba Gump or other restaurants. Black side of the egg has a happy face on it, denoting that you're OK and do not need assistance. The yellow sad face catches the waiter/waitress' attention and they stop to help you with whatever you may need. Waitresses were very courteous, however, down to the point. Who can blame them though? It got rather busy quickly. No small talk or anything like that, just straight to the point. Not a bad thing, just an observation of what I noticed.   Cincinnati chili, as my boyfriend described it, was "not Skyline, but can pass as Cincinnati chili. More like Dixie chili." Not as watery as Skyline, a bit more flavorful in my opinion (more spices in it). Not as cheesy as Skyline though.  The Hawaiian breakfast platter of course, was good. Well, to be fair, it really is hard to mess up on sunny side up eggs so I'll skip that. They tasted like eggs. The sour dough toast, well, it was sour dough toast - so I'll skip that as well. Not sure what else to write about since everything else on that plate tasted as it should have. I've never quite had an "exceptional" quality Hawaiian breakfast, so... The spam was just spam that was pan fried, no teriyaki sauce marinade. I guess the fact that it tastes like what it's supposed to and looks the way it is supposed to is a plus though. Food tasting like anything other than what it is sometimes odd and could be a bad thing.
